Ruth Esperanza tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en un colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una mecánica automotriz, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Ruth Esperanza trabaja de lunes a sábados un local que venden ramos de flores para toda ocasión, esta en este trabajo desde hace algunos años. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar y para pagar los estudios de sus hijos. 

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres con Decisión comprises 11 women, who engage in various activities to improve their household finances and to support their families. They live in the outlying areas of Cuenca, which is the country's third most important city and a World Heritage Site since December 1999. The city has many places to visit where you can have fun with your family.

Ruth Esperanza has been a member of Mujeres con Decisión for eight years, and, during this time, the communal bank has become family to her. She likes the loans because they improve her financial stability. Ruth Esperanza, 39, is married and has three children, ages 17, 14, and 8, from the relationship. The two oldest children are in high school, and the youngest attends a small school in the city. Her husband is an auto mechanic, and they live in their own house.

For several years, Ruth Esperanza has worked Monday to Saturday in a florist shop, where they sell flowers for all occasions. She will use the loan to buy groceries and to pay for her children's education. Her dream is to be debt free.

loans.use: to buy groceries and to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Kuña Aty 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Caaguazú, 16 mujeres se han unido para trabajar juntas, ayudarse y poder salir adelante por medio del esfuerzo de cada una. Son mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron luchar y poner todo de si para salir adelante.
La Sra. Elida es una de las integrantes, tiene una despensa anexo mercería y cuenta que su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y así poder mejorar su local. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de las capacitaciones vaya mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de artículos de librería ya que su casa y negocio están al lado de una escuela. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
Sixteen women from the city of Caaguazú have joined together to work as a team and help each other out to be able to get ahead by means of their efforts.  They are female heads of household who decided to strive and give their all in order to get ahead.

Elida is one of the members.  She has a grocery store/variety shop and she relates that her dream is to expand the business to improve her locale.  She wants that as time passes and thanks to training her and her family’s lives will gradually improve.

She’s requesting this loan to buy stationery supplies because her house and business are next door to a school and she’ll be able to continue growing in business this way thus providing her family with what they need so they will suffer no wants in life.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Comité Esperanza está en su ciclo número 11  del programa de comité de mujeres, lleva ese nombre, ya que todas las integrantes tienen la esperanza de poder crecer, ayudar a sus familias a que tengan lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ana tiene un pequeño copetín donde vende comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y demás.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de golosinas, bebidas, insumos para hacer comestibles y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y ayudar a su familia por medio de esos ingresos. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group called “Comité Esperanza” (Hope Committee) is in cycle #11 in the women’s committee program.  It carries that name because all the members hope to be able to grow, to help their families to have what they need to have a proper life that’s free of privations.

One of the members is Ana who by means of her effort and non-stop work and the application of behaviors vital for a successful woman, is improving her poverty situation.  Ana has a small snack bar where she sells food, beverages, snacks and others.

She’s asking for this loan to buy snacks, beverages and ingredients to prepare the food and others so that she can continue with her sales and help her family by means of this income.  She’s grateful for this opportunity she and her fellow members are receiving.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft-drinks and food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Medalla Milagrosa está en su Primer Ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y además de eso se están conociendo y aprendiendo a trabajar juntas para poder salir adelante, ya que saben que esa es la clave para poder crecer e ir mejorando.
Una historia digna de destacar es la de la Sra. Elsa, quien por medio de la confección de prendas que hace, está saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que pese a las adversidades esta pudiendo crecer y mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Lucha por salir adelante y día a día ir mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo y también cumplir con varios pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The group called “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) is in its first cycle in the committee program; they all work and are getting to know one another and learning to work together to get ahead because they know that’s the key to be able to grow and to improve.

A story worthy of pointing out is Elsa’s who by means of the clothes she makes is getting ahead.  She’s a very hardworking person who despite adversities is being able to grow and improve her family’s income.  She strives to get ahead and day to day is improving.

She’s asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, adhesives, buttons and others to continue working and filling various orders she has.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Claudia habitante del municipio de Masaya, sus planes a futuro es poder terminar de Construir su casa junto a su esposa trabaja dia a dia para poder cumplir su sueño, ella es comerciante y su esposo es dueño de un taller de Metalurgia, entre los dos se dividin los gastos del hogar, la mayor difucltad que se les presenta es que no pueden recaudar de una sola vez el dinero ya que con los gastos del hogar y los de sus hijo se le es complicadao, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara los siguientes materiales, Zinc, Perlines, Bloques, Cemento, Hierro, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han  brindado.
texts.en: Claudia lives in the city of Masaya. Her plan is to finish building her house. She and her husband work daily to realize this dream. She is a merchant, and her husband owns a metallurgy shop. They share the household expenses. The biggest problem they have is not being able to raise enough money all at once because household expenses and those of their son make it complicated. She will use this loan to buy the following materials: zinc, beams, blocks, cement, iron, and more. She thanks Afodenic and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es: La señora Marina, mujer trabajadora habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hija, su ma yor sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella tra baja para una empresa privada al igual que su esposo, con este nuevo credito que se le ha otorgado comprara Materiales de Cosntrucion para poder aumentar un cuarto mas a su casa ya que  necesita tener mas espacio y mayor seguridad, Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro es parte de los materiales, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado estos años quien en conjunto a Fondo Kiva le  dan la confianza necesaria.
texts.en: Marina’s a hardworking woman living in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and daughter.  Her greatest dream is to be able to finish building her house and improving her living conditions.  She works for a private firm and so does her husband.  With this new loan she’s been granted she will buy building supplies to be able to add another room to her house because she needs more space and greater security.  Some of the materials will be blocks, cement, sand and iron rods.  She is grateful for the support Afodenic along with Kiva funds have given her all these years; they give her the necessary trust.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en: Shahid is a hard-working 27-year-old man who was recently married. He has been running a stationery shop for three years. He requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some more supplies of stationery as his current stock is almost gone. He would also like to add some new items to his shop, such as files and electronic calculators. In this way his sales would increase, as would his net income. As he is living with his wife in a rented house right now, he wants to purchase his own house with the profits he earns.

loans.use: to purchase stationery supplies

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia mayor de edad casada con cuatros hijos menores de edad, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado al norte del occidente del país, Rosa Emilia es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser luchadora, emprendedora y responsable con sus obligaciones ya sea como madre y esposa, ella desde muy temprana edad comenzó a trabajar con su mama en el negocio de fritanga venta de comida tipica de este pais(tortias de carne, gallo pinto, tacos, enchiladas, carne asada, tajadas, entre otros ), donde ella después se independiza y logra colocar un negocio propio porque necesitaba cubrir los gastos familiares actualmente su negocio tiene 7 años, también se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima para el negocio de fritanga como: plátanos, aceite, sal, carne, arroz, debido a que ella ofrece comidas como: cenas, tacos, tajadas, enchiladas, gallo pinto, maduros, entre otros, uno de sus sueños es tener un negocio total de venta de ropa nueva para que no tenga que andar de manera ambulante y que así sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar un carrera profesional algo que ella no puedo hacer, Rosa está muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia is a married adult with four minor children.  She’s from one of the municipalities in Chinandega located in the northwest of the country.  Rosa Emilia’s a woman who is noted for being hardworking, enterprising and responsible with her obligations as a mother and a wife.  She started working at a very young age with her mother in her fried-food business selling traditional dishes from this country (meat pies, ‘gallo pinto,’ tacos, enchiladas, grilled meat, fried plantain, etc.)  Later she became independent and managed to open her own business because she needed to cover her family expenses.  To date, the business is 7-years-old.  She also buys and sells new clothes.

The objective of this loan is to buy the raw materials like bananas, oil, salt, meat and rice she needs for her food because she offers meals like dinners, tacos, fried plantain, enchiladas, ‘gallo pinto,’ and plantain, among others.  One of her dreams is to have a business exclusively dedicated to new clothing sales so she won’t have to continue going from place to place and so her children will have the opportunity of studying a professional career, something she was unable to do. Rosa’s very happy and grateful with the support Kiva lenders offer people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mario Bilomar

texts.es: Don Mario, habitante del barrio la fuente en Managua una zona muy humilde por sus pobladores, es un hombre trabajador, a la par de su esposa intenta  salir adelante con la venta de pan su único medio de ingresos en la familia. Con este crédito que solicita desea realizar la construcción de un cuarto, comprara los materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, esta mejora le vendrá bien para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mario lives in Managua’s La Fuente neighborhood, a zone with very humble residents.  He’s a hardworking man.  Alongside his wife he tries to get ahead selling bread which is his family’s only source of income.  With this loan he’s requesting he wants to build a room.  He will buy the building materials like cement, sand, iron rods, concrete blocks.  This improvement will be very useful for his children’s comfort.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Gelgi De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Gelgi, madre de tres hijos que a como pudo los saco adelante hoy en día son mayores de edad e independientes, su esposo es jubilado, ella tiene una licenciatura en administración, pero se ha dedicado más a la costura por la falta de empleo. En la actualidad tiene pedidos por parte de sus clientes pero no los ha podido realizar por falta de fondos para invertir en materia prima es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar telas y accesorios.
texts.en: Gelgi provided for her now three grown and independent children. Her husband is retired. She holds a college degree in administration, but, for lack of employment, she works mostly as a seamstress. She now has client orders, but she lacks money to buy materials to fill them. So she has applied for a loan to buy fabric and accessories.

loans.use: to buy fabric and accessories.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a married 56 year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. He owns an agricultural tractor with which he performs tasks such as excavating the land to prepare it for cultivation. Today he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to equip his tractor with a water vessel so as to carry out his work properly. Ibrahim intends to enhance his work operations by offering his clients high-quality services in order to satisfy their demands and keep them loyal to him. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to equip his tractor with a water vessel

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del Socorro mayor de edad casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por el comercio, Vicenta es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora en la vida para asi sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles un mejor futuro en la vida siendo unos profesionales ya que lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos ella no pudo culminar sus estudios, gracias a sus esfuerzos y espíritu de superación ella ahora es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: granos básicos, productos congelados, café, sobres de shampoo, salsa de tomates, huevos, sal, pan, leche, frijoles cosidos, fósforos, cigarros, cosméticos, chinería, entre otros productos más, ella compra  en mercados y distribuidores que les ofrecen sus productos en las puertas de su casa, Vicenta tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales da al crédito y al contado, y lo recupera semanal y quincenal, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería y así poder brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes y en un futuro no muy lejanos poder incrementar sus ingresos, Vicenta agradece la oportunidad que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Vicenta del Socorro is a married adult with three adult children.  She’s from the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country, a zone noted for commerce.  Vicenta’s a very hardworking woman who strives in life to move her children forward and to give them a better future in life as professionals since due to lack of resources she herself was unable to finish her schooling.

Thanks to her efforts and drive for self-improvement, she now owns a grocery store located at home where she sells all types of products like basic grains, frozen goods, coffee, envelopes of shampoo, tomato sauce, eggs, salt, bread, milk, cooked beans, matches, cigarettes, cosmetics and low-cost novelty items, among others.  She buys in markets and from suppliers who bring their products to her doorstep.  Vicenta has regular and drop-in customers who she sells to for cash and on credit; she collects weekly and biweekly.

The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital to stock the grocery store and provide better customer service so that in the not too distant future her income will increase.  Vicenta is grateful for the opportunity Kiva lenders give people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vilfredo

texts.es: Vilfredo de 38 años de edad, habita con su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, en las edades de 8 a 14 años en el suroccidente de la ciudad. Desde muy joven ha trabajado vendiendo artículos varios, como aguacates y también en tareas de albañilería. Actividades con las que ha logrado ahorrar para consolidar su hoy negocio de ventas de mercancías variadas, las cuales ofrece mediante créditos desde los lunes hasta los sábados, en jornadas laborales que inician desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza de contado en el municipio de Maicao y en la ciudad de Barranquilla, para luego ofrecerlos a una clientela que ha organizado desde el año 2001, época en la cual inició su negocio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa y alimentos para vender como pescado y aguacates. Con esta inversión aspira a incrementar sus ventas, pues su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio ¿y que mejor que trabajar con disciplina de ahorro, para lograrlo?
texts.en:
Vilfredo, 38, lives with his family, which comprises his wife and three children between the ages of 8 and 14, in the southwest part of the city. From an early age, he has sold a variety of items and also worked as a bricklayer. He managed to save to open his own business, selling an assortment of merchandise, and he offers credit to customers. He is open Monday to Saturday from 8 AM until 7 PM. He purchases the merchandise in the cities of  Maicao and Barranquilla to resell to a customer base that he has built since 2001, when he started his business.  

He has applied for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy clothing and food items such as seafood and avocados. He expects the investment to increase sales, and his goal is to have his own shop. What could be better than working and saving to achieve that?

loans.use: to buy clothing and food items such as seafood and avocados to sell.

loans.name: Jeannette Del Carmen

texts.es: Jeannette del Carmen, mayor de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad originaria de Chinandega, es una microempresaria que tiene una pulpería en su casa en la cual vende granos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, productos congelados, detergentes, ropa de niños, chinería y otros, también tiene una sorbeteria en su casa de habitación donde tiene alta demanda de sus clientes  aún más en estas fechas festivas, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de sus pulpería y más aun en la sorbeteria como: conos de todo tamaños, tazas, cucharas, servilletas, entre otros para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes en este tipo de producto.Jeannette agradece mucho a los inversionistas kivas por el apoyo que ellos les brindan a personas de bajos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Jeannette del Carmen is a married adult with three minor children.  She’s from Chinandega and is a micro businesswoman who owns a home-based grocery store where she sells basic grains like rice, sugar, oil, frozen goods, detergent, children’s clothes, low-cost novelty items and others.  She also has a home-based ice-cream shop where demand is high especially during these festive times.  

The objective of this loan is for working capital to buy products for the grocery store and even more so for the ice-cream shop like cones in all sizes, cups, spoons and napkins, among others to fill customer needs in this type of product.  Jeannette is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Sol Marina

texts.es: Sol de 65 años, vende productos mediante guía especializadas desde el año 2010, cuando aprovechando su experiencia como empleada comercial, una compañera de trabajo le propuso vender artículos mediante catálogos, tal como su amiga lo hacia. Sol Entonces, inició su negocio y desde hace dos años, no se ha detenido. Los principales productos de su oferta, son los productos de belleza y productos de tocador, que ofrece mediante una venta directa a una clientela de vecinos, familiares y referidos, que trabajan en empresas. Su meta es continuar incrementando sus ingresos, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, para comprar en mayor volumen; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara: cosméticos, productos capilares, entre otros. Su meta mas adelante es abrir mas adelante un local  y crecer mucho mas, para generar nuevos ingresos que beneficien a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sol, 65, has been selling products via catalog since 2010 when taking advantage of her experience as a commercial employee a fellow worker proposed that she start selling items via catalog like her girlfriend was doing.  Sol then started her own business two years ago and hasn’t stopped since.  

The main things she sells are beauty products and toiletries that she sells directly to a clientele consisting of neighbors, family members and referred people who are employees in firms.  Her goal is to continue increasing her income but her working capital is insufficient to buy larger amounts which is why she’s asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo by means of which she’ll buy cosmetics and hair products among others.  Her goal for later on is to open a storefront and to grow much more to generate new income that will benefit her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair products, among others.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a 35-year-old married woman. She is from Lebanon, and lives with her husband and four children, three of whom are still attending school. 

She owns a shop where she sells different types of clothes. Imane cooperates financially with her husband to pay the high costs of living. 

With her requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will increase her inventory by augmenting the variety of clothing she has, so she can increase her sales and therefore, her income. 

She is certain the loan will help her boost her revenue by a large percentage; in the future she plans to also sell shoes from her shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by widening the variety of clothes she can sell.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, age 44, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers sheltering (construction) services. 

Parveen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron (metal) sheets for his business. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Parveen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron (metal) sheets for her husband's sheltering business.

loans.name: Parsaloi

texts.en:
Parsaloi has successfully paid off his previous loan owing to a good harvest season. He has continued to educate his children with the proceeds attained.

Parsaloi has been issued a second loan of 40,000 KES, which he will use to put up a large storehouse for storing up his produce and also to buy farm inputs. This will fetch him better proceeds because the maize demand will be higher and the supply will be less beyond the season.

His dream is to grow his farming business into a commercial outlet.

loans.use: to put up a large storehouse for his produce and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Alfatmia Group

texts.en:
This group is called ALFATMIA, and is made up of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. The group applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Randa is a 36-year-old married woman who has four children. She sells different items such as clothing, incense, etc. She started her business with goods she took on credit from merchants. Randa tries hard to improve her living conditions. 

She intends to expand her business and increase her profit, so she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy clothing, incense, etc.. 

All the members of the group thank Kiva lenders for financing them the first time.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing, incense, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Zhanetta

texts.en:
Zhanetta is from Armavir town, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and daughter Qnarik. 

Zhanneta is a cook at one of the city's restaurants. Together with her husband, she works hard to sustain the family. Their daughter, Qnarik, studies at Armavir State Industrial-Pedagogical College. She is very hardworking young lady with prosperous future goals. Unfortunately Zhanetta's monthly income is barely enough to make ends meet, and she isn't able to save money for Qnarik's education. So, with a good credit history behind her, Zhanetta has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

The loan is very important for the whole family. Zhanetta dreams of seeing her daughter with an educational background, and does her best to ensure a good future for Qnarik.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for her daughter.

loans.name: Karei

texts.en:
Karei is a 60-year-old gentleman, married, and supporting a family of 14. He is a livestock trader, and has been in the business for the last twenty years making a monthly income of KES. 15,000

Karei learned about KADET LTD from fellow livestock traders who are already registered, and are being funded by KADET LTD.  He has acquired his first loan of KES. 30,000, which will enable him acquired more livestock to sell.  He will use the proceeds to meet the family's basic needs.

He plans to diversify into crop farming. He hopes to improve the living standard for his large family, as well as put up a permanent house for them.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 31-year-old single man, living with one parent. He has owned a toy shop since 2010 where he sells a wide range of toys designed for different ages. 

Today, he is in need of a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to purchase additional toys for his shop, to be able to satisfy his customers' demands and, therefore, earn higher income. 

This is Moussa's first Kiva loan and he is very optimistic about what he will attain monetarily, after getting it. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase its capital.

loans.use: to purchase additional toys for his shop.

loans.name: Deisy Leonor

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Deisy, tiene 49 años de edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos de 24, 19 y 18 años, todos viven con ella los menores estudian en universidad. 

Doña Deisy es una gran madre que para ganarse la vida y la de sus hijos después de que se separo puso un negocio de internet en su casa, allí también vende útiles escolares, helados, sodas y bocadillos de picar, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00. Tiene muchos clientes como por ejemplo los estudiantes que llegan  a hacer consultas o trabajos en las maquinas, lleva más de tres años con este negocio y poco a poco lo ha ido ampliando, empezó con el servicio de internet y ahora tiene una papelería bien surtida.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar útiles escolares ya que es lo que más se vende en esta época del año. Lleva casi dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez aumenta más su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
Picoaza appears in the books as one of the aboriginal towns that’s part of the Manta culture.  This urban parish is located just ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manta.  The “María Asunción” communal bank meets here every fifteen days.

Deisy, 49, lives here.  She’s separated and has three children who are 24, 19 and 18 years of age; all of them live with her and the younger ones attend university.

Deisy’s a great mother who in order to earn a livelihood and support her children after she separated opened an Internet business at home.  She also sells school supplies, ice-cream, sodas and snacks to nosh on there.  She works every day from 8am until 9pm.  She has many customers like students for example that come by to do research or homework on the machines.  She’s been in business for more than three years and it’s gradually been growing.  She started out with the Internet service and now she has a well-stocked stationery shop.

She will use this loan to buy school supplies because that’s what sells best during this time of the year.  She’s been in the communal bank for almost two years and she likes it because her business grows more with each loan.  Her dream is to continue forward in life and in business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hard-working 52-year-old lady, married and a mother of five children. She has been operating a grocery store for the last six years, making a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She learned about KADET LTD from a marketing campaign that was carried out in the village center where her business is located.

Mary has acquired a fourth loan of 50,000 KES, which she will use to put up shelves in her open store, as well as to add to her grocery stock. Her profits will be used to meet her family's basic needs.

She hopes to expand the business into a very profitable venture.

loans.use: to put up shelves in her store and add to her grocery stock

loans.name: Nola Asunción

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Nola, tiene 61 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esa relación tienen cinco hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, una hija  vive con ella en su casa con sus hijos pequeños. 

Doña Nola para salir adelante y para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar se dedica al comercio, ella tienen un deposito en su casa  en el cual vende aguas, colas, cervezas, al por mayor y al menudeo como lo quieran sus clientes, allí también vende  gas de uso domestico ya que el gas tiene mucha salida porque es ella la única que vende gas por el sector. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. 

Este crédito es para comprar gas de uso domestico ya que no tiene mucho y le hace falta para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientes. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Picoaza appears in the books as one of the aboriginal towns that’s part of the Manta culture.  This urban parish is located just ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manta.  The “María Asunción” communal bank meets here every fifteen days.


Nola, 61, lives here.  Her husband died several years ago and she was left widowed but her marriage produced five children who are all adults now; one of her daughters and her little children live with her at home still.

In order to get ahead and to cover household expenses, Nola works in commerce.  She has a depository where she sells water, sodas and beer at wholesale and retail according to her customers’ wishes.  She also sells domestic use gas which sells very well because she’s the only gas seller in the sector.  She works every day with her daughter’s help.

This loan is to buy gas for domestic use because she doesn’t have much left and needs more to meet customer need.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and likes it because of the help they give her with loans to get ahead.  Her dream is to continue working in her business.

loans.use: to buy gas for home use.

loans.name: Karina Yoconda

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la  señora Karina, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 21, 14 y 7 años de edad,  todos viven en su casa y estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela, su marido es chofer.

Doña Karina además de ser una gran madre y esposa se dedica a la comercio, ella tiene un local  en su casa en el cual vende agua en bidón, sodas, jugos y otras bebidas, ella además de vender en su local también entrega a domicilio estos productos, pues cuenta con un carro en el cual realiza sus entregas, algunas veces le ayuda uno de sus hijos y otras veces trabaja sola. Lleva 7 años dedicada a esta actividad  con lo cual se gana sus propios ingresos que le sirven para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar agua en bidón, sodas y jugos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 11 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Picoaza appears in the books as one of the aboriginal towns that’s part of the Manta culture.  This urban parish is located just ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manta.  The “María Asunción” communal bank meets here every fifteen days.

Karina, 41, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 21, 14 and 7 years of age; all live at home and attend university, secondary and primary school.  Her husband’s a driver.

In addition to being a great wife and mother, Karina is a merchant.  She has a shop at home where she sells water in large bottles, soft-drinks and other beverages.  In addition to selling in her shop she also home delivers these products since she has a car she does her deliveries in.  sometimes one of her children help her and sometimes she works alone.  She’s been in this business seven years and earns her own income this way that is useful for her to pay her children’s schooling.

This loan is to buy water in large containers, soft-drinks and juices.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 11 years and likes it because of the help they give her to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy large jugs of water, soft-drinks and juices.

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en:
Ma. Bella is a 46-year-old, married woman, from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 25, while the youngest is 18. 

Ma. Bella runs a store in her community and sells basic commodities, like sugar, coffee, soap, biscuits, seasonings, and toiletries. She requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy soft drinks and to expand the diversity of items in her store. 

In the future, Ma. Bella would like to improve her retail store business, to provide her family with balanced diets and quality education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and to expand the diversity of items in her store.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 28-year-old, hard-working gentleman, married to a salonist. He is a father of a six-month-old baby. 

Gabriel operates a mobile phone shop that deals with the sale of accessories, as well as money transfer services. He earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

Gabriel learned about Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) from his wife's client, who is registered and is being funded by KADET. 

Gabriel has acquired his first loan of KES 70,000 which will facilitate the purchase of mobile phone accessories as well increase the float amount for the money transfer service.

The proceeds will be reinvested for the expansion of the business. Gabriel's dream is to open several phone shops in Narok town.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora  Ana, tiene 57 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, ninguno de sus hijos vive con ella, solo un nieto que es como su propio hijo, tiene 14 años y estudia en colegio. Su marido es taxista.

Doña Ana tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas y venta de comidas rápidas, tiene su negocio desde hace tres años y le ha ido bien ya que en el sector es la única cabina telefónica y muchas personas acuden a su local, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 23h00, trabaja sola y comparte su tiempo de trabajo con los del hogar ya que su negocio está en su casa, actualmente también está vendiendo útiles escolares para así aprovechar la época de entrada a clases que es cuando más se venden estos productos.

Este crédito es para surtir más su negocio de útiles escolares para servir mejor a sus clientes. Lleva más de 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes en su vida y su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante mejorando más su negocio.
texts.en:
Picoaza appears in the books as one of the aboriginal towns that’s part of the Manta culture.  This urban parish is located just ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí.  The “María Asunción” communal bank meets here every fifteen days.

Ana, 57, lives here. She’s in a common law relationship and has seven adult children; none of them still live with her, only a 14-year-old grandson attending secondary school.  Her husband’s a taxi driver.

Ana has a business consisting of telephone booths and fast-food sales.  She’s had it for three years and she’s done well because hers are the only phone booths in the sector and many people come to her shop.  She works every day from 8am until 11pm.  She works alone and shares her work time with her home because her business is located in her house.  She’s also now selling school supplies to take advantage of the start of school season which is when these products sell the most.

This loan is to stock her business with school supplies to provide better customer service.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 11 years and likes it because the loans are very important in her life and in her business.  Her dream is to continue improving her business more.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Dominique Marie Flore

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 41 ans mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomates et autres) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 9 ans. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du tempsEgrâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de cajots de tomate pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 41-year-old woman, a mother, and a merchant who sells fresh staple foods retail (tomatoes and more) according to the season. She has been doing so for nine years at a local market. She is very familiar with suppliers and especially with her customer base, which she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself facing inventory shortages, since she has to sell her inventory in order to get more, due to her meager capital. She would like to increase her inventory of crates of tomatoes to have plenty, enabling her to satisfy further the constant customer demand and to avoid shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase crates of tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer and a printer

loans.name: Rose Lom Group

texts.en:
Nenglhing sells piglets and generates income for the family.  She belongs to “Rose Lom Group” and she is pictured with her hand raised. She is also the featured borrower of the group. Nenglhing subjugates all the challenges one can endure. She has seven kids and lives with her aged in-laws. Her husband earns a living as a sweeper in a military camp with a small regular monthly income.  To manage the family finances with only her husband's income was a big challenge. Debts were piling up while she was trying to look after the kids and the in-laws. School fees, medicinal cost for the in-laws and household maintenance expenses were all borne by only her husband income.

Nenglhing started raising piglets and slowly developed her piglet-selling business.  She is making rapid progress in her business. She usually travels across the neighboring provinces in the state and purchases piglets. The piglets are then sold in her village and the neighboring villages at a profit. She said, since each house raises pigs, selling piglets is not complicated and instead entices her to do better.  The most challenging part of her business is transportation. The public transport is the most convenient option but the passengers sometimes complain. In order not to disturb others, a private vehicle is hired to transport the piglets. The cost is high but that is the only option left for the piglet transportation. She keeps them in the pigsty at the back of her house and does the selling.

She and her husband work side by side to manage the household expenses.  With her financial assistance, the family is now able to pay back the previous debts.  She wants all of her seven kids to get an education because she was deprived of a good education in her childhood days. The family financial conditions did not allow her to pursue further studies and she ended up with a mere primary education.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more piglets to sell and meet the demands of her customers. She is also planning to provide her customers with a credit facility if she can successfully avail the loan.  She thanks Kiva and WSDS for the undeniable support and love. She wishes them great success and prosperity. The rest of the group members are engaged in piggery, weaving and vegetable-selling businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to sell

loans.name: Ngnonbouwo

texts.fr: Ngnonbouwo est un de 57ans, marié père de famille .Il a un petit secrétariat, sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse alors il sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa structure en ajoutant les ordinateurs et une imprimante pour pouvoir la satisfaire et augmenter sa production. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront non seulement d'ajouter le petit matériel bureautique, mais aussi aux besoins quotidiens et surtout une partie de la scolarisation de leurs enfants
texts.en: Ngnonbouwo is 57 years old, married, and a father. He has a small business providing office services. His customer base is becoming larger and larger, so he is requesting a loan to expand his business by adding computers and a printer in order to satisfy his customers and increase production. The profits earned from this loan will enable him no only to add various supplies and office equipment but also to [cover] day-to-day needs and especially the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a printer for his business

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 61-year-old, married man, living with his wife and four children. He is from Lebanon. 

Despite his older age, Abdallah is still working, so as to earn a good income and be able to satisfy his family’s needs. He has owned a restaurant since 2009 and also has more than 30 years of experience working in this domain. Abdallah serves his customers delicious food plates and sandwiches. 

Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to purchase an electrical generator for his business. He states that the loan will positively impact upon his work and he is sure that his sales and revenues will be augmented. 

In the future, Abdallah plans to open a new branch of his restaurant in another area.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator for his restaurant business.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad, age 53, lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns a computer accessories shop. Shamshad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase computer accessories for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Shamshad hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Anis

texts.en: Anis is a 53-year-old Lebanese single man. He has been working as a car mechanic since 1989. His job is specialized in car electrical repairs. With his loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will purchase mechanical tools and supplies with which he intends to improve his repair services and, therefore, meet his customer’s needs. He is very optimistic and confident that the loan will allow him to gain more customers and make more money. Anis took advantage of previous Kiva loans and we note that he was a very good client with payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken expanded his business, and now he has three employees.

Ken wishes to enter into the transport business. He is seeking a loan of 52,300 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorbike. He wants to diversify his income and own a car-hire service as part of his business. Ken heard of Milango through friends, and he immediately joined.

This loan will enable him to realize his dream and have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Dulce Sonrisa Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Sonia mujer de 56 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos, tiene su negocio de venta de comida en una zona franca del departamento de Masaya, de estar en esta actividad tiene 4 años consecutivos, en la institución tiene más de un año, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, repollo, vinagre, plátanos, platos descartables, cucharas descartables, etc. Alejandra tiene 49 años de edad su negocio es la venta de pollo y Miriam tiene 56 años de edad su negocio es la venta de caramelo, café servido etc.
texts.en:
This group consists of three entrepreneurial members. One is Sonia, 56 years old and married with two children. She has run a business selling food in a free trade zone in Masaya Department for four straight years. Sonia has been with the institution for over a year. She will use the loan to purchase staple items such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, chiltomas, onions, tomatoes, cabbage, vinegar, bananas, disposable plates and spoons, etc. 

Alejandra is 49 and runs a business selling chicken. Miriam is 56 and runs a business selling candy, coffee by the cup, etc.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of staple items such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, chiltomas [sweet peppers], onions, tomatoes, cabbage, vinegar, bananas, disposable plates and spoons, etc.

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Doric, who is in her early forties, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been running a grocery store since 2011. She works from 12:00 noon to 11:00 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Doric's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the grocery stock by buying more beer, soda, water and spirits, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the grocery store.  Her dream is to one day be able to own a poultry business.

Doric will share this loan with her loan group "Mango", with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the grocery store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica  a la crianza de gallina ponedora (producción de huevos) desde hace 2 años sus productos los vende en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clienta pues sus productos los vende a buen precio con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Daniel solicita un crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios como concentrado, profilaxis de gallina ponedora, vitaminas, etc.  ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He has raised laying hens (for egg production) for two years. He sells his products at markets near his home and has many customers because he sells at good prices. With the money he earns, Daniel is able to meet his household expenses. 

He is seeking a loan to buy essential supplies such as feed and preventive medicine for his laying hens, vitamins, etc. Raising hens is Daniel's only source of work and this loan will allow him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and preventive medicine for laying hens, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Nazibrola

texts.en:
Nazibrola is 51 years old. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with her 31-year-old son David, daughter in-law and two grandchildren (4 and 6 years old). Nazibrola requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions.
 
Nazibrola owns an internet café and David is working at the local water company. Nazibrola’s daughter in law is a seller at the clothes shop. They all work on small monthly salaries.
 
Nazibrola requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Nazibrola has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Nazibrola will purchase more computers for her internet café. As not everybody has internet in their houses, people go to the internet café to use the service. Nazibrola is planning to expand her business. After purchasing more computers, she will be able to serve more people and earn better profit. With the increased profit, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more computers for her internet café

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children from Talibon, Bohol. The oldest child is 14 while the youngest is 6. She engages in seaweed farming. She has been into seaweed farming for 10 years. Her husband is a fisherman. His catch can generate income and is also used for family consumption. 

Julie requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy materials like straw, seaweed seedlings, and tissue for the seaweed to grow fast and generate more harvest, and so they can be sold on time. 

In the future Julie would like to invest in another business to support her family as well as to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials like straw, seaweed seedlings, and tissue.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина умная женщина, которая очень успешно размещает учебу с семьёй. Она замужем на доброго человека и на воспитании имеет 1 сына, которому 2 года. Зарина после окончания школы поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Она учится в 3 курсе. Она любит все предметы и активно участвует во всех лекциях и семинаров. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но ее муж не имеет денег для оплаты ее учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarina is a bright woman who is combining her studies with family very successfully. She has a good husband and is raising one two year-old son. After graduating from high school, Zarina entered the Tajikistan State University of Business and Politics. A third-year student, she loves all subjects and actively participates in all lectures and seminars. She needs to pay for her tuition, but her husband cannot afford it. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 34 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Мухаббат более чем 15 лет работает в средней школе. Она работает учительницей младших классов. Полученную зарплату она использует для обеспечения семьи, так как ее муж мастер по стройки домов и не имеет большой доход. Она хочет улучшить условию проживания, путем покупки мебели и техники, так как она не имеет современную мебель и технику. Она хочет купить стенку для гостиной, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки мебели. Она надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhabbat is 34 years old. She is married and is raising two children. For more than 15 years, Muhabbat has been working in a middle school. She works as a teacher for younger classes. She uses her salary to pay for her family's expenses, because her husband is a house builder and does not have a high income. She hopes to improve her quality of life by purchasing furniture and electronics, as she does not have modern furniture and electronics. She hopes to buy a wall for the living room, but she does not have the money to do so. She has asked for a loan of 2,000 somons for the purchase of furniture. She is hoping to rely on your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Joselinda

texts.en: Joselinda is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Getafe, Bohol. She has two children who are 10 and 11 years old respectively and has earned a living by operating a sari-sari (or variety) store for the last four years. She sells items such as biscuits, bread, candies, mangoes and various other items. Joselinda is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy items to sell to her customers and to attract more customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business so that she can build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
60-year-old Marina lives in Tskaltubo district with her son Aleksandre. Marina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.  The only source of the income for the family is from trading. Marina is buying clothes from the big market in the capital city at the wholesale price, brings it to her district and sells with the price markup among the villagers.
 
Marina requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Marina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Marina will purchase more stock of clothes for trading. She will have better choice to offer to her clients to better satisfy their needs. This will significantly increase the number of clients she has. She will have more clients and have better income. Marina will use part of the profit for reinvesting in the same field in order to expand her business, and another part she will use for her family's well being.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for her trading business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old and an industrious gentleman. He is married to Judith, who is a farmer, and is the father of three children ages five, two years, and five months respectively. He learned about KADET LTD from a colleague.

Samuel has been in the transport industry for the last four years, making a monthly income of KES. 9,000. He has successfully paid off his first loan and is applying for a second loan. He will use the funds to repair and service his motorcycle. 

He will use the proceeds to put up a poultry farm. His dream is to raise a highly educated family.

loans.use: to repair his broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Esther Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Esther forma parte del banco comunal Los Talvos desde hace 8 años, tiempo en el que los créditos le han permitido mejorar y crecer en su pequeño negocio, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar goza de un clima frió, está rodeado de varias montañas y hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora, se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y al comercio.

La Señora Esther tiene 27 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo  de 5 años de edad y está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja  como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Esther pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa realizando los quehaceres de su hogar, pero para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar trabaja en las tareas del campo, cría y vende cerdos y gallinas, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar. Ella es una profesional en la rama de la costura y también se va a dedicar de esto. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir el pago de la entrada de una máquina de coser y comprar material para la costura, asi va a dar el primer paso para comenzar con un pequeño taller en su casa. 


Su meta es tener un taller con operarios en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esther is part of a communal bank called Los Talvos, and has been, for the past 8 years. During this time, the credits she has received have helped her to improve and grow her small business. She lives in the area around the parish of Cuenca Valley. This area enjoys a cool climate and is surrounded by mountains as well as beautiful landscapes; the people here are friendly, gentle and hard working. They work in agriculture, raising animals and commercial activities. 

Mrs. Esther is 27 years old, married and has one child from this union who is 5 years old who is studying in the small school in his neighborhood. Her husband works as a bricklayer, they don't have their own home, and so, they live in their parents' home with whom they share the household costs. 

Mrs. Esther spend the majority of her time in home doing domestic chores, but in order to help her husband with household costs, she also works in the fields, raising and selling pigs and chickens. She also works in agriculture and what she grows is for her family's personal consumption. She is also a professional seamstress and also works in this area. 

This new credit will in invested in a down payment on a sewing machine and to purchase sewing material so she can take the first steps to starting her own small workshop in her home. 

Her goal is to have her own workshop and operations in her house.

loans.use: with a down payment on a sewing machine and to purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Konstantine

texts.en:
Konstantine is 31 years old and lives in Tbilisi with his parents, three brothers and grandmother, who receives a retirement pension. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. He works as a gardener and his father is a driver, and they both earn a small monthly income. There is hardly enough on food for the family. According to Credo estimates the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Konstantine is requesting a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup credits with easy terms to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These people are regarded as high-risk borrowers because of their low income. With his credit Konstantine will buy a car and work as a taxi driver. He will continue working as a gardener every third day and drive the taxi on the other two. The new business initiative will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Carmen Mercedes

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16 y 3 años y un bebé de 7 meses de nacido, el mayor estudia en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
 
Doña Carmen es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar  se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos los  días unas  dos a tres horas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad por lo cual tiene buena clientela que siempre le compran sus productos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Picoazá is listed in the books as one of the aboriginal villages of the Manteño-Huancavilca culture. This urban parish is located only ten minutes away from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabí Province. Here the members of the communal bank "María Asunción" gather every fifteen days. 

In this place there lives Carmen. She is 40 years old and married, and from this relationship she has three children: two children aged 3 and 16, and a 7-month-old baby. The oldest is attending high school. The husband is a tradesman. 

Carmen is a housewife, who in order to earn her own income to help her husband with house expenses, sells clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, women's' accessories) by catalog sales. She sells door-to-door. She works every day for some two to three hours. She sells her products on credit and collects every eight days. She has been doing this activity for 15 years which is why she has a good clientele who always buys her products.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing. This is her fifth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.
 
Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Dovya Group

texts.en:
Zaituni, who is in her mid-thirties, is married with four children who are still going to school. She has been running two businesses, selling fruits, vegetables and charcoal for ten years now.  She works from 9:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zaituni's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock and increase the fruits and vegetables. She started selling firewood and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, cover household expenses and has almost finished building her house. She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to resell.

Zaituni will share this loan with her loan group, "Dovya", with 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and firewood to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 31-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 10, while the youngest is 3. 

Jocelyn grows rice. She works hard to earn a living. She has been growing rice for more than ten years now. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy medicines, fertilizers and more rice seedlings, to yield a larger harvest and an increase in sales. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her business to improve their livelihood status and also to be successful in her farming business.

loans.use: to buy medicines, fertilizers and more rice seedlings.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old, married to Oduol, a mechanic, and supports a family of five. A tailor in the town of Bomet, Jane has been in business for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

Jane learnt about KADET LTD from one of her regular clients, a registered member who is being funded by KADET LTD. She has requested her first loan of KES. 20,000 which will help her to acquire fabrics, threads and other materials required for dressmaking. The proceeds will be used for business expansion.

Jane's dream is to grow her business to a profitable level and educate her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads for dressmaking

loans.name: Aisuluv

texts.ru: Айсулув очень скромная, спокойная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем. Ей 23 года. У нее двое детей - сыну 1 год и дочери 3 года. Она со своей семьей проживает в Яванском районе. В течение 3-х лет Айсулув вместе с мужем работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Айсулув нравится ее работа, так как она зарабатывает честным трудом. Она научилась земледелию еще в детстве, когда помогала родителям. Айсулув выращивает в основном пшеницу, овощи и бахчевую культуру. Кредит запрашивает для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая помидора, огурцов, арбуза и дыни. У Айсулув новопостроенный дом. За счет прибыли с продажи урожая она хочет провести ремонт в доме и приобрести домашние принадлежности.
texts.en: Aisuluv is a very modest, quiet, and hardworking woman. She is 23 years old, married and has two children--a son who is one and a daughter who is three. She and her family live in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. For three years she has worked with her husband on a farm. Aisuluv likes her work since she earns an honest living. She learned farming at an early age while helping her parents. She mostly grows wheat, vegetables melons and gourds. She is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for her harvest of tomatoes, cucumbers, watermelons and other melons. Aisuluv has a newly built home. She wants to use her new profits to make finishing touches to it and to buy home accessories.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for her harvest of tomatoes, cucumbers

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Narcisa forma parte del banco comunal Los Talvos desde hace 2 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a conocer más a sus amigas y compartir gratos momentos, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar goza de un clima frió, está rodeado de varias montañas y hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora, se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y al comercio.

La Señora Narcisa tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltara de 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa  en la que viven es propia.

Doña Narcisa trabaja como empleada domestica desde hace algún tiempo, le va muy bien en este trabajo y espera continuar así. En su casa a más de dedicarse sus hijos también cría y vende cuyes y cerdos. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para animales, cuyes y cerdos. 

Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio de animales.
texts.en:
Narcisa has been a part of the Los Talvos communal bank for 2 years. During that time she has gotten to know her friends more and shared good times with them. She lives in the outskirts of the Valley of Cuenca. This place has a cool climate and is surrounded by different mountains and beautiful landscapes. Its people are friendly and hardworking. They work in farming, raising animals and in commerce.

Narcisa is 32 years old. She is the single mother of 2 children, aged 15 and 10. Her oldest son goes to high school and her daughter is going to a local elementary school. She owns the house they live in.

Narcisa has worked as a maid for some time. It is going well for her at this job and she hopes to continue doing it. At home in addition to caring for her children, she raises and sells guinea pigs and pigs.

She will use the money from the loan to invest in buying feed for the animals, as well as guinea pigs and pigs. 

Her goal is to continue growing in her animal business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals as well as guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 42 years old. He lives in a small village, Tsereteli, in Marneuli district, with his 41-year-old wife, Tsiala, and two sons. Zurab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Zurab is an artisan. He is working on construction for private orders. Zurab earns a small monthly salary, which is the only source of the income for the family. 

Zurab requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Zurab will purchase a milk cow. Zurab’s wife, Tsiala, will be milking the cow every day to produce dairy products. The family will be selling the products at the local market and among the villagers to earn additional income. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Fuzuli refugee. Aynur has been raising cattle for the past 5 years. She says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort, but her husband helps her to raise the cattle, fatten them and sell them in the market. 

Aynur usually buys cattle, raises them, fattens them and sells them in the central bazaar. Her monthly income of 150 AZ is the only source of income for her family. She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into her family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan, due to its large use in everyday meals.

She is applying for a loan of 1800 AZN in order to buy more calves. This is going to be her first loan with Aqroinvest. She believes this loan will have a positive impact in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Sandra está realizando su sexto crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal Los Talvos, le gusta el banco comunal porque en cada reunión conversa con sus amigas de varios temas de su interés. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar goza de un clima frió, está rodeado de varias montañas y hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable, gentil y trabajadora, se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y al comercio.

La Señora Sandra tiene 21 años, es casada y esta por tener a su primer hijo. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en un taller que es de su propiedad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros y comparten los gastos de la casa.

Doña Sandra es profesional en la costura y tiene en un pequeño taller en el que trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. También cría y vende gallinas y cerdos. 

Su crédito va a invertir en el pago una letra de una máquina de coser que adquirió y comprar material para la costura. 

Su meta es agrandar su taller.
texts.en:
Sandra is getting her sixth loan alongside her friends and companions from the Los Talvos communal bank. She likes the communal bank because at each meeting she chats with her friends about various interesting topics. She lives in the area surrounding the parish of Valle en Cuenca. This place enjoys a cool climate and is surrounded by several mountains and beautiful landscape. Its people are friendly, kind and hard-working and they work in agriculture, raising livestock and trade. 

Sandra is 21 years old, married and is going to have her first child. Her husband is a mechanic and works in a workshop which is his own property. He does not have his own house and so lives at home with his parents-in-law and shares in the household expenses. 

Sandra is a professional seamstress and has a little workshop where she works from Monday to Saturday with no fixed timetable. She also raises chickens and pigs. 

She will invest her loan in paying the installment for a sewing machine that she acquired, and to buy material for sewing. Her goal is to enlarge her workshop.

loans.use: to pay the installment for a sewing machine and to buy material for sewing.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is a petty trader who sells local rice at Ve-Agbome, Hohoe market and its surrounding villages. Ellen has received formal education but only to middle school because of financial constraints. She is married with 4 children. Her husband is a peasant farmer. Ellen has been into petty trading for the past 2 years, and she helps her husband with the household finances. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of unprocessed rice from the local farmers in order to make more profit. She hopes to save and use the new profits from her business to enhance her working capital.

loans.use: to buy more bags of unprocessed rice from the local farmers

loans.name: Peacock Group

texts.en:
Epimack, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two daughters who are still going to school. He has had two businesses, a retail shop and a charcoal business, for five years now. He works from 8:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Epimack's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock the missing items in his shop's inventory, and to start his business of selling charcoal. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to renovate his house, pay school fees and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. He dreams of expanding his business.

Epimack will share this loan with his loan group, "Peacock," which has ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Joelito

texts.en:
Joelito is a 45-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has seven children. The oldest child is 24, while the youngest is 2. He is engaged in seaweed farming. He grows seaweed. Aside from seaweed farming, Joelito also engages in fishing. He sells fish, crabs and clams. He has been into fishing for more than ten years now. 

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy straw and additional seaweed seedlings to improve the production of seaweed. 

In the future, Joelito would like to invest in other businesses to improve their livelihood status and also to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy straw and additional seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
