En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 18, 17, 16, 12, 8 y 6 años de edad, los  mayores estudian en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña María es una muy buena  ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos de plástico como platos, vasos, fundas, etc. trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esta hora del día es más fresco y puede realizar mejor sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Lleva más de dos años en este negocio y le va muy bien, con sus ganancias ella puede ayudar a que sus hijos puedan salir adelante en sus estudios ya que con lo que el marido gana no les alcanza para esto.

Este crédito es para comprar platos, sillas, vasos, baldes, entre otras cosas. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado tanto la institución como sus compañeras. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada communal bank meets every 15 days in the La Sequita parish in Montecristi.  The canton is known for its famous straw hats that are valued in and outside of the country.

This is where María, age 36, lives.  She is married, and they have six children, ages, 18, 17, 16, 12, 8, and 6.  The older ones go to high school, and the two youngest go to elementary school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

María is a very good housewife.  In order to get her own income, she is a merchant.  She sells plastic products like plates, glasses, and bags, etc.  She works every day, mostly in the mornings.  That is when it is coolest and she can best make her rounds.  She sells for credit and collects every week-end.  She has been in this business for over two years, and it is going very well for her.  With her profits she is able to help her children be able to get ahead in their studies.  What her husband earns is not enough for this.

This loan is to buy plates, chairs, glasses, and buckets, among other things.  She has been in the communal bank for over two years.  She likes it because of the help the institution, as much as her colleagues, has given her.

Her dreams are to get ahead and to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, chairs, and buckets.

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 8 y 3 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y  el menor en escuela. Su esposo es ayudante de albañil.

Doña Maritza es una muy buena  ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos de plástico como platos, vasos, escobas, recogedores, sillas, etc. y también vende cosméticos y cremas.  Trabaja tres o cuatro días de la semana, sale a hacer sus recorridos con la ayuda de sus hijos, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Sus productos los compra en un local en Picoaza ya que le dan a muy buen precio. Lleva cuatro años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar cosméticos, cremas y productos de plástico. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio  y le gusta porque el grupo es bien unido. 

Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada communal bank meets every 15 in the La Sequita parish in Montecristi.  The canton is known for its famous straw hats that are valued in and outside of the country.

This is where Maritza, age 33, lives.  She is married, and they have four children, ages 15, 13, 8, and 3.  The oldest children go to high school, and the youngest goes to primary school.  Her husband is an assistant bricklayer.

Maritza is a very good housewife.  In order to get her own income she is a merchant.  She sells plastic products like plates, glasses, brooms, dustpans, and chairs, etc.  She also sells cosmetics and creams.  She works three or four days a week.  She goes out to make her rounds with the help of her children.  She sells for credit, and she collects every week-end.  She buys the products at a place in Picoaza because they give her a very good price.  She has been in this business for four years, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy cosmetics, creams, and plastic products.  She has been in the communal bank since it started.  She likes it because the group is very united.

Her dream is to have a place to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, and plastic products.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune lives in Odzun village in the Lori region with her husband, mother-in-law, and daughter. 

She is a teacher, with many years of experience, teaching at a local school. Since there is a high unemployment rate in the region, Nune's husband had to go abroad and find work there. 

Their daughter, Lilit, studies at university, which is located in Vanadzor town. It is 42 kilometers from the village they live in and Nune has had to rent a house in the city for Lilit to live in. She also has to provide Lilit with the necessary financial means to cover her daily costs. 

All these costs do not allow Nune to create savings to pay for Lilit's tuiton fee. So, she has applied for a loan of AMD 100,000 to pay her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition fee.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
22-year-old Elvin lives alone in Marneuli district. Several times, Elvin requested a loan from local financial institutions for his business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and poor living conditions. 

Elvin is a car artisan. He has his own workshop where he fixes damaged cars and earns a small monthly income.

Elvin requested loan from Credo to start-up the business. Elvin has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. 

The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Elvin will purchase a computer diagnostic apparatus for cars. He will be able to diagnose the cars and find the problems to fix them. This will attract more clients and Elvin will have more cars to fix. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase Elvin's income and he will be able to expand the business and also improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a computer diagnostic apparatus for cars.

loans.name: Tatiana Lizbeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Tatiana, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad. El marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
 
Doña Tatiana tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende toda clase de víveres, granos, legumbres y bebidas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, su negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que así está ganado sus ingresos por el bien de su bebé que es lo más preciado que tiene ella. Lleva recién un año con su negocio pero a pesar de que tiene poco tiempo su negocio lo tiene muy surtido razón por lo cual cada vez tiene más clientes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar  víveres para seguir aumentado su negocio y su clientela. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 1 año  y le gusta porque gracias al crédito empezó su negocio.

Sus sueños mejorar su negocio y que nunca les falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada communal bank meets every 15 in the La Sequita parish in Montecristi.  The canton is known for its famous straw hats that are valued in and outside of the country.

This is where Tatiana, age 20, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have a one year old child.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Tatiana has a food supply store in her house.  She sells all types of food supplies, grains, vegetables, and drinks.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She started her business with the first loan that she received from the institution.  She is very grateful for this because she is earning income for the good of her baby, who is most precious to her.

She has had her business for one year.  However, in spite of having her business for a short time, she has it well stocked.  That is the reason that she regularly gets more customers.

She will use this loan to buy food supplies in order to continue increasing her business and her clientele.  She has been in the communal bank for over one year.  She likes it because, thanks to the loan, she started her business.

Her dreams are to improve her business and for her family never to be in need.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Ángel Miguel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive el señor Ángel, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su mujer es comerciante.

Don Ángel y su esposa tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, venden toda clase de víveres, granos, legumbres, carnes, embutidos, bebidas, entre otras cosas, además su mujer también vende sabanas, cortinas y toldos para lo cual ella sale a recorrer y también vende en su casa, ellos trabajan todos los días y casi todo el día sobre todo los fines de semana que es cuando más venden, lleva tres años con su negocio el cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres y útiles escolares para aprovechar la época de entrada a clases que es cuando más se vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 1 año  y le gusta porque con los créditos puede surtir más su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada communal bank meets every 15 days in the La Sequita parish in Montecristi.  The canton is known for its famous straw hats that are valued in and outside of the country.

This is where Ángel, age 23, lives.  He is in a common-law marriage, and they have a three year old child.  His wife is a merchant.

Ángel and his wife have a food supply store in their house.  They sell all types of supplies, grains, vegetables, meat, sausages, and drinks, among other things.  His wife also sells sheets, curtains, and sunshades.  In order to do so, she goes out to sell, and she also sells at their house.  They work almost all day, every day.  They work most of all on the week-ends, which is when they sell the most.  He has been in the business for three years, and it allows him to get his family ahead.

He will use this loan to buy food supplies and school supplies in order to take advantage of the season when classes start.  This is when he sells the most.  He has been in the communal bank for over one year.  He likes it because, with the loans, he is able to stock his business more.

His dream is to get ahead for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy food and school supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Felicidad

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria forma parte del banco comunal Victoria del Portete, vive por el sector de Quinta Chica en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable, gentil y muy luchadora que trabajan día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares.

La Señora Gloria tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 13 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la rama de la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada por un familiar.

Doña Gloria a más de dedicarse a su hogar, trabaja muy duro en las actividades del campo las cuales son la crianza de animales y la agricultura, realiza esta actividad desde muy joven ya que heredo de sus padres y ahora son su fuente de ingresos, a pesar de ser un trabajo sacrificado le gusta mucho trabajar en esta actividad.

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ganado del cual obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y cerdos para  engordarlos y venderlos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Victoria del Portete communal bank.  She lives in the Quinta Chica area of Cuenca.  It is a place with beautiful scenery.  Its people are kind, charming, and very tenacious.  They work day to day in order to improve their households’ financial stability.

Gloria, age 35, is married.  They have two children, age 13 and 6.  Her first daughter goes to high school, and her second daughter goes to a city primary school.  Her husband works in the field of construction as a bricklayer.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in a house that is lent to her by a relative.

In addition to devoting herself to her household, Gloria works very hard in the activities of the field.  These are raising animals and farming.  She has done this business activity ever since she was very young because she inherited it from her parents.  It is now her source of income.  In spite of being demanding work, she really likes to work in this business activity.

She used her previous loan to buy livestock, from which she got very good profits.  She will use her new loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs in order to fatten them and sell them.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Sofía Pascuala

texts.es:
La Señora Sofía es socia del banco comunal Victoria del Portete, vive en la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene grandes llanuras propicias para la crianza de ganado y la agricultura, su gente se caracterizan por su amabilidad y carisma, aun mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Sofía tiene 33 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 14, 10 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y dos en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Sofía pasa en casa realizando los quehaceres de su hogar pero también se dedica a la cría pollos, cuyes y ganado, tres días a la semana trabaja en la agricultura cultivando terrenos ajenos y hay veces que también le llaman para lavar ropa ajena. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca y también en alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es comprarse un terreno y allí construir su casita.
texts.en:
Sofía is a member of the Victoria del Portete communal bank.  She lives in the Victoria del Portete parish in Cuenca.  This parish has large, lush plains that are favorable for raising cattle and farming.  Its people are known for their kindness and charisma.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  

Sofía, age 33, is married, and they have three children, ages 14, 10, and 4.  Her first child is in high school, and the other two go to an elementary school in the area.  Her husband works as a day worker.  They do not have their own house.  Therefore, they rent where they live.

Sofía spends time at home doing the household chores.  However, she also raises chickens, guinea pigs, and cattle.  Three days a week she works in agriculture, cultivating other people’s land.  At times, she is also called upon to wash other people’s clothes. 

She will use the loan to buy a cow and feed for her animals.

Her goal is to buy a piece of land and to build her little house there.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Rocío Valeria

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Rocío, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y  tiene un bebé de apenas 9 meses de nacido. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Roció es una ama de casa que al ver que a su esposo no le alcanza para los gastos familiares se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas ya que ella aprovecha que a esas horas su mamá  le puede cuidar a su bebé, compra su mercadería en Portoviejo y en   Guayaquil, lleva más de 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y en especial ropa de niños. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace 3 ciclos y le gusta ya que gracias  al primer  crédito empezó  su negocio.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive con familiares.
texts.en:
Picoaza is certified as one of the indigenous settlements of the Manteña culture. This urban parish is located only 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi. Here is where the members of the María Asunción communal bank meet every two weeks. 

This is where Rocío lives. She is 19, married, and has a baby who is barely 9 months old. Her husband is a construction worker. Rocío is a housewife who, seeing that her husband does not have enough for the household expenses, works as a vendor. She sells all types of clothing, and does this door-to-door.

She works every day, especially in the mornings, as she takes advantage of those hours when her mother can take care of her baby. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo and Guayaquil. She has been in this business for more than a year, and it is going very well. 

She is going to use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and especially children's clothing. She has been a member of the communal bank for three loan cycles and likes it, as thanks to the first loan, she started her business. Her dream is to have her own home, as she lives with family members.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Aurora Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Aurora forma parte del banco comunal Victoria del Portete, vive por el sector de Quinta Chica en Cuenca, lugar de de hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable, gentil y luchadora que trabajan día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica.

La Señora. Aurora tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, 5 de ellos son casados y viven independientes y su último hijo que tiene 13 años está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Doña Aurora trabaja a diario en las duras tareas del campo como es la agricultura y  la crianza de animales, este es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres el cual le ha permitido mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar y sacar adelante a toda su familia. 

Su crédito anterior lo ha invertido en la compra de animales, semillas y abono de los cuales obtuvo buenas ganancias. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, ganado, alimento para sus animales y abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the Victoria del Portete communal bank.  She lives in the Quinta Chica area of Cuenca.  It is a place with beautiful scenery.  Its people are kind, charming, and tenacious.  They work day to day in order to improve their financial stability.

Aurora, age 55, is a widow.  Her marriage produced six children.  Five of them are married and live independently.  Her last child, age 13, goes to a city high school.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in a relative’s house.

Aurora works daily doing difficult field work.  She farms and raises animals.  She learned this trade from her parents, and it has allowed her to improve stability in her household and to get her whole family ahead.

She used the previous loan to buy animals, seeds, and fertilizer.  She got good earnings from this.  She will use her new loan to buy chickens, livestock, feed for her animals, and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy chickens, livestock, animal feed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ara Pyahu Group

texts.es:
Ara Pyahu tiene 13 integrantes, quienes gracias a su trabajo están en su séptimo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sebastiana, quien a través del esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Sebastiana tiene una despensa bien surtida y en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que quiere superarse con el correr del tiempo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, verduras, productos a granel, arroz y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece esta oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en: “Ara Pyahu” has 13 members who thanks to their work are now in the 7th cycle of the women’s committee program.  One of the members is Sebastiana who is getting ahead thanks to her efforts.  She has a well-stocked grocery store where she works every day starting very early.  She’s a very hardworking person who wants to improve as time goes by.  She’s asking for this loan to buy fruit, vegetables, bulk items, rice and others to continue with her sales.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she and her girlfriends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 29-year-old married man and the father of four children. He works in construction, and specializes in cement and sanitary work. He also operates a compressor machine in several projects. Hasan works hard to provide his family with the best possible life, especially since his wife doesn't work because she stays home to care for their children. He has applied for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy cement and construction materials to meet customer demand. He is working hard to expand his work area and open a general construction company.

loans.use: to buy cement and construction materials.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señorita María forma parte del banco comunal Victoria del Portete, estos créditos le permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica. Vive en la parroquia Victoria del Porteter en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene grandes llanuras propicias para la crianza de ganado y la agricultura, su gente se caracterizan por su amabilidad y carisma, aun mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La señorita María tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su mamá quien se dedica a la ganadería, su padre no vive en el país. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Ella labora desde hace un año y medio en una fábrica de calzado, esta actividad la desempeña de lunes a viernes 8 horas al día, también tiene ganado el cual le da cuidando su mamá cuando se encuentra en el trabajo. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado. 

Su meta es estudiar Administración de Empresas.
texts.en:
María belongs to the Victoria del Portete communal bank.  This loan allows her to improve her financial stability.  She lives in the Victoria de Portete parish in Cuenca.  This parish has large plains that are favorable for raising livestock and farming.  Its people are known for their kindness and charisma.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

María, age 22, is single and lives with her mother, who raises livestock.  Her father does not live in the country.  She does not have her own house, so she rents where she lives.

She has been making shoes for one and a half years.  She does this eight hours a day on Mondays through Fridays.  She also has livestock, which her mother cares for when she is at work.

She will use the loan to buy livestock.

Her goal is to study business administration.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Leonor Antonieta

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es arquitecto.

Doña Leonor es una mujer que le gusta tener sus propios ingresos, para esto ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de varias marcas, además de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende es en su casa ya que hasta allí llegan sus clientes que en su mayoría son amigos y familiares, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince  días. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Lleva más de 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Picoaza is described in books as one of the indigenous peoples which are part of the Manteña culture. This urban community is located only ten minutes away from the town of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi. Here is where the members of the "María Asunción" communal bank gather together every 15 days.

This is where Leonor lives. She's 41 years old and married, and from this relationship she has two children aged 16 and 14, who attend school. Her husband is an architect.

Leonor is a woman who likes to have an income of her own. To that end, she sells various brands of clothing by catalog. In addition, she sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women's accessories). She sells on a door-to-door basis and also from her home, since that's where her customers come. Most of her customers are friends and relatives. She sells her merchandise on credit and collects payments every 8 or 15 days. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and it has been going very well.

This loan is to purchase clothing, perfumes, lotions and cosmetics, among other items. She has been in the communal bank for over 12 years and she enjoys it because it's easy to get loans.

Her dream is to have her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Tacurindy Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Tacuarindy está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, tiene 16 miembros, donde cada una se esfuerza por poder crecer y mejorar cada día sus ingresos. Ellas son luchadoras y muy emprendedoras.
Una historia es la de Brigida, quien se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, cuenta que es muy sacrificado ya que siempre tiene que estar pendiente de sus animales para que no les falte nada. Cuenta que su sueño es poder tener algún día una granja donde tener muchas clases de animales para la cría.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y cerdos pequeños para poder criar. Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo todas ellas.
texts.en:
The group called “Tacuarindy” is in cycle #4 in the women’s committee program.  It has 16 members each of whom strives to grow and to improve her income every day.  They are very enterprising, hardworking women.

One story is about Brigida who works raising pigs to sell.  She relates that it’s very demanding because she must always be focused on her animals not lacking anything.  She relates that her dream is to someday be able to have a farm where she can raise all kinds of animals

She’s asking for this loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and piglets to raise.  She is grateful for the opportunity all of them are getting

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is 37 years old, married and lives in Talibon, Bohol. She has two children who are 12 and 15 years old. She earns a living by running a store where sells items such as lotion, body spray, laundry soaps and fabric conditioner. She is requesting a loan for 18,000 PHP to more items to sell and attract more customers. In the future, Jenifer would like to expand her business to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. María está realizando su cuarto crédito en el banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy visitada por la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos y envuelta por una amplia naturaleza, su gente conserva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Le gusta la banca comunal porque los créditos le permiten mejorar sus negocios.

La Señora María tiene 33 años,  vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que a más de dedicarse a su hogar trabaja en varias actividades económicas, vende cosméticos de varias marcas desde hace 3 años, todos los días de domingo a domingo trabaja en la preparación y venta de almuerzos y solo los fines de semana prepara meriendas. 

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para la venta y víveres para preparar los alimentos y así continuar creciendo en esta actividad económica. 

Su meta es terminar su casa la cual ya se encuentra en construcción.
texts.en:
This is María’s fourth loan with the Medio Ejido communal bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a lot of tourists because of its beautiful colonial architecture.  It is bathed by four rivers and enveloped by expansive nature.  Its people conserve the culture and traditions of their villages.  She likes the communal bank because the loans allow her to improve her businesses.

María, age 33, is in a common-law marriage, and they have three children, ages 15, 11, and 6.  Her first child is in high school, and the younger two attend a city elementary school.  Her husband is a security guard.  They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live.

María is a very hard-working woman.  In addition to devoting herself to her household, she works at various business activities.  She has been selling various brands of cosmetics for three years.  Every day, from Sunday to Sunday, she works preparing and selling lunches.  On the week-ends she makes snacks.

She will use her loan to buy cosmetics to sell and food supplies to prepare the food.  This way she will continue growing in this business activity.

Her goal is to finish her house, which is now under construction.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and food supplies.

loans.name: Grace Elsa

texts.es:
La Señorita Grace está realizando su tercer crédito en el banco comunal Medio Ejido. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy visitada por la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos y envuelta por una amplia naturaleza, su gente conserva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita. Grace tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Grace desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos los que vende a sus amigas y compañeras de la Universidad, ella está en el quinto ciclo de la carrera Ingeniería Electrónica y Telecomunicaciones. 

Su crédito lo va a  invertir en pagar sus estudios y también va a comprar cosméticos de promoción y así ampliar su negocio. 

Su meta es terminar sus estudios y llegar a ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
This is Grace’s third loan with the Medio Ejido communal bank.  She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a lot of tourists because of its beautiful colonial architecture.  It is bathed by four rivers and enveloped by expansive nature.  Its people conserve the culture and traditions of their villages.  

Grace, age 22, is single and lives with her mother.  They do not have their own house, so they rent where they live.

Grace has been selling cosmetics for five years.  She sells to her friends and colleagues at the university.  She is in the fifth cycle of her electrical engineering and telecommunications studies.

She will use the loan to pay for her education.  She will also buy cosmetics on sale, and this way she will expand her business.

Her goal is to finish her education and to become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and to pay for her education.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
La Sra. Gertrudis es Casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos están en la Argentina trabajando y los restantes aun son pequeños que son el motivo de su lucha de todos los días, procurando poder darles lo mejor.
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en el barrio. Una de sus hijas le ayuda en con las tareas en la despensa, y asi están saliendo adelante gracias a la ayuda de la familia. Consiguió montar su despensa con un poco de dinero que le había juntado con el trabajo que realizaba anteriormente como asalariada. Cuenta también que su marido trabaja en un lavadero que montaron en su patio para que con ese ingreso pueda ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, verduras, carnes, y demás insumos para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio y dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is married with four children, two of which are currently working in Argentina. Her two youngest children live with her and are the reason Gertrudis struggles every day to be able to provide for them the best she can. She owns a small, well-stocked grocery store that is very well-known in her neighborhood. One of Gertrudis' daughters helps her to take care of it. Her store and the help of her family allows Gertrudis to help her family get ahead. She was able to open the store with some money she saved from her previous job. Her husband works in a laundromat that they opened from their patio. With the earnings from both of these businesses, Gertrudis and her husband pay their household expenses. 

Gertrudis is requesting this loan in order to buy fruit, vegetables, meat and other supplies to keep her grocery store stocked so that she can keep providing her customers with items they need.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat and other supplies to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Amistad, está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas decidieron unirse para ayudar a sus familias y por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorena quien con esfuerzo y gracias a la venta de prendas que hace está saliendo adelante. Tiene todo tipo de prendas y es por eso que atrae a muchos clientes siempre y en lo cual le ve muy bien. Su meta es poder tener una tienda de ropas bien surtida, ya que sabe que de esa forma podrá seguir ayudando a su familia.
Lorena solicita de este crédito para la compra de buzos, jeans, remeras, camisas y demás, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas y mejorando cada día más.
texts.en:
The group called “La Amistad” (Friendship) is in cycle #8 in the women’s committee program.  They are from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso and they decided to join together to help their families by means of their teamwork and their growth together.

One of the members is Lorena who with effort and thanks to selling clothes is getting ahead.  She has all types of clothes and this is why she attracts many customers always and does very well.  Her goal is to be able to open a well-stocked clothing store because she knows she can continue helping her family this way.

Lorena is asking for this loan to buy sweatshirts, jeans, t-shirts, shirts and others because she’ll be able to continue selling and improving more this way every day.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rincon Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rincon Poty está en su 16 ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se han puesto como meta crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también mejorar como personas y capacitarse.
Zunilda, comenta que tiene un salón de belleza en el que trabaja arduamente para ir creciendo. Su negocio esta mejorando gracias a la atención que ella da a sus clientes, además de ello comenta que su sueño es ir ampliando su peluquería para poder mejorar sus ingresos y también ayudar a las personas que necesiten trabajo.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, spray, shampoo, enjuagues, gel y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called “Rincon Poty” is in its 16th cycle in the women’s committee program.  They have set a goal for themselves to grow not only economically 
but also as persons and to get training.

Zunilda comments that she has a beauty salon that she works hard to make grow.  Her business is improving thanks to the service she provides her customers.  In addition, she comments that her dream is to expand the beauty salon in order to improve her income and also to help people who need employment.

She’s asking for this loan to buy supplies like hair color, spray, shampoo, rinses, gel, etc. for her beauty salon so she can continue to provide good customer service.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Elba Elsa

texts.es:
La Señora Elba forma parte del banco comunal Medio Ejido, el tiempo que se encuentra en este grupo ha fortalecido su amistad con todas sus vecinas y amigas, le gusta mucho este tipo de créditos ya que le permite mejorar su estabilidad económica. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy visitada por la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos y envuelta por una amplia naturaleza, su gente conserva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Elba tiene 57 años de edad, está divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 24 y 22 años, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda economícamente, su segunda hija se dedica los estudios universitarios, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Elba se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales, quimbolitos, humitas que son platos típicos del Ecuador, tiene este negocio desde hace 15 años y ofrece estas delicias puerta a puerta, trabaja de domingo a domingo hasta que termine de vender sus productos.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para preparar estos platos típicos.
texts.en:
Elba is a member of the Medio Ejido communal bank.  The time that she has spent with this group has strengthened her friendship with all of her neighbors and friends.  She really likes this type of loan because it allows her to improve her financial stability.  She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a lot of tourists because of its beautiful colonial architecture.  It is bathed by four rivers and enveloped by expansive nature.  Its people conserve the culture and traditions of their villages.  

Elba, age 57, is divorced.  However, the marriage produced two children, ages 24 and 22.  He first child, a son, works and helps her financially.  Her second child, a daughter, attends the university.  She does not have her own house, so she rents where she lives.

Elba makes and sells tamales, "quimbolitos" [a corn-based steamed dessert], and “humitas” [a dish similar to tamales].  These are typical Ecuadorian dishes.  She has had this business for 15 years.  She sells these delightful dishes door to door.  She works from Sunday to Sunday until she finishes selling her products.

She will use the loan to buy food supplies in order to prepare these typical dishes.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús está formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia de Paccha en Cuencas, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación, su gente en especial se dedica a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades. Las socias son mujeres muy alegres y luchadoras que trabajan día a día para mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares y así darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Juana, está realizando el segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, le gusta mucho esta forma de créditos ya que a más de mejorar su economía, se reúne con sus amigas para platicar y salir de su rutina diaria de trabajo. 

La Señora. María Juana tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 15, 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros pero  independientes.

Doña María Juana pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de pollos a los cuales los tiene en galpones. También siembra de hortalizas a las que las vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, alimento para pollos y semillas. 

Su meta es  realizar un galpón más grande para sus animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Divino Niño Jesús is made up of 11 women who live in the Paccha parish in Cuencas, an area that enjoys a lot of vegetation. The population works in animal husbandry, farming and in the city doing different jobs. 

The members are very happy women who fight and work every day to improve the economic situation of their homes and to give their children a better future. 

One of the members of this group is María Juana. She is asking for her second loan next to her friends and members of the communal bank Divino Niño Jesús. She likes this type of loan a lot since it improves her economy. 

She gets together with her friends to talk and to get away from the daily work routine. 

María Juana  is 39, married and has 4 children aged 15, 12, 10 and 8. Her first two children are studying in school and her youngest two study at a small local school. 

Her husband works as a day laborer. They do not have their own home which is why they live with her in-laws in their own area of the house. 

María Juana spends most of her time at home but helps the household economy by raising chickens which she keeps in sheds. She also plants vegetables which she sells in her community or in the city. 

She will use the new loan to buy chickens, chicken feed and seeds. 

Her goal is to build a bigger shed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed and seeds.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades. Este comité se encuentra en su 8vo ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en las capacitaciones.
Alejandra, una de las integrantes se encuentra mejorando sus ingresos y su vida gracias al trabajo arduo que esta haciendo. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de diferentes marcas y por medio de ese trabajo está saliendo adelante. Ella se está esforzando por mejorar cada día.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de cosméticos de variadas marcas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y teniendo los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of this committee carry out a variety of activities.  This committee is in its 8th cycle and their sense of responsibility and desire to make progress each member has stand out both in attendance and in training.

Alejandra is one of the members who is improving her income and her life thanks to the hard work she does.  She sells cosmetics of various brands and by means of this work is getting ahead.  She’s striving to improve every day.

She requests this loan to buy cosmetics of various brands to continue with her sales and having the means to help her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio es de la ciudad de Luque, tiene un colectivo en el cual trabaja como chofer, en una línea interna de la cuidad de Luque, el es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde siempre se ha esforzado mucho por poder salir adelante.
Cuenta que este es el sustento de su familia, es por eso que lo cuida mucho pues es muy valioso para él. Sueña con algún día poder tener otro colectivo que poder hacer trabajar y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Dicho préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el colectivo que maneja para su mantenimiento logrando de ese  modo ofrecer mayor comodidad y seguridad a sus usuarios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Julio comes from the town of Luque. He owns a bus in which he works as a driver on a local bus line of the town of Luque. He's a very hard-working person who has always made a great effort in order to get ahead.
He reports that this is his family's means of livelihood, which is why he takes very good care of it, since it's very valuable to him. He dreams of being able to own another bus someday, so that he can work and continue to support his family.
The loan he requests will be invested in the bus he drives by doing maintenance work on it. That way he'll be able to offer more comfort and safety to his passengers. He gives thanks for this opportunity he's getting, because it will be very helpful to him.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his bus.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Las Mercedes es el trabajador grupo formado en la ciudad de Encarnación, con 15 miembros, quienes gracias a la ayuda, al sacrificio y trabajo de cada una ya están en su ciclo 16. Ellas son conocidas por ser personas muy solidarias en el barrio.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, se encuentra mejorando cada vez más. Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería, también se debe destacar el trabajo sacrificado que ella hace por poder salir adelante y dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa.
La Sra. Juana solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencería de todo tipo, ya que así podrá cumplir con el pedido de todas y todos sus clientes y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Las Mercedes is a hard working group of 15 members which started in the city of Encarnación. 

Thanks to the help, sacrifice and work of each one, they are in their 16th phase.
 
They are known as very supportive people in the neighborhood. 

One of the members is Juana. Through effort and hard work she is a successful woman who find herself constantly improving. 

She sells lingerie. It should also be highlighted that she has sacrificed by working hard in order to get ahead and to give her family what they need in order to live a decent and dignified life. 

Juana is asking for a loan in order to invest it in buying all types of lingerie. 

This way she can fill all the orders from her clients as well as keep growing.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to be sold.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: La señora Luz Elena habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo y dos hijos, su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su esposo se dedica a cultivar la tierra, ella por su parte tiene su negocio vende comida como: Enchiladas, Tajadas con Queso, Nacatamales, Tortillas, Cuajadas. con este credito ella podra invertir en su negocio y asi obtendra mayores ganancias, con las ganancias doña Luz invierte en la construccion de su casa y su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Luz Elena lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and two children. Her greatest dream is to be able to improve her living conditions. Her husband works in cultivation and for her part, Luz has a business selling food such as: enchiladas, tajadas (fried ripe banana pieces) with cheese, nacatamales (maize, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaves), tortillas, and junket.

With this loan she will be able to invest in her business and therefore earn better profits. With the profits, Luz invests in the construction of her house and helps her husband with the household expenses.

She thanks Afodenic and Kiva Funds for their support.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Kalidou

texts.fr: kALIDOU est un homme âgé de 45 ans père de famille. Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 1 an déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kalidou is 45 years old and he has a family.  One year ago, he opened and started to manage a small grocery store in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city.  His small retail business is doing well, thanks to Kalidou's warm welcome, to his professional experience and to the fact that he has managed to build a good customer base over time.  However, with an increasing number of customers, Kalidou can no longer meet demand because his capital is so small that he has to buy in retail quantities.

Kalidou is requesting this loan in order to boost his small business and diversify his merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, boxes of sugar, snacks...) which will help him to increase his profit margin.  He will reinvest part of his profits in his activity in order to cover the needs of his business.  With the rest of the money, he will be able to meet his daily needs as well as those of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of staple goods.

loans.name: Antia

texts.es:
El Sr. Antia tiene 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Ñemby  está casado con la Sra. Raquel, ambos tienen 5 hijos todos mayores que ya son independientes pero que los ayudan cuando pueden.
El Sr. Antia se dedica a la Micro industria ya que cuenta con una fábrica de metalúrgica donde se dedica a la fabricación de Muebles Metálicos para todo tipo de comercios, como  despensas, farmacias, copetines, supermercados etc, su local de negocio tiene una excelente ubicación ya que se encuentra en un lugar estratégico.
Cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba como chofer en una empresa y que hace 15 años más o menos que vivió una escasez de trabajo, y decidió independizarse al principio sólo compraba los estantes de metales para revender pero no le resultó porque no tenía mucha ganancia luego conoció a un amigo que se dedicaba a la fabricación de esos tipos de muebles y se asoció con él pero más adelante consiguió las herramientas necesarias y ya trabajó por su cuenta y con ayuda de su familia hoy día su empresa es familiar ya que todos su hijos trabajan con él.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de metales, con los cuales podrá seguir haciendo los muebles que vende. Esta agradecido por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Antia is 57 years old, and lives in the city of Nemby.  He is married to Raquel, and together they have 5 children who are all grown and independent, but they help them when they can.

Antia has a small metalworking business where he makes steel furniture for all types of businesses, such as grocery stores, pharmacies, snack bars, supermarkets, etc.  His business has an excellent location, because it is in a strategic spot.

He says that previously he worked as a driver for a company for about 15 years, during which time he did not have enough work.  He decided to start working independently.  At first, he only was buying metal shelves to resell, but this didn't give him a lot of earnings. Then he met a friend who was making these types of furniture pieces, and he started working with him.  Later on, he acquired the necessary tools and started working on his own  with the help of his family.  Today, he has a family business, since all of his children work with him.

Antia is requesting a loan to buy metal, so that he can continue to make the furniture that he sells.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving, as it will be very helpful to him.

loans.use: to buy metal to make steel furniture to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre mujeres luchadoras, ya que eso son, 18 mujeres que se unieron y están luchando ciclo tras ciclo y es gracias a ello que están haciendo el ciclo 17. Desean seguir trabajando y mejorando la vida de cada una.
Carmen es parte de este grupo y este grupo y cuenta que a través de la costura esta saliendo adelante, ya que este es su medio de subsistencia y la forma en la que obtiene los ingresos del día a día. Su meta es poder llegar a ser conocida por otros lugares, poder mejorar su taller y también dar trabajo a otros.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, ya que son su principal insumo para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This is the Mujeres Luchadoras Group [Fighting Women Group] since this is what they are. 

They are 18 women who got together and are fighting phase by phase and thanks to this are now at their 17th phase. 
They want to keep working and improving the life of each one of them. 

Carmen is part of this group and says that thanks to her sewing she is getting ahead. This is her livelihood and the way that she makes money from day to day. 

Her goal is to be known in other parts, to be able to improve her workshop and give work to others. 

She is requesting this loan to invest it in buying fabrics, thread, elastic, buttons etc. These are her main supplies in order to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons etc.

loans.name: Geissell Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Geissell habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, sus planes a futuro es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y terminar de construir su humilde casita, entre los dos luchan dia a dia para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante, ella trabaja para una empresa privada al igual que su esposo, ella adema tiene un negocio vende Tanques de Gas Licuado  en su casa de habitacion, negocio el cual le esta llendo muy bien ya que con este credito comprara mas Tanques para que la distribuidora le proporcione mas producto, Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan brindado ya que sus ingresos mejorar.
texts.en: Geissell lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children.  For the future, she plans to improve her living conditions and finish construction on her humble house.  She and her husband strive each day to get ahead with their children.  She works for a private company, and so does her husband. Geissell also has a business selling propane tanks from her house, and this business is doing very well.  With this loan, she will buy more tanks so that the distributor can provide her with more gas to sell.  She appreciates the support that Afodenic and Kiva are providing her, because it will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy tanks of propane gas

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Fatima mujer humilde, trabajadora habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos sus planes a futuro es mejorar sus condiciones de Vida y terminar de Construir su casa, entre los se dividen los gastos del hogar ya que ambos trabajan para poder salir adelante,  con este credito doña Fatima compra Materiales de Construccion como: Cemento, Arena, Hierro, Bloques ya que desea construir un cuarto en la parte trasera de su casa para poder tener mejor espacio, Agradece a Afodenic el apoyo que en cojunto a Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Fátima’s a humble, hardworking woman living in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children.  Her future plans are to improve her living conditions and to finish building her house.  Both she and her husband work to get ahead and they both share household expenses.  

Fátima will use this loan to buy building supplies like cement, sand, iron rods and blocks because she wants to build a room on the rear of the house in order to have more room.  She thanks Afondenic for the help which in conjunction with Kiva funds it has been giving her.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 44 years-old and the mother of five children, all of whom all are currently studying in school. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi where she earns a monthly profit of KES. 5,000.

Kadzo was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her third loan of KES. 30,000 in order to buy more stock of fish to sell. She will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees for her children.

 Kadzo hopes to own her own fish depot in the future so as to help improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish stock for her business.

loans.name: Luz Miriam

texts.es:
Luz de 44 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad. Por su familia esta mujer se ha sacrificado con el fin de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y garantizarles una buena educación. Su vida no ha sido fácil pues ha debido a trabajar fuertemente para sacarlos adelante. 
Con esmero y dedicación ha logrado montar un almacén dedicado a la comercialización de artículos de papelería, belleza y aseo personal. Con el fin de aumentar las ventas y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido.
Sueña con seguir creciendo dentro del mercado local y garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, 44, is a single mother of three minor children.  This woman has sacrificed for her family in order to provide them better quality of life and guarantee a good education for them.  Her life hasn’t been easy because she’s had to work hard to move them forward.

With effort and dedication she succeeded in setting up a store specializing in stationery supplies, beauty products and personal hygiene products.  Aiming at increasing sales and improving her home’s economic conditions, she’s requesting a loan to buy stock.  She dreams with continuing to grow in the local marketplace and to insure a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies, beauty products and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Leap is aged 52 years and married. She has five children. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for 30 years. The current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Leap’s group consists of five members who are all female. Leap is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. 

Leap hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 47 year-old widow who supports a family of five members. She buys and sells cereals in Bomet town, Narok county, Kenya. Her monthly income is around kes 20,000

Rebecca learnt about Kiva partner KADET LTD  from a loan officer. She has successfully paid off her first loan. She has been advanced a second loan of KES. 30,000 which will facilitate in the purchase of more cereals to resell. The proceeds will be used to cater for the family's basic needs and educate the children.

Her hope is to raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to resell.

loans.name: Thioumadé 1 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de trente femmes qui habitent le même village, elles sont amies, parentes et voisines. Leurs activités dominantes sont le petit commerce et l'embouche.

Madame Marème l'emprunteur en vedette est une jeune femme mariée sans enfant, elle est coiffeuse de profession mais s'active dans le petit commerce de draps de lit.Elle est debout vers la droite habillée en wax orange avec une taille basse noire.

Elle achète des draps déjà confectionnés à Touba pour les revendre au niveau de son village.

Avec son prêt elle envisage d'acheter 15 draps de lit à 7500 F l'unité d'où une valeur totale de 112500 F pour espérer se faire beaucoup de revenus à la vente. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne, d'appuyer son mari dans les charges familiales et d'aider ses frères et sœurs en fournitures scolaires et à l'achat de médicaments en cas de besoin.
texts.en:
This group consists of 30 women who live in the same village and who happen to be friends, relatives or neighbors.  Their main activities are small retail business and animal fattening.

Marème, the featured borrower, is a young married woman with no children.  She is a professional hairdresser, but she is also actively involved in the sale of bed sheets.  In the photo, she is standing on the right-hand side, wearing an orange wax-print dress and a long black top.

She buys sheets which have been sewn in Touba and resells them in her village.

She plans to use her loan to buy 15 bed sheets for a total price of 112,500 francs (7,500 francs per sheet), and hopes to make a large profit at resale.

Marème uses her profits to strengthen her savings, to help her husband with the family's expenses, and to help her brothers and sisters to buy school supplies and medications, if need be.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerzan por poder ir creciendo en cada emprendimientos que hace. El grupo lleva ese nombre ya que ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que luchan por mejorar sus vidas y ser cada día mejor.
Rosa es parte de este grupo, quien gracias a la venta de alimentos que hace está saliendo adelante y lucha por seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en su negocio. Rosa es una persona que pese a las adversidades ha podido crecer y mejorar para ayudar a su familia.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo, carne, jamón, queso y demás, para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The 14 members of this committee work doing different activities. They all strive to keep growing in each venture they take on. 

The group has this name since they are hard working women who fight to improve their lives and to each day be better. 

Rosa is part of this group who thanks to selling food that she makes, is getting ahead and fighting to keep growing and investing in her business. 

Rosa is a person who despite adversity has been able to grow and improve in order to help her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables, spices, flour, eggs, meat, ham, cheese etc. in order to keep making the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, flour, eggs, meat, ham, cheese etc

loans.name: Gertrudis Del Socorro

texts.es: Gertrudis, de 67 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad , ella se gana la vida vendiendo comida y refrescos naturales en la ciudad de Granada, actividad que realiza hace más de 10 años,  cuando comenzó con una pana plástica dos manteles yuca y repollo para elaborar vigoron plato típico de la ciudad. Hoy en día su comida es muy popular sobre todo los platos típicos y sus bebidas. Ella le gustaría tener un local de comida típica  ofreciendo variedad a su clientela. Hoy está solicitando el crédito para comprar frutas, yuca, repollo, tomates, hojas de plátano, pues son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar su  comida. Esto le permitirá tener capital para trabajar y también impulsar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gertrudis, 67, is a single mother; she has four adult children.  She earns her living selling food and natural beverages in the city of Granada, an activity she started ten years ago when she started out with a plastic basket, two tablecloths, manioc and cabbage to make ‘vigorón’, [a cabbage salad known as curtido (chopped cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and chili pepper marinated in vinegar and salt), boiled manioc, and chicharrones (fried pork with skin or with meat) wrapped in plantain leaves],a traditional dish in the city.

Today, her food is very popular, especially her traditional dishes and her beverages.  She’d like to have a locale to sell traditional food offering variety to her clientele.  She’s asking for a loan to buy fruit, manioc, cabbage, tomatoes and banana leaves which are part of the raw materials she uses to make her food.  This will allow her to have working capital and will give her business a boost.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and banana leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a display case, shelving and beauty products.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número 14  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo todo lo que sus posibilidades les permiten para poder crecer y ayudar a sus familias.
Una historia digna de destacar es la de la Sra. Artemia, quien gracias a las delicias que hace puede tener los ingresos mínimos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y hábil en la cocina, es por eso que le está yendo muy bien y ya tiene muy buena clientela. Le gustaría poder tener algún día un negocio estable donde seguir trabajando.
Pide este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que ella vende.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras Group is in its 14th phase of the Committee for Women Program.  They all work and they help each other to get ahead. 

They are doing everything possible to grow and help their families. 

A dignified story to highlight is the one of Astemia, who thanks to the delicacies she makes can have the minimal income she needs to help her family. 

She is a hard working and skilled person in the kitchen. This is why things are going very well for her and she has a good clientele. 

One day she would like to be able to have a stable business where she can keep working. 

She is asking for this loan to invest it in buying vegetables, meats, spices and other supplies in order to keep making the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, spices and other supplies.

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 32 years old. She lives in a small village in Dusheti District with her two children, who go to school. Rusudan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Rusudan works as a waitress at local restaurant and she gets a small monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs in the "subsistence poor" category. 

Rusudan requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Rusudan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Rusudan will begin a clothing trade. She plans to purchase clothing from wholesalers and then resell at higher prices. After starting a business, she will be able to increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to begin a clothing trade.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married with five children. The last three attend school. For more than ten years, she has been selling food and water, and she also has some rental houses as part of her business every day.

She knew of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan of 100,950 Kenya shillings to buy building materials.The business is fine, despite the challenge of her tenants making late payments.

In five years, she wants to build more houses and establish herself as a supplier of water. She has three employees helping her run her business. She also wants to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is a 53 year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children.The oldest is 20 while the youngest is 9. She runs a RTW (ready to wear) business. She sells t-shirts, blouses, pants and various kinds of shoes.  Her husband works as a salesman. 

Ivy works hard to earn a living. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP in order to buy various rtw (ready to wear) items and shoes.  This will give a wide array of stock for customer's to choose from.  In the future, Ivy would like to expand her rtw business to support her family and to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy various rtw (ready to wear ) items and shoes.

loans.name: Loert's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Loert is 63 years-old and married with nine children. To support her family, she has been farming rice on ten hectares of farmland for 42 years. From the current business, she can earn about 65,000KHR per day and can save about 18,000KHR each day for the future needs. 

This is a group loan for Loert’s group of two with Kiva’s partner VisionFund and she is the first cycled client. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 2,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use a portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to timely grow her rice so as to better her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Aisah Jean

texts.en:
Aisah Jean  is 43 years-old, a mother of three and she lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. 

She earns a living from selling a variety of foods such as chicken, beef, pork, longaniza (a type of sausage) and other items.
 
She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 14,900 in order to purchase more stock of chicken, beef and pork. She believes that expanding her business will mean more money.

Aisah Jean has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Aisah Jean hopes to maintain a good repayment record with PMPC and dreams to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of chicken, beef, pork and longaniza (a type of sausage).

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda de 33 años, es líder en su comunidad, sus vecinos manifiestan que es una mujer con una perseverancia y calidez humana que la destacan en cualquier lugar. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos gracias a un subsidio que recibió por parte de una entidad. Hoy agrade por la ayuda que le han brindado y asegura que desea seguir creciendo dentro del sector debido a la viabilidad y rentabilidad de su negocio. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de animales, cuido y adecuaciones locativas de galpones.

Sueña en un futuro próximo, convertirse en una fuente de empleo para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 33 years old. She is a leader in her community. Her neighbors declare that she is a woman with perseverance and humanity that make her stand out anywhere. For three years she has been raising chickens and pigs, thanks to a subsidy that she received. Today she is grateful for the help that was offered her, and she confirms that she wants to continue growing in this sector because of the viability and profitability of her business. For this reason she is applying for a loan that she will invest in purchasing animals, their care, and suitable modifications of their sheds.

She dreams of becoming a source of employment for her community in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, care for them, and make suitable modifications of their sheds.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan  es un excelente cliente de MiCredito y Kiva, ha ido creciendo poco a poco, atravez de los financiamientos que se le ha otorgado está muy agradecido por la confianza y respaldo que ha obtenido como agricultor pues el crédito lo tiene en el momento que más lo necesita.  El crédito anterior le ayudo para complementar los costos de producción de media manzana de tabaco, de la cual gracias al crédito obtuvo buenos rendimientos y utilidades. Las cuales las tiene ahorradas para reinvertirlas en el próximo ciclo además piensa comprar una camioneta en buen estado para transportar su cosecha y no depender del alquiler de vehículos para esta actividad. El préstamo anterior lo invirtió específicamente en la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas y mano de obra para cultivar tabaco. En este nuevo préstamo desea invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, abonos  y gastos de mano de obra para establecer dos manzanas de maíz, frijol y media manzana de tomate. Este nuevo préstamo le estaría ayudando a obtener diversificada la producción, mantener la seguridad alimentaria de su familia y la comunidad. Una vez finalizado el préstamo el siguiente paso sería cultivar tabaco.
texts.en:
Juan is an excellent MiCredito and Kiva client.  He has been progressing little by little as he has received financing.  He is very grateful for the trust and support that he has received as a farmer, as his loan was very much needed and well-timed.  His previous loan helped with his production and harvest costs, specifically for purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and labor costs for harvesting his tobacco field, which performed well and produced good profits.  He has been saving his profits to reinvest in his field for the next planting cycle as well as purchase a truck that is in good condition to transport his harvest and not depend on a rental truck. 

He plans to use this loan, in combination with his savings, to invest in input costs such as fertilizers, and labor costs to expand his fields with corn, beans, and tomato.  This new loan will help diversify his production and secure the food for his family and community.

loans.use: Para comprar fertilizantes, abonos  y gastos de mano de obra

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente con enormes sueños y metas por cumplir, que se vale de su lancha para hacerlos posibles. Es un hombre luchador, responsable y trabajador, además de ser atento y servicial, eso le ayuda a desempeñar sus actividades, ya que trabaja en una playa del país, con su lancha transporta a personas de un extremo a otro, es así como el cada mañana se dispone a trabajar con lo mejor que tiene para que el pan no falte en su hogar vive con su familia en casa propia. Tiene necesidad de comprar repuestos para su lancha, y no tiene el capital para hacerlo. Es por eso, que solicta nuevamnete un crédito para poder comprar repuestos necesarios para que junto a su lancha puedan continuar brindando el servicio que sus clientes merecen y asi seguir llevando el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
This is a client with huge dreams and goals to meet who avails himself of his boat to do so.  He’s a responsible, hardworking, striving man in addition to being kind and service-oriented.  This helps him to do his work since he works at one of the country’s beaches transporting people from one end to the other.  This is how he heads out every morning to work so that bread will not be lacking in his own home where he lives with his family.

He needs to buy spare parts for his boat and does not have capital to do so.  Because of this, he’s once again requesting a loan to be able to buy the needed spare parts so that he and his boat can continue providing the kind of service his customers deserve and continue providing his home with daily sustenance.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and supplies.

loans.name: Telmira

texts.es: Telmira tiene 69 años de edad , es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, vive acompañada de su esposo y de su suegra de 104 años de edad.Telmira se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo , lleva 3 años en está actividad ya que antiguamente se dedicaba a la ganadería pero por motivos de salud tuvo que dejar este negocio y vender todo su ganado para dedicarse s su tienda. Gracias a la fortaleza y el amor de su familia pudo salir adelante y establecerse en este rubro ya que desea seguir adelante para tener una tienda mucho más grande.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará mas productos comestibles tales como leche, azúcar, arroz, conservas de pescado, entre otros .
texts.en:
Telmira is 69 years old. She is a hard-working and responsible woman. She lives with her husband and her mother-in-law, who is 104 years old. Telmira sells food products, and her own house is her workplace. She has been in this business for 3 years, since she formerly raised livestock, but for health reasons she had to leave this business and sell all her animals to dedicate herself to her store.
