Thanks to the strength and love of her family, she was able to move forward and establish herself in this area, since she wants to continue forward to have a much bigger store. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the financial support that she receives. Furthermore, she promises to make her payments punctually. With the 1000 PEN that she has applied for, she will buy more food products such as milk, sugar, rice, and preserved fish, among other items.

loans.use: to buy products such as milk, sugar, rice, and preserved fish, among other items

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa de un familiar. El cliente está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: This client has worked in farming for several years growing beans and corn and he has managed to cover his household expenses with sales from his harvests.  He is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man who lives with his wife and child.  He is asking for a loan to be able to buy supplies for his harvest, such as fertilizers, manure, seed, fertilizers, etc.  and to improve the land he grows on, which is pictured above, as he is not able to cover these expenses with what he makes.  This would give him better earning and better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his harvest, such as fertilizers, manure, seed, fertilizers, etc., and to improve his land

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Petronila de 32  años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad del San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 03 años  a la venta de ropa usada y nueva.
Doña Petronila  también vende golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas y tajadas de plátano con pollo, su venta es ambulante en los barrios y colonias de su comunidad, sus clientes le prefieren por sus buenos precios y variedad en sus productos, además de su atención que es personalizada.
Doña Petronila  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de faldas, vestidos, blusas, camisas, calzonetas y también para compra de papas, patastes, cebollas, chiles, plátanos etc. que es su otra actividad.
Doña Petronila  con el apoyo del préstamo espera que mejore un poco su calidad de vida al tener más ganancias en su negocio, está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Petronila is 32, she is a single mom, has two dependent children and lives in the community of San Lorenzo, South of Honduras, she owns her house and works selling new and used clothing.  Petronila also sells food items such as tacos, enchiladas and slices of plantain with chicken, she is a street vendor and goes to neighborhoods and areas of her community, her customers prefer her products due to the good prices and variety she offers, in addition to her personalized customer service.  Petronila is requesting a loan to buy skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, underwear, as well as to buy potatoes, pear squash, onions, peppers, plantains, etc.; which is her other activity. 

Petronila hopes that with the loan her quality of life will improve a bit, she is very happy to continue to work with Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, underwear, as well as to buy potatoes, pear squash, onions, peppers, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miriam de 44 años de edad, es una mujer dedicada a su matrimonio y al cuidado de su hijo de 5 años de edad. Ama su familia y asegura que es el mejor regalo que Dios ha podido darle. En la actualidad se dedica al estampado de camisas y ropa en general, labor que realiza desde su casa con el fin de generar los ingresos necesarios para colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. 
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de pinturas, esmaltes y plástico; necesarios  para realizar los acabados a las prendas.
Sueña con permanecer en familia y tener la oportunidad de ver crecer a su hijo.
texts.en:
Miriam, who is 44 years old, is a woman who is dedicated to her marriage and the care of her 5-year-old son. She loves her family and confirms that it is the best gift that God has been able to give her. Now she works in printing shirts and clothing in general, work that she does from her home with the goal of generating the income necessary to help her husband with the household expenses and offer a better quality of life to her son.

She is applying for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of paints, enamels, and plastic, items that are necessary to do the finishing of the garments. She dreams of staying in her family and having the opportunity to see her son grow up.

loans.use: to buy paints, enamels, and plastic

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Doña Johanna, es una señora muy trabajadora, se dedica por completo a su negocio de pulpería y su esposo vende productos ferreteros, sus hijas ya están más grandes, una  va a la universidad y la otra está en la escuela primaria, para doña Johanna su mayor sueño es poderles dar los estudios a cada una de ellas, es por eso que solicita este crédito para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio para lograr su meta, ella se levanta muy de mañana para poder vender y cumplir con los gastos diarios del hogar.
texts.en:
Johanna is a hardworking woman who dedicates herself completely to her general store.  Her husband sells hardware products.  Her daughters are now older.  One attends university and the other is in primary school.  

Johanna's dream is to be able to allow both of them to attend school.  She is requesting this loan to continue investing in her business so that she can achieve this goal.  She gets up early every morning in order to sell and meet the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase grains, pastries, candy, sodas, dairy products, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es: María Ernestina, habitante del barrio 18 de Marzo una zona muy vulnerable por la delincuencia, tiene la edad de 32 años, madre de dos hijos menores de edad quienes estudian la escuela primaria, su esposo al ver la dificultad de empleo en el país, tuvo que emigrar al vecino país de Costa Rica en busca de trabajo, mientras María tiene una pequeña pulpería con la que busca como salir adelante, es por eso que desea invertir con mas productos con el crédito solicitado para ayudarse con las ventas para responder a las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en: María Ernestina lives in the 18 de Marzo neighborhood; a very unstable zone due to crime.  She’s 32-years-old and mother of two minors attending primary school.  Because of the difficulty in securing employment in the country, her husband had to emigrate to neighboring Costa Rica in search of work while María has a small grocery store she uses to try to find a way to get ahead which is why she’ll invest in more products with the requested loan to help with sales so she can respond to her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, chicken, vegetables and snacks.

loans.name: Jaeriz

texts.es: Estudiante de la carrera de Lic. en Derecho es Jaeriz, de 26 años de edad, trabaja como Asistente en Radiología, con su salario y la ayuda de su pareja logra pagar sus gastos universitarios. Hoy en día está en la etapa final de su profesión, el crédito que solicita es para pagar el curso de especialización de la carrera y una parte de la mensualidad de sus estudios los cuales se había retrasado por problemas económicos, para ella es muy importante culminar sus estudios para aspirar a un mejor empleo y ayudar a la familia.
texts.en: Jaeriz is a student in a Master’s in Law program. Her is 26-years-old and she works as an assistant in radiology. With her salary and the help of her partner, she is able to pay for her university costs. Today she is in the final stages of her profession. The loan that she is requesting is to pay for specialization course of the professional program and to pay one part of the reoccurring fees of her studies that have been delayed due to financial problems. For her it is very important to finish her studies and aspire to a better job and help her family.

loans.use: to pay school dues and a specialization course for her career

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: La señora Juana mujer humilde y trabajadora habita en la cominidad llamada las Dispersas del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su familia lucha dia a dia para salir adelante, desde hace mas de 15 años se dedica al cultivo de la tierra cosechando Cafe, actualmente necesita realizar Mantenimiento a su cultivo para poder combatir las plagas, con este credito  comprara Urea, Completo, Triple etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado
texts.en: Señora Juana is a humble and hard-working woman. She lives with her family in the community called Las Dispersas in the town of Ticuantepe. She strives every day to advance. For more than 15 years she has cultivated the land, harvesting coffee. Now she needs to maintain her plantings to combat pests. With this loan she will buy urea, Completo and Triple fertilizers, etc. She is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva funds have offered her.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Dolores

texts.es: La señora Claudia de 41 años de edad, es estudiante de la carrera de Psicología Clínica, es soltera madre de dos hijos a quienes mantiene con su trabajo como pedagoga atendiendo principalmente a niños con capacidades diferentes; devenga un salario que con dificultad le alcanza para los gastos básicos del hogar y la mensualidad de la universidad. Con este crédito desea pagar el curso de titulación para brindar una mejor atención en su labor y superarse en la vida para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is 41 years old and is studying for a degree in clinical psychology. She is a single mother with two children, whom she supports with her work as a teacher, mainly looking after children with special needs. 

She earns a salary which is barely enough for her basic household expenses and her university fees. With this loan she wishes to pay for the degree completion course, so that she can provide improved care in her work, and succeed in life so that she can help her children.

loans.use: To pay for her degree completion course.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De El Tambo Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Emprendedoras de el Tambo” está conformado por  mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras dedicadas a diversas actividades  para sacar adelanta a sus familias.
 Georgina  Faustina tiene 42 años está casada y tiene dos hijos,  trabaja desde que tiene 18 años vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogo y además una bodega.
Ella está un poco apenada por que sus hijos son varones y no pueden ayudarla a la venta de sus productos, pero si la ayudan en la atención en su bodega en las horas en la que Georgina tiene que ofrecer sus productos.
El préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de productos que se encuentran en promociones y ofertas para obtiene un poco más de ganancias en las ventas. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean completamente profesionales. Ella y todo su grupo están alegres y entusiastas, agradecen a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo obtenido. Georgina luce sonriente,es la primera de la derecha y se encuentra de pie viste un saco a cuadros .En la parte superior derecha, se encuentra la fotografia de la señora  Esmeralda.
texts.en:
The “Las Emprendedoras de el Tambo” group is made up of hardworking and enterprising women who work in different activities to get their families ahead.  

Georgina Faustina is 42 years old. She is married and has two children. She has worked since she was 18 years old selling beauty products via catalog and she also has a small store. She is a little disappointed because her children are boys and they can't help her see her products, but the can help her serve customers in the store when Georgina has to sell her products.

She invested the loan in buying products that are on sale to make a little more profit on the sales. Her biggest wish is for her children to have good careers. She and her whole group are cheerful and enthusiastic. They are very grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan she has been given. Georgina is smiling. She is the first from the right and she is standing with a plaid coat. In the upper right part of the photo, there is a photograph of Esmeralda.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, colognes, powders, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 23 years old. He lives in the small village of Kvareli District with his parents, brother, and grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Shota requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. The family has a vineyard and 0.3 hectares of agricultural land, where aubergine (eggplant) is grown. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. The profits are hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Shota has requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Shota has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. The rural poor are regarded as high risk borrowers because of their low income. 

With his credit Shota will rent agricultural land and sow maize. He will do all the agricultural work there to insure in a good harvest. He will sell the harvested maize at a good price and increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to rent agricultural land and purchase maize seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 36, is married with children. She lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City.

Irene sells foods and softdrinks to earn a living. She has requested a loan to but 5 sacks of rice and softdrinks.

Irene has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of rice and more bottles of softdrinks

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat is 36 and lives with her family in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with seven children, six of whom are in school--the remaining one is too young for school. Rice farming has been the main source for her family’s income for ten years. To earn more income, her husband also catches fish to sell in the village. The current business earns her family about 26,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 16,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Nat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Tomas Eduardo

texts.es:
Tomas,  vive con su compañera de vida y disfruta de dos hijos, no tiene ayuda de familiares. El se dedica al cultivo de maíz y plátano, asimismo es panificador, este oficio lo aprendió como ayudante y hoy en día es empleado, tiene 10 años de realizar el negocio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos necesarios para llevar a cabo el cultivo tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, semilla de maíz; esta inversión le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para la siembra.
Su sueño es aumentar la producción, agregar otro tipo de cultivo, sacar a sus hijos adelante y crecer como micro empresario, asimismo construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Tomas lives with his life companion and enjoys two children, and he does not have help from relatives. He cultivates corn and plantains, and he also sells bread, which he learned as an assistant and today is an employee; he has worked in the business for 10 years. 

The loan that he needs will allow him to buy the necessary supplies to finish the planting, including: compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and corn seeds. This investment will help him to have everything necessary for the sowing. 

His dream is to increase the production, add another type of crop, bring his children forward, grow as a small business owner, and construct his own house.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and corn seeds.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo por lo que requiere de más capital de trabajo para fortalecer el negocio y por la buena atención que la Institución le brinda; este le permitirá comprar llantas, parches, mechas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior  le ayudo a mejorar los ingresos y darle mantenimiento a algunas herramientas; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Ricardo is faced with the need for a new loan because he needs more working capital to strengthen his business. He attributes this to the good service PADECOMSM is providing him.

He will use the new loan to purchase tires, patches and fuses, among other items. The previous loan helped him to improve his earnings and service some tools. His family’s economic conditions and circumstances have optimized.

loans.use: to purchase tires, patches and fuses, among other items.

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSALES”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Liduvina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de mantas, costura de tejidos, costura y venta de trajes, tejidos, venta de condimentos, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Liduvina es integrante, ella indica que dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de autos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por la guía de su madrina, que le enseñó la venta de repuestos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de rodamientos, pernos, llantas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compartir con las socias, el préstamo con pocas garantías.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosales" will start their 4th loan cycle in Pro Mujer at the Senkata central office.  This group has 8 members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Liduvina, who is the President.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including: clothing sales, blanket sales, dressmaking, the production and sales of suits, knitting, condiment sales, and cattle sales.

The loan that they are taking will benefit this group of small businesswomen, including Liduvina.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer 2 years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Now she has a business selling auto parts.  She discloses that she learned this business under the guidance of her godmother, who taught her the spare parts business.

The loan that she is taking now will be used to increase her working capital; she will buy bearings, bolts and wheels from the wholesale businesses in the city of La Paz to later sell from her sales post.  In this way, she can generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she enjoys spending time with the other members, and getting a loan with little collateral.

loans.use: to buy bearings, bolts and wheels

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Дилшод более 13 лет является мясником. Он покупает скот, откармливает несколько недель, режет и продает мясо на своем лавке. Он старается преподнести мясо с высоким качеством местным жителям. Он в данном бизнесе имеет большой опыт. Его отец помогает ему введение бизнеса. Он планирует расширить свой оборотный капитал, так как у него много клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется, что этот займ поможет ему развевать бизнес и увеличить доход.
texts.en:
Dilshod is a hardworking man.  He is married and raising one child.  While his wife is a homemaker, he has been working as a butcher for more than 13 years.  He buys livestock, which he fattens for a few weeks before slaughtering and selling the meat in his store.

Dilshod tries to provide very high quality meat to the local residents.  He has a long experience in this business and is assisted in his professional activity by his father.

Dilshod would like to increase his working capital because he has a large group of customers.  He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy livestock.

He is awaiting your kindness and hopes that this loan will help him to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to increase his butcher shop's working capital.

loans.name: Jardin De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDIN DE ROSAS” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Edelberta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, tejido de mantas, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de calcetines, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Edelberta es integrante, ella indica que hace varios años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de amigas que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por enseñanza de su tía, posteriormente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana y ropa de bebe) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, le crédito, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal association "Jardín de Rosas" is starting its twelfth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. This group is made of eight members and led by a management team where Edelberta is the president. The businesses of its members are varied and include a grocery store, blanket knitting, and the sale of "salchipapas" (mix of sliced pan-fried beef sausages and french fries), baby clothes, socks and cosmetics. 

The loan requested will benefit small microentrepreneurs, among which is Edelberta. She has been with Pro Mujer for several years and joined after being invited by some friends that were already members of the institution. She currently runs a business selling baby clothes. She learned from her aunt and then decided to start her own company. 

She will use the loan to buy stock (wool and baby clothes) in bulk from the trade shows to sell later in her store. This is how she makes a living and brings resources to her household, as she's married and has three children. 

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the savings, the loans, the training and the health area.

loans.use: to buy wool and baby clothes.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 49 years old. He lives in Khulo district with his wife, son, daughter in-law, and 3-year-old grandson. 

Zurab requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a plot of land where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. The family also owns milk cows. Zurab’s wife milks the cows every day to produce dairy products. The harvested products and dairy products are sold at the local markets.

Zurab requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Zurab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, Zurab will open a café. He has a space at the local board building. He plans to do a small renovation, purchase all the needed equipment and products, and open a café. As there are a lot of people working in this building and also a lot of locals going there for civil issues, Zurab will have a good number of clients. He will earn a good profit and try to develop his business more. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To open a café.

loans.name: Salot

texts.en: Salot is aged 29 years and married with two children. Residing in a rural village of the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, she and her husband have been farming rice for more than five years to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR 21,000 per day and she can save about KHR 11,000 each day for future needs. Salot is with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now, she is applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000. With this loan, she is going to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will help her to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina is a 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice for almost 10 years now. 

To be able to continue her farming, Esterlina requested a loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers, medicines, and rice seedlings to improve her yield. Gaining more harvest will provide proper diets and other daily expenses. Esterlina hopes that she will expand her farming business to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, medicines, and additional rice seedlings.

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim is a farmer who has a plantation. He has been in the agricultural business since 1998. He sells his agriculture products at the local market. He has a lot of clients who prefer his goods because he grows vegetables and crops with good quality. He hopes that in the future, he will develop his business and earn more income. 

Halim is a well-bred person and has a good knowledge as he was one of the best pupils at the school. His parents were poor and that’s why he couldn’t to get higher education. He always dreams to earn a high degree. 

Halim has acquired a loan of 10,000 Tajikistan Somonis (TJS) to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He awaits your support and believes that your support will make his living conditions better.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for his land, where he grows potatoes and wheat.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Charlotte did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Charlotte sells clothing and sandals in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been doing this for about three years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have five children. Charlotte uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Charlotte will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of clothing and sandals, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Charlotte wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of clothing and sandals, which will aid her in improving her overall sales in her retail business.

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 40-year-old married man and a father of two children. He has been working in repairing auto bodies and automotive furniture for 15 years. In 2001 he started his own business, and he worked hard enough to develop it.

Talal is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy an old car, repair it, and sell it for a very good price. He is working in this way to increase his income and develop his business more, to make sure that he can reply to almost all of his family and customer needs.

He hopes to move his workshop to the main road so he can attract more customers in the future.

loans.use: To buy an old car, repair it, and sell it for a very good price.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income. 

Since 2003, Kosar has been working as a tailor. She provides stitching services in her community. Her eldest daughter also helps her in stitching up dresses. She has excellent stitching skills and due to the money she generates, she has managed to provide a better quality of life for her family. 

Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to purchase one more sewing machine as her number of customers are increasing day by day. Because she has only one machine, she cannot easily cope with all customers on time and that results in a loss of money and customers. Therefore, as a member of this two-person group, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine, which will allow her to fulfill the demands of customers more efficiently and to elevate her level of income. With the profit amount she will pay for the educational expenses of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

In the picture Kosar is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Priscilla is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling meat in Abura Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years.

Priscilla is married and has 1 child. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their child’s school fees. 

Priscilla wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of meat. In the long term, Priscilla plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 24-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband has been driving a taxi for three years and this is the only source of income for her family.

Right now there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required for the engine of her husband's taxi; because of this, it is almost impossible for him to get some income from it. 

Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi so that he can drive it properly. With the profit amount her husband will buy one more taxi in the future. 

Yasmeen desires to provide quality education to her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to meet the repairing cost of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia needs a loan for her beauty salon. She has been doing this business for 3 years. She will purchase cosmetic products like makeup kits, facial creams, and hair dryers. With the help of this loan she will be able to increase her earnings and to get more customers as she will have  more beauty products. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy runs a warung, a small shop in Indonesian, selling snacks, drinks and other small items in Bogor.  Bogor is about two hours away from Jakarta.  Eddy’s shop is not just a typical warung because Eddy is also a part of the Ruma Network, where he sells mobile phone airtime credit and processes bill payments for customers.  Eddy is excited to be a part of this network because he hopes that these services will bring more customers to the shop and increase his income.  

Eddy lives with his wife and four children.  Since joining Ruma, Eddy is earning on average $50/per day in mobile airtime credit sales.  With support and assistance from Ruma staff, he hopes to grow his business even more.  

Eddy is now offering to process electricity bill payments for customers as a new service.  To do this, he is required to print receipts for these transactions.  He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase this printer so he can offer this new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to print required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en: Nighat is a 38-year-old married woman. She is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of clothes selling for almost two years. She purchases clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market at profitable rates. Nighat is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. Her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend a part of the profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new colorful clothes to sell.

loans.name: Neath

texts.en: Living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Neath is aged 36 years and married with three dependent children. Two are in school while the remaining one is too young for school. Neath and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava for 16 years. The current business earns her about KHR 84,000 per day and she can save about KHR 40,000 each day for future needs. Neath is with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now, she is asking for another loan with VisionFund of KHR 2,000,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cultivated land. She hopes to grow her current business so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cultivated land.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en:
Rahmat runs a small shop selling fertilizers and patched tires in Serang.  Serang is about two hours away from Jakarta.  Rahmat’s shop is not just a typical warung (small shop in Indonesian) because Rahmat is also a part of the Ruma Network, where he sells mobile phone airtime credit and processes bill payments for customers. Rahmat is excited to be a part of this network because he hopes that these services will bring more customers to the shop and increase his income.  

Rahmat lives with his wife and two children.  Since joining Ruma, Rahmat is earning on average $5 - 10/per day in mobile airtime credit sales.  With the support and assistance from Ruma staff, he hopes to grow his business even more.  

Rahmat is now offering to process electricity bill payments for customers as a new service.  To do this, he is required to print receipts for these transactions.  He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase this printer so he can offer this new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to print out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of bowls, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a widow and has one child. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Beatrice is a successful businesswoman. She sells maize and rice in Abura Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 15 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Beatrice uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Beatrice will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and rice, aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and rice.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She usually sells her Banku in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling Banku for 10 years. 

Aba is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their childrens' school fees. 

Aba wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty Banku. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Samlot

texts.en:
Samlot, 50 years old, lives with his family members in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. He has four dependent children. For the last 31 years, he and his wife have been farming rice and planting cassava as the main sources of the family’s income. He also works for others for a fee to earn additional income for his family. The current business earns his family about KHR 50,000 per day. 
This is the first loan for Samlot with VisionFund. He is applying for a loan of KHR 4,000,000. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. He hopes to increase his crop yields and sell it for a good price so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 60 years old. He lives in the small village of Mtskheta District with his wife and granddaughter, who goes to the local school. Elguja requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Elguja works as an builder on private orders and gets income, which is not stable. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the poor subsistence category. 

Elguja requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Elguja has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Elguja will purchase a car. After purchasing a car, he will be able to work as a taxi driver and increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Yoeng

texts.en: Yoeng, aged 40 years old, lives with his family members in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. He has three children, one of whom is dependent on him and still in school. To better support his family, he has been farming rice on three hectares of farmland and planting corn on five hectares of farmland. His wife also supplements the family’s income by selling pork in the village. This is the first micro loan for Yoeng with VisionFund. Now, he is applying for a loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer for his cassava and rice growing. He hopes to increase his crop yields and earn more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cassava and rice growing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Even though Eunice grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Eunice is an entrepreneur. She sells meat in Abura Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). 

Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began one year ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their one child. Eunice has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Therefore she aims to use her loan to purchase more meat to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Eunice wants to break the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Robson

texts.en: Robson is a 40-year-old hard working woman of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, three sons, and four daughters. Her husband is a mobile technician and runs his own shop. Robson is a very experienced and skilled woman. She has been selling bed sheets and cloth for two years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to purchase a new variety of bed sheets and cloth from other cities at a lower rate and then sell it here for profit. She is living in a rented house and she wants to build her own house. This loan could fulfill her dreams and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new bed sheets

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Even though Adwowa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Adwowa is an entrepreneur. She sells palm kennel oil in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). 

Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 3 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. Adwowa has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more palm kennel nuts. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwowa wants to break the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more palm kennel nuts.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Abena sells corndough in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. 

She is married to a photographer, and together they have five children. Abena uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Abena will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of corn, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Abena wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of corn, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Nana Efua

texts.en: Although she has not received a formal education, Nana Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for 20 years. Nana Efua is married and has two children. Her husband works in forestry. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Nana Efua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, Nana Efua plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels for her food sales.

loans.name: Lalarukh

texts.en: Lalarukh is a 43-year-old hardworking mother of four children. Her husband died six years ago, and she is the sole supporter of her family. She is facing a lot of financial problems right now due to the low monthly income and large family size. Lalarukh is using her tailoring skills to generate some income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work for seven years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to purchase a new sewing machine so that one of her daughters can help her in stitching clothes. In this way, her production would increase. She would pay the household expenses after getting the profit.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Kolu

texts.en: Kolu is 30 years old, she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Kolu is married; she completed grade 12 before bearing her children. She has two children aged 13 an 11 years; both are in school and live at home. For the passed ten years, she been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with a little amount from her husband who works as a driver. She learned this business from her mother. Kolu likes her business because of the way she can make money from it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business; she hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her used clothing business,

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1988. She has two little children. She and her husband make aluminum frames to earn a living. Her husband’s income is about 3,500,000 Viet Nam Dongs (VND) per month. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are lacking of capital to enlarge her aluminum store. Her dream is for her children to grow up well and to enlarge her store. This loan is one of steps that will help her reaching these dreams. Phuong is a hardworking and dynamic woman. This job suits her family’s skills.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to make aluminum frames. She always wants to expand her business and raise children up well.

The other member who is part of Phuong's group is Loan, who is 28 years old. She has two children. She is a seller. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell groceries.

loans.use: to buy aluminum to make frames.

loans.name: Khut's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Khut is 42 and married with six children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. 

For the last 20 years, Khut has been farming rice as a primary business for her family. The current business earns her about 60,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to make a living, and she can save about 15,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Khut with Kiva partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Khut is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to have a larger rice crop so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s EK Phnom district, Saret is 55 years old and married with six children. To make a living, she has been planting rice on 1.5-hectare for 40 years as a primary business. The current business earns her about 36,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to support the family’s needs.

Saret‘s group consists of five members who live in the same village and they are just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Saret will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice on time so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Iwan  runs a warung, or a small shop, in Indonesia. He sells snacks, drinks, and other small items in Bogor.  Bogor is about 2 hours away from Jakarta. Iwan’s shop is not just a typical warung; he is also a part of the Ruma Network, where he sells mobile phone airtime credit and processes bill payments for customers.  Iwan is excited to be a part of this network because he hopes that these services will bring more customers to the shop and increase his income.  

Iwan lives with his wife and children. Since joining Ruma, Iwan is earning on average $100 - $200 per day in mobile airtime credit sales.  With the support and assistance from Ruma staff, he hopes to grow his business even more.  

Iwan is now offering to process electricity bill payments for customers as a new service. To do this, he is required to print receipts for these transactions.  He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase this printer so he can offer this new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer for printing out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Mao is 34 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been working as a rice farmer on two hectares of farmland. Her husband complements the income by working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 50,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and save about 25,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Mao with VisionFund and they are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, Mao wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and increase the family’s income so as to improve her standard of living and to fulfill her dream to build a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Jennet is 36 years old; she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, which is one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Jennet is married. She completed grade 4, before bearing her children. She has four children between 20 and one month old. Only three are in school and live at home. For the passed five years, she been selling charcoal. She started this business with a little amount give to her from her husband who works as a driver. She learned this business from her mother; Jennet likes her business because of the way people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business and hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her charcoal sales business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Even though Faustina grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Faustina is an entrepreneur. She sells yams in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 8 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 3 children.

Faustina has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more yams to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina wants to break the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more yams to sell.

loans.name: Buyuni Tazara Group

texts.en:
Mwanaheri, who is in her early 50s, is married with six grown-up children.  She also has seven grandchildren who are still going to school.  She has been a tailor since 1981.  She works from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mwanaheri's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a sewing machine, and to buy different types of materials and sewing equipments. She has managed to successfully pay back all her loans. She used the profit to pay school fees for her seven grandchildren and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more materials and make more dresses and suits to sell. She dreams of building her own house.

Mwanaheri will share this loan with her loan group "BUYUNI TAZARA," which has 13 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials and make more dresses and suits to sell.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en: Lali is 40 years old. She lives in Batumi District with her children: eight-year-old George and 10-year-old Sopho. Lali requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of the low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Lali has a bakery. She bakes pastries and sells them. Her income is really small and it’s hardly enough to feed her children. Lali requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Lali has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of a business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Lali will purchase a bed. She has few empty rooms in her house. After purchasing a bed, Lali will be able to rent the rooms out to tourists. As the Batumi district is a summer tourist area, Lali will have good numbers of clients and earn an additional income. With the increased income she will be able to provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a bed to rent out the rooms for her tourism business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Agnes is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She usually sells her Gari in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling Gari for 2 years. 

Agnes is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their childrens' school fees. 

Agnes wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty Gari. In the long term, Agnes plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She sells sandals in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began seven years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. Efua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more sandals to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more sandals to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Araba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Araba sells porridge in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about five years. She is married and has two children. Araba uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Araba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of ingredients to make porridge, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Araba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of ingredients to make porridge, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Arematha

texts.en:
Arematha is 23 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, which is the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Arematha is single. She completed 12th grade before establishing her business 7 years ago by selling cosmetics such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, and roll-on. She started this business with the little amount from her mother, and she learned this business from her. She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly she enjoys the interaction of her customers. She spends eight hours with her business six days a week.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business, from which she hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 42, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. He is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. For the last 22 years, Mao has been in farming rice, planting cassava, and working as a construction worker to support his family. Sometimes, he works for others for a fee in order to add up more income. The current business earns him about 30,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to meet the family's needs. 
 
Mao is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now he is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for his cassava planting and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more crops so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cassava planting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba is 45 years old: she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, which is one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Kumba is married. She did not go to school, and has seven children whose ages she does not know. Only three are in school and live at home. For the passed five years, she been selling Lappa (traditional clothes used mostly by women). She started this business with a little amount given to her from her husband. She learned this business from her mother. Kumba likes her business because of the way people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business and hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more traditional clothes for her retail business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 49 years old, and she lives and works in Buchanan, which is the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Julia is a widow and she stopped her education in the 7th grade. She has seven children between 10 and 28, only three of whom are in school and live at home. For the past 15 years she been selling dry and fresh fish in the local market. She likes how people respond to her business, and most interestingly she enjoys the interaction of her customers. She spends eight hours with her business six days a week. She started this business with a little amount from her family, and she learned this business from her mother. She likes her business because the ways people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business, hoping to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 50-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and two daughters. Her husband has been running a tire shop for 25 years. Parveen has requested a loan from kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase new tires for the purpose of selling and this would increase his net income and savings. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new tires for her husband's retail business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling maize in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years.

Ama is married and has eight children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their childrens' school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 42 years old. She lives in the small village of Khobi District with her wife and two children, who go to school. Irma requested loans from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow mandarin trees, nut trees, and bay trees. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. In addition, Irma works as a teacher at the local school. It pays hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irma requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Irma has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With her credit, Irma will purchase a milking cow and will renovate shed for the cow. She will produce cheese for selling and will be able to increase her income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow and renovate a shed.

loans.name: Kerbeh

texts.en: Kerbeh is 40 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, which is one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is married, she stopped her education in the 6th grade and has two children between 24 and 3 years old. Only the three-year-old is in school and lives at home. For the passed three years, she has been selling used clothes. Kerbeh started this business with the little amount give to her from her aunty. She learned this business from her. Kerbeh likes her business because of the way people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business and hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her used clothes business.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 36 years old. She lives in the small village of Khoni District with her husband and parents-in-law, who are provided with a retirement pension. Maka requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family start-up business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used in making cheese products. They sell cheese at local markets. Besides this, her husband works as an electrician and gets a small income. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the poor subsistence category. 

Maka requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Maka has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of a business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Maka will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, she will be able to sow vegetables there. The harvested vegetables will be sold at local markets at a good price. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Ing's Group

texts.en: Ing, 50-years-old, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has four children. For the last 30 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as a primary source of the family’s income to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR 50,000 per day and she can save about KHR 27,000 each day for future needs. Ing’s group consists of two members; she is a second cycle client while her group member is a fourth cycle client. She successfully used the first loan to better support her family’s living. Now, she and her group members are applying for a loan of KHR 1,200,000 each. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Regina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling maize in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Regina is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Regina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Teclaire Régine

texts.fr: Téclaire est une jeune femme de 29 ans célibataire. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Téclaire is a young 29-year-old single woman. After her training, she opened a hair salon and has been managing it now for ten years. She has the problem of often lacking cosmetics, hair extensions, and hair weaves in her shop because she buys these products at retail. 

She is asking for a loan so she can buy her merchandise at wholesale, allowing her to satisfy her customers and earn more.

The earnings from this loan will help meet her needs and those of her family. They will also be saved to [help] expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of hair weaves and cosmetics

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de trois femmes dévouées qui ont comme activités principales le commerce et l'élevage.

Madame Khady la responsable est âgée de 65 ans, elle est mariée mère de 6 enfants. Elle mène une activité de commerce de poissons fumés et de légumes, fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine. Elle est debout à droite couverte d'un châle beige et a levé la main gauche.


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter des paniers de poissons fumés et des légumes à revendre pour se faire beaucoup de revenus; et aussi des bœufs pour augmenter son troupeau.


Elle recycle ses bénéfices pour maximiser ses profits et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three devoted women who primarily engage in commerce and raise animals for a living. 

Khady is the leader of the group. She is 65 years old, married, and a mother of six children. She sells smoked fish and vegetables and also raises cattle. She is standing on the right [of the photo] covered in a beige shawl raising her hand.

With this loan, she hopes to buy baskets of smoked fish and vegetables to resell, so she can make a lot of profit and also add some cows to her herd. 

She re-uses her earnings to maximse her profits and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria de oficio comerciante se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas, fue beneficiada con un crédito Kiva que le permitió comprar mentira prima para mejorar su producción  de tortillas, está muy agradecida con la oportunidad que obtuvo. 
Desea producir más tortillas y es por eso que usara el crédito para comprar maíz, leña  y cal al por mayor pues así conseguirá un mejor precio por la materia prima y mantendrá los precios a su clientela. Además ir mejorando su humilde cocina y los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria's business is making and selling tortillas.  The previous Kiva loan she received allowed her to buy raw materials to improve her tortilla production; and she is very grateful for that opportunity.

Now she wants to make more tortillas and plans to use a new loan to buy corn, firewood and lime wholesale.  This is so she can get a better price on the raw materials and keep prices low for customers.  She also wants to renovate her humble kitchen and improve her household income.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdourahmane, marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’ainé a 16 ans et le cadet, 11 est un client récemment inscrit à l’IMCEC. Depuis 4 ans,  Abdourahmane achète des ensembles lins, qu’il replace  dans le quartier mais surtout parmi ses collègues, car il est enseignant de profession et le commerce n’est qu’une activité parallèle pour augmenter ses sources de revenus.
Il prend en charge sa famille et s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne.
Dans l’avenir, il désire acquérir un magasin afin de pouvoir stocker de la marchandise et pourquoi ne pas varier  et diversifier son commerce.
texts.en:
Abdourahmane is married and a father of three children, of whom the oldest is 16 and the youngest is 11. He recently became a member of UIMCEC.

Abdourahmane is a teacher by profession. [But] for the last four years, he has [also] been buying linen sets and selling them in the neighborhood and to his colleagues. This is a side-business that increases his sources of income.

He takes care of his family and their everyday expenses.

In the future, he wants to acquire a shop in order to stock his merchandise and to vary and diversify his commerce.

loans.use: to buy linen sets for men and women to resell

loans.name: Ndéné

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndéné est devenu membre de l’IMCEC  depuis Février 2013. Il exerce le métier de photographe-caméraman depuis 10 ans. Il est marié et père de 2 ans respectivement âgé de 3 ans et de 21 mois. Ndéné a besoin d’un crédit de  150000F  afin d’aménager son studio en y installant des chaises, achetant un Playstation et un appareil numérique. C’est grâce  aux revenus de son activité qu’il arrive à s’occuper de sa famille et de payer la location de son atelier.
Ndéné travaille de 8h à 23h car il est passionné par son métier d’ailleurs il veut toujours améliorer son activité et augmenter ses fonds.
texts.en:
Ndéné became a member of UIMCEC in February of 2013. He has been a photographer/cameraman for ten years. He is married and a father of two children, who are 3 years old and 21 months old. 

Ndéné needs a loan of 150,000 francs in order to upgrade his studio by installing chairs and buying a Playstation and a digital camera.

Thanks to his earnings from this business, he can take care of his family and pay the rent of his studio. 

Ndéné works from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m., because he is passionate about his work. Moreover, he always wants to improve his business and increase his funds.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera and upgrade his studio by installing a Playstation to diversify his photography business

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
