41-year-old Mamia lives in Tsageri district with his 40 year old wife Zoia, his retired mother, and two sons (3 and 5 years old). Mamia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
Mamia's family run an agricultural business. They have milk cows and a vineyard. Zoia is milking the cows for producing dairy products. Mamia is making wine and vodka from the harvested grapes. He is also working at the local school as a teacher on a small monthly salary.
Mamia requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Mamia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Mamia will purchase grocery stocks to open a grocery shop. He already has a commercial space, which will be used as a shop. Mamia is very enthusiastic to develop the new family business. He will work hard and long hours to serve as many clients as possible. Mamia will be reinvesting part of the profit in the same field to expand the stocks and offer a better choice of products to the clients. Another part of his income he will use for improving his family living conditions and providing a better future for his children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks to open a grocery shop

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 23 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his 22-year-old wife Diana, who is a student. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
George is working in a cleaning company on a small monthly salary, which is the only source of the income for the family. It’s rarely enough to cover all the monthly expenses, especially to pay Diana’s studying fees. 
George requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit George will purchase equipment to open a car washing center. He has already rented a space, which was used as a car washing center before as well. After purchasing all the needed equipment George will wash cars and also carpets. As this place is already known among the locals, and since George will offer them new services, such as washing the carpets, he will have good numbers of clients. George is a very hard working man. He wants to earn more income to provide for his wife's studying and improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to open a car washing center

loans.name: 14 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “14 DE DICIEMBRE”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa de bebe, confección de polleras, venta de mantas, tejido de mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de libros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mary es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un pequeño capital que le dio su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "14 DE DICIEMBRE" is in its fifth loan cycle of the Pro Mujer program at the Senkata social center.  The group is comprised of eight members whose board is directed by Mary, the president.  The group's diverse businesses include: selling baby clothes, making regional costumes, selling blankets, weaving blankets, knitting sweaters, selling clothing, selling cosmetics and book sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners such as Mary, who is a member of the group.  She has been in the Pro Mujer program for three cycles and joined through an invitation from her mother who is a member of the institution.  Her current business is selling baby clothing and she began it with a small amount of capital that her mother gave her.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her working capital to buy clothing from wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz.  She will then sell it at her small stall.  This means of income allows her to generate resources to maintain her family comprised of her common-law husband and five children.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she says it is enjoying the company of the other members.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans qui consiste à vendre de l’huile de palme. Elle est bien connue dans le quartier et les clients viennent chez elle pour acheter la marchandise.
Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’ainé est tailleur et tous les deux appuient le chef de famille dans les charges de la maison.
Elle veut améliorer son commerce en voyant son capital augmenter avec l’appui d’une Institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Awa has been selling palm oil for more than ten years. She is well known in the area, and her customers come to her home to buy her goods.

Awa is married and a mother of seven children, of whom the oldest is a tailor. Awa and her oldest child both help Awa's husband with the household expenses.

Awa wants to improve her business and see her capital grow with the help of the financial institution UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to resell

loans.name: Rositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Herminia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de papa, venta de ropa nueva, ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Herminia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que la visito en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con una mercadería que pudo comprar con los préstamos sacados en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ROSITAS" is beginning its fourth cycle in the Pro Mujer women's program at the social center Los Andes.  It is comprised of eight members whose board is directed by Herminia, the president.  The diverse businesses of the members include: weaving of blankets, sales of potatoes, sales of new clothing and hardware sales.

The loan they are requesting will help the small business owners, including Herminia who has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years.  She joined by invitation from a consultant from the institution who visited her at home.  Her current business is selling clothing and she started it with merchandise she bought with loans through Pro Mujer.

The loan she is requesting now is to buy clothing at wholesale markets so she can sell it at her stall.  This means of income allows her to generate resources to maintain her household.  She is married and has nine children.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she says it is the credit, training and health area.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 28 years old and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. Buchanan is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Kebbeh is married. She stopped her education in second grade. Kebbeh has two children between 3 and 13 years old; only one is in school, and two of them live at home. For the past three years, Kebbeh has been selling pepper, bitter ball, bananas, oranges etc. She started this business with a little amount from her aunty, who she learned this business from. Kebbeh likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business, and hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Even though Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She sells doughnuts in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 7 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 4 children. Ekua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, Ekua aims to use her loan to purchase more sugar, oil, and flour. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, oil, and flour

loans.name: Digna Maribel

texts.es:
Digna, está casada, vive con su hijo y la nuera. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, asimismo un molino, el oficio lo aprendió de su esposo y ya tiene más de 26 años de desempeñarlo, su deseo es ampliar  el negocio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos de frutas  y verduras tales como: papaya, manzanas, repollo, chiles, cebollas, ejotes, zanahorias, entre otros; asimismo comprar ladrillo de piso para terminar una cochera;  este le ayudara a invertir en lo necesario y así obtener ingresos para los gastos del hogar.
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio y mejorar su vivienda, incrementar los ingresos  y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Digna is married and lives with her son and daughter-in-law.  She sells fruits and vegetables and also runs a mill, having learned the trade from her husband.  She has been in business for over 26 years and wants to expand it.

The loan she is requesting is to buy fruits and vegetables such as papaya, apples, cabbage, peppers, onions, green beans, carrots, etc; as well as buy brick flooring to finish her garage.  This will help her obtain what she needs to earn an income to cover household expenses.

Her goal is to expand her business and renovate her home, while increasing her income and giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell, and buy brick flooring to finish her garage.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old. She lives in Samtredia District with her husband, 2-year-old son, and grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Ana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family has no source of income. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Ana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Ana will begin a trade in clothing. She plans to purchase clothing from the wholesalers in Turkey and then resell at higher prices in Samtredia District. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 31 years old, and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. Buchanan is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Alice is married. She completed grade 12, before establishing her business five years ago, selling fashion clothes such as blouses, jean trousers, t-shirts etc. Alice started this business with a little amount from her mother, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly she enjoys the interaction with her customers. Alice spends ten hours with her business, six days a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business, and hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is 31 years old, and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. Buchanan is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Joanna is married. She completed grade 12, before establishing her business seven years ago, selling rice by the cup. Joanna started this business with a little amount from her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. Joanna likes how people respond to her business, and mostly she enjoys the interaction with her customers. Joanna spends 8 hours with her business, six days a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business, and hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 49 years old, and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. Buchanan is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Alice is married and has five children between 20 and 31 years old, all of whom are living on their own. Alice stopped her education in third grade. For the past thirty years she been selling fresh fish, frozen chickens, pig's feet, etc. Alice started this business with a little amount from her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. Alice likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business, and hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling salted fish in Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Efua is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of salted fish. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of salted fish

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Nashon, who is in his late 30s, is married with three children, who are still going to school. Nashon has been running a barber shop for two years now. He works from 7.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Nashon's 2nd loan from Tujijennge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to repair the shop by painting the walls and bought salon equipment which was out of stock. He has paid his loan back successfully. Nashon used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more and advanced shaving machines and more salon equipment to make the salon more attractive to customers. His dream is to one day be able to open another barber shop in a different place.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Tanzanite" with thirteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more and advanced shaving machines and more salon equipment to make the salon more attractive to customers.

loans.name: Yeimy Arely

texts.es:
Yeimy,  es una persona muy reconocida en la comunidad, vive actualmente con sus padres, su compañero de vida y una hija de 4 años de edad, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y juguetes, oficio que lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, lo desempeña desde hace 4 años, tres días por la semana de 6:00am a 12:00pm, la ventaja que tiene es que los productos son apreciados por sus clientes.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar blusas, camisas, pantalones, chores, entre otros y juguetes tales como: muñecas, rompecabezas, juego de cocina, etc. Este le ayudara a surtir mas el negocio, obtener mayores ingresos y así adquirir un negocio más rentable, uno de los riesgos seria la competencia que hoy en día se vive.
Su sueño es crecer en su tarea para seguir trabajando y así generar más utilidades, con ello brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yeimy is a very well-known person in her community.  She currently lives with her parents, her partner and her four-year-old daughter.  She does not have family members abroad.  Yeimy's business is selling clothing and toys.  She learned this on her own initiative and has been in the business for four years.  She works three days a week, from 6.00am to 12.00pm.  The advantage she has in her business is that her products are popular with her customers.

Yeimy needs this loan to buy blouses, shirts, pants (trousers), shorts, etc. and also toys such as dolls, puzzles, kitchen sets etc.  This will help her to further stock her business, make more income and have a more profitable business.  One of the risks she has would be the competition that she faces.

Yeimy's dream is to grow in her business so that she can continue working and make more profits so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, dolls, puzzles and toy kitchen sets

loans.name: Unión Mariscal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN MARISCAL”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de comida, ayudante de albañil, trenzado de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió porque no encontró otro medio de generación económica, en la actualidad le va muy bien.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The 'Unión Mariscal' community bank are starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office.  The group has seven members and is run by a board of directors with Justina as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling meat, selling food, working as a builder's assistant and knotting blankets.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these small micro-businesswomen.  Justina, one of the group's members, says that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined through an invitation from her friend who is an existing member.  Justina has a business selling food.  She says that she learned this trade because she couldn't find any other way of making money.  Her business is currently doing very well.

Justina will use this loan to increase her capital, purchasing rice, oil and other products wholesale in the street markets in the city of El Alto.  She will then use them to make her food and sell it from her sales location.  This work allows her to make the money she needs to support her household as well as she can.  She is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Justina replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María,  vive con su compañero de vida y sus seis hijos que son los que le ayudan en el trabajo agropecuario, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos,  crianza de ganado y cerdos, oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres y lo realiza desde temprano la mañana hasta las 4:00pm, la ventaja que posee es que lo lleva a cabo en terreno propio. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos necesarios para el cultivo tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas; este le ayudara a fortalecer la cosecha y obtenerla libre de plagas para poder comercializarlo.
Su sueño es trabajar para logar un buen rendimiento en sus cosechas y obtener ingresos favorables para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her partner and her six children who help her with her farm work.  She does not have family members abroad.  María grows basic grains and raises cattle and pigs.  She learned this business from her parents and currently works from early in the morning until 4.00pm.  The advantage that she has in her business is that she owns her own land.

The loan that María needs will allow her to buy the inputs she needs for her crops such as fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides.  This will help her to strengthen her harvest and ensure that it is free of problems so that she can sell it.

María's dream is to enjoy a good yield from her crops and to make good income so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor es una jovencita de 19 años de edad que vive en la casa de sus suegros en compañía de su esposo y su pequeño hijo.Su principal actividad es la preparación de productos lácteos por eso todas las mañana acompaña a su esposo a sus terrenos a sacar leche de sus vacas para luego proceder con la preparación del queso y venderlos en su mismo pueblo o enviarlos a otra ciudad.Al principio se le hizo muy difícil ya que no contaban con liquidez económica para que compren más ganados razón por la cual no tenian tanta producción,  pero gracias al apoyo de su familia lograrón aumentar sus ganados y así mismo la producción de leche y de queso.Como una mujer emprendedora Flor, espera sacar adelante su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor producto y de calidad.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su producción y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is a 19-year-old young woman who lives with her parents-in-law with her husband and small son.  Her main business is making dairy products.  Every morning she and her husband go milk the cows so they can make cheese and sell it in their village or send it to another city.  At first things were difficult because they did not have enough money to buy more cattle so production was limited.  But thanks to support from their family they were able to increase their livestock and milk and cheese production.

Like other women entrepreneurs, Flor wants to make her small business flourish so she can supply her customers with the best quality products.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the opportunity.  The loan will be very useful for her work.  She is requesting 1,500 PEN to buy a cow to increase production and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Deli

texts.es:
Deli tiene 44 años de edad , es madre soltera de una hija adolescente con quien vive en su casa propia.Deli se dedica a la venta de comida todos los fines de semana se dirige a un pueblo cercano que se encuentra a una horade su vivienda para realizar su actividad, suele vender pollo asado , plátano asado y comida variadas. Hace 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad siempre contando con el apoyo de su hija.Al principio se le hizo muy difícil dedicarse a este negocio ya que no contaba con liquidez económica para la compra de los insumos, y no tenía el lugar indicado para este negocio pero gracias a Dios y al apoyo de su familia pudo salir adelante.
Lo que ahora espera con la ganancia de sus ventas es mejorar su puesto de venta para luego abrir un local propio.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos tales como arroz, carnes , verduras y otros productos que utilizará en la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Deli, 44, is a single mother. Her teenage daughter lives with her in a house of their own. Deli sells food. Every weekend, she travels to a town located one hour from her house. She sells roasted chicken, roasted plantain and varied preparations. She has been doing this for three years now, with her daughter’s support. It was difficult at the beginning because she lacked liquidity to buy the supplies she needed and because she did not have a proper place where to sell her food. However, thanks to God and her family’s support, she could get ahead with her business. Deli hopes to improve her food stall with the profits she makes, and in the future open her own establishment. 

This is Deli’s first loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the opportunity she is given to receive financing, something that will be useful for her working life. This time, she is requesting 1,500 soles [PEN] to buy supplies such as rice, different kinds of meat, vegetables and other ingredients needed to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, different kinds of meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Isabel Crisitina

texts.es:
Isabel, es una humilde comerciante, de 58 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León, madre soltera de un hijo. Ella es de procedencia muy humilde se crio trabajando desde muy pequeña, vendiendo en las calles. Comenzo vendiendo artículos plásticos de forma ambulante, después trabajo en la venta de productos para higiene personal. Pero desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender frutas, galletas, snacks. A ella le gustaría tener un puesto más amplio de frutas en el mercado donde puede vender al por mayor es uno de sus anhelos. 
Hoy esta requiriendo el crédito para comprar frutas de temporada. Este crédito le permitirá surtir su negocio y lograr agregar más productos como snacks y dulces para vender.
texts.en:
Isabel is a humble merchant. She is 58 years old and lives in the city of León. She is the single mother of one son. She is from a very humble background and was raised to work from the time she was very small, selling in the streets. She started selling plastic items as a street vendor, and then worked selling personal hygiene products. For the last 5 years she has sold fruit, cookies and snacks. She would like to have a bigger spot to sell fruit in the market where she can sell wholesale. That is one of her biggest wishes. 

Today she needs the loan to buy fruit in season. This loan will allow her to stock her business and add more products such as snacks and candies to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.es:
Alejandro, le surge la necesidad de un prestamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el oficio de carpintería; este le permitirá comprar los materiales necesarios para llevar a cabo dicha actividad, tales como: madera, pintura, herramientas, chapas, pleibo, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su inventario e incrementar sus ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Alejandro is requesting this loan as he needs more working capital to continue investing in his carpentry business.  This will allow him to buy the materials he needs to carry out his work such as wood, paint, tools, metal sheets, plywood, etc.

His previous loan helped him to improve his inventory and increase his income.  His financial situation and his family situation have both improved.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, tools, metal sheets, plywood, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda I Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESMERALDA I”  iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhannet es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cereales, confección de pantalones, servicio de baño público, venta de ropa de bebe, carpintería, macramé de mantas, tejido de gorros, venta de regalos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhannet es integrante, ella indica que es hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de joyas; este negocio lo aprendió de su tía a la que acompañaba a las ferias de Perú y Bolivia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de joyas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera, pero aún vive con su madre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el interés bajo y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “ESMERALDA I” communal bank will begin its nineteenth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Alto Lima center. It is made up of eleven members and is led by a board of directors, of which Jhannet is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the bank have are varied. They include: selling grains, making pants, running a public bathroom, selling baby's clothing, carpentry, macrame blankets, knitting hats, selling gifts.

The loan they will take out will benefit these small businesswomen, one of which is Jhannet. She says that she has been in Pro Mujer for six years. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling jewelry. She learned this business from her aunt, whom she used to accompany to the fairs in Peru and Bolivia.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying jewelry materials she will acquire at the markets in the city of El Alto and after making them she will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her home as best she can, because she still lives with her mother.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the low interest rates and the training.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Tulipanes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TULIPANES”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delfina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de calzados, venta de carne de cordero, venta de estuco, venta de faldas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delfina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de equipos de juego para niños; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de sus amigos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carruseles para niños) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Tulipanes” community bank are starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela regional office.  The group has six members and is run by a board of directors which has Delfina as its secretary.  The businesses that the members are engaged in are varied and include: selling vegetables, running a neighborhood store, selling footwear, selling lamb, selling plaster and selling skirts.

The loan they are requesting will benefit these small micro-businesswomen.  Delfina, a member of this group, says that this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on her own initiative.  She currently has a business selling children's play equipment.  She started this business on the recommendation of her friends.

The loan that she is taking out will be used to increase her capital and she will purchase children's play equipment from wholesalers to later sell from her own sales location.  This work allows her to make money so that she can support her household as well as she can.  She is a widow and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Delfina replied that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy children's play equipment

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de la tienda que posee; este le permitirá comprar productos de primera necesidad tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, aceite, bebidas, golosinas, papel higiénico, jabón, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
José needs more working capital to continue investing in his store.  This will allow him to buy basic household products such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, oil, drinks, candies, toilet paper, soap, etc.

José's previous loan helped him to increase his stock levels and make more income.  His financial situation and his family situation have both improved.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, oil, drinks, candies, toilet paper, soap, etc.

loans.name: Elvi

texts.es:
Elvi, de 28 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.La actividad laboral de Elvi consiste en brindar servicio de peluquería y estética en general. Tiene un local acondicionado en su vivienda en donde atiende a los clientes que requieren de algún corte de cabello, tintes, iluminaciones y otros. Del mismo modo realiza tratamientos capilares, cuidado facial y otorga servicios de maquillaje, peinados, tratamientos de pies y manos a señoras o señoritas que acudirán a eventos o reuniones sociales como matrimonios o celebraciones de 15 años. Tiene tarifas establecidas para cada uno de los servicios que brinda y siempre es muy solicitada gracias  a los precios cómodos y a la calidad de su trabajo. Lleva en este negocio más de 2 años y trabaja sola. Durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando aprendió mucho y reforzó algunos tratamientos que ya conocía por el bien de sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos artículos que usa en su trabajo como tintes, champú y diversos cosméticos para maquillaje.
texts.en:
Elvi is 28 years old. She is an enterprising and very hardworking woman. She is married and has 2 children with whom she lives in a home she owns. Elvi's work activity is offering a hair styling and general styling services. She has a locale set up in her home where she serves her customers who need a haircut, color, highlights and more. She also does hair treatments, treatments, and makeup, hairstyling, foot and hand treatments for women or girls who are going to social events such as weddings or quinceaneras. She has set fees for each of the services she offers and she is much in demand thanks to her comfortable prices and the quality of her work. She has been in this business for more than 2 years and she works alone. During the time she has been working she has learned a lot and she reinforced some treatments that she already knew for the good of her customers. At this time, she will ask for S/. 1000. She is very excited to have the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time.

With the amount she has asked for, she will buy different items that she uses at work, such as dyes, shampoo and different cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy products such as dyes, cosmetics, scissors and more.

loans.name: Arelis Jose

texts.es:
Arelis, vive en la ciudad de León, casada, estudio administración de empresas. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercadería en General como joyas de plata y acero, perfumes, cosméticos, su mama la impulso a que comenzara su propio negocio ya que no encontraba trabajo en la carrera que estudio entonces que generara ingresos por ella misma. Hoy en día tiene bastante clientela en especial las amas de casas y las que trabajan en empresas privadas. Es así como ha logrado salir adelante y no rendirse ante la situación económica y escasez de trabajo. 
Hoy está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar joyas de plata y acero de diferentes estilos, tamaños y colores. Esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad a su clientela sobre todo durante la temporada del mes de las madres que las ventas tienden a subir.
texts.en:
Arelis lives in the city of León. She is married and studies business administration. Right now, she sells general merchandise such as silver and steel jewelry, perfume, and cosmetics. Her other encouraged her to start her own business since she couldn't find a job in her major so she should make income on her own. Today she has a lot customers, especially housewives and women who work in private businesses. That is how she has gotten ahead and not given up faced with the economic situation and lack of work. 
 
Today she is asking for the loan to buy silver and steel jewelry in different styles, sizes and colors. This will allow her to offer more variety to her customers, especially during mother's day season when sales tend to increase.

loans.use: to buy silver and steel jewelry.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives with his family in the small city of Stepanavan, which is in the area of Lori. Vardan is a father of two children, a daughter who is a student at Yerevan State University in the Department of Tourism and a son who works abroad. 

Vardan and his wife have been engaged in farming for many years. They have a small cattle barn where they keep four cows. The main and decent income that they earn comes from the sale of milk to the factory. 

Vardan has decided to enlarge his cattle-breeding business and to buy two calves. This is the second time that he has applied for a Kiva loan, relying on Kiva lenders' kindness and support. He asks for a loan of 500,000 AMD for this purchase.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Hanselyn

texts.en:
Hanselyn is 21 years old and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Hanselyn is single. She completed 12th grade before establishing her business six years ago, selling cosmetics such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, roll-on, etc. She started this business with a little money from her mother, and she learned this business from her. She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly she enjoys the interaction with her customers. She spends 8 hours a day with her business, six days a week.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 35 years old and married to Lucy. They are blessed with four children. He has been in this business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of about KES 43,000. He has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

He will use the anticipated profits to take his children to boarding schools. His hope and dream is to have an excellent and healthy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Manuchar

texts.en:
Manuchar is 29 years old. He lives in a small village in the Chokhatauri District with his mother, Rusudan. Manuchar has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up. However, he has not had success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family comes from their agricultural activities. Specifically, they have two milking cows, five calves, a pig and piglets. Rusudan produces cheese products and sells them at the local markets. They have 0.6 hectares of agricultural land, where 500 nut trees are grown. They sell 400 to 500 kg of nuts seasonally and at a good price. It is hardly enough to put food on the table for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manuchar has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Manuchar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up credit with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his loan, Manuchar will purchase a tractor. This will enable him to receive orders to transport wood, thereby increasing the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Joudi Group

texts.en:
Evelyn is the featured borrower of Joudi's group. She is the first one from the right. She, along with the other group members, has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. She and the other group members have been friends since they came to Lebanon to earn a living.

Evelyn works as a housekeeper. She is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has applied for a loan to pay for her children's education fees.

Judianne is the one in the middle. She is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She also works as a housekeeper in order to provide her children with the best living. The money she receives from the loan will be sent to her family in the Philippines.

loans.use: To pay her children's education fees.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 28 years old and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Margaret is married. She did not go to school, and has seven children whose ages she does not know, only three of whom are in school and  live at home. For the past five years she has been selling rice, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a little money from her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. She likes her business because of the way people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business, and she hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Al-Zhra Group

texts.en:
Al-Zhra is a group that is composed of three women: Mnal, Samiah, and Amal. They are hardworking, enterprising women who do not give up easily. Currently they are requesting a loan of 210,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB in order to increase their business levels. 

Mnal is 36 years old and a married woman. She has sold incense and perfumes to customers for many years. She is able to attract good customers. She would like to apply for a second loan to start selling different types of goods, so she applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy rechargeable mobile cards to sell in order to increase her capital. She thanks Kiva lenders for financing her first loan and she hopes to be provided for in this loan as well.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es: Eustaquio, es un humilde pero trabajador comerciante quien se dedica a vender ropa de manera ambulante. Se siente agradecido por ser beneficiado con su primer crédito Kiva el cual utilizo para comprar mercadería tales como ropa para dama y caballero. Hoy en día cuenta con más clientes y nuevas zonas para vender. Es por tal motivo que este necesitando el crédito para comprar vestidos, jeans, bóxer, calcetas, camisas, blusas. Pues desea aprovechar la temporada alta del mes de las madres que es cuando el comercio experimenta un incremento en las ventas.
texts.en: Eustaquio is a humble but hard-working salesman whose business is selling clothing as an itinerant street vendor.  He feels grateful for his first Kiva loan which benefited him as he used it to buy merchandise (men's and women's clothing).  He now has more customers and new areas in which to sell.  For this reason, he needs a new loan to buy dresses, jeans, boxer shorts, socks, shirts and blouses.  He would like to make the most of the peak season around Mothers Day as this is when his business experiences an increase in sales.

loans.use: to buy dresses, jeans, boxer shorts, socks, shirts and blouses

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 25-year-old beautician, single and a mother of a four-year-old daughter. She operates a salon on the outskirts of Narok town, Kenya, earning a monthly income of about KES 10,000. She learned about KADET LTD  from one of her regular customers.

Beatrice has successfully paid her first loan and has applied for a second loan of KES 10,000 which will facilitate her in the purchase of hair weaves, extensions, conditioners and other oils needed for her busy salon. She hopes to use the proceeds to educate her daughter. Her dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and hair oils.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 30 years old and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Amie is married. She completed 12th grade and has a two-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past four years she has been selling peppers, bitter ball, bananas and oranges, etc. She started this business with a little money from her husband, and she learned this business from her mother.

She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. She spends 8 hours a day with her business, six days a week. Amie is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Jaimito Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JAIMITO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chicharrones, venta de enseres y ropa, venta de café, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de tela y tenis.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas de grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y enseres en general; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, el área de salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The Jamito community bank is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office.  The group has ten members and is run by a board of directors which has María as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling pork rinds, household goods, coffee, food, groceries, fabric and sports shoes.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these micro-businesswomen.  Marïa is a member of this group and she says that she has belonged to Pro Mujer for six months, joining through an invitation from her friends who were existing members of the institution.  She currently has a business selling clothing and general household products.  She points out that she started this business on her own initiative.

María is taking out this loan to increase her working capital.  She will buy clothing from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and then re-sell them from her own sales stall.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, María replied that she likes the health services and the training.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta,está casada con José y tiene 5 hijos de 21, 19, 17, 5 y 3 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su propia casa.Felicita se dedica a la carpintería labor que comparte con su pareja. Realiza su trabajo en un pequeño taller instalado en su propia casa, se inició comprando algunas maquinas de corte de madera gracias al dinero que lograron ahorrar por algún tiempo. Atienden pedidos de clientes en pequeñas proporciones, aunque asegura que la capacidad productiva de su negocio va en aumento con el correr del tiempo. Cumple esta función cerca de 11 años, inicialmente trabajaba solamente con la ayuda de su esposo, pero ahora tienen dos obreros más que les brindan el apoyo necesario en todas las funciones que realizan.Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le genera continuamente el dinero necesario para solventar los gastos de su hogar, así como la educación de sus hijos y otros aspectos, por esa razón ahora planea ampliar el área del establecimiento que usa para realizar su trabajo y además espera realizar diferentes muebles o accesorios de madera para empezar a vender en grandes cantidades. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos implementos como madera, pegamentos, laca y barnices que requiere para brindar un mejor acabado a los artículos que produce.
texts.en:
Felicita is 40 years old and she is a hard-working and enthusiastic woman.  She is married to Jose and they have 5 children who are 21, 19, 17, 5, and 3 years old.  They all live together in their own home.  Felicita works as a carpenter with her husband.  She began doing this work in a small shop in her home.  She began by buying some wood-cutting machinery thanks to money that she was able to save over time.  She acquired customers little by little and her production increased so that her business grew over time.  She has worked in this capacity for 11 years, initially by working alone with the help of her husband, but now she has two employees that help her in all areas of the business.

She enjoys her work because she continually generates the income that she needs to pay her household expenses, along with the cost of education for her children and other expenses. She is now planning to increase the size of her workshop because she wants to make different types of furniture and wood accessories and sell them in large quantities.  In order to make this dream come true, she is seeking a loan of 1,500 soles.  She is very thankful for the financial support that she is receiving so that she can continue with her work.  With this money she will buy various materials such as wood, pigments, lacquer and varnishes that she needs to create a better finish on the items she produces.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, lacquer, pigments, and more.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 52 years old. She lives in the Samtredia District with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Nino requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nino trades with meat at the local bazaar. Her husband works as a butcher. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nino requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Nino will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built they will be able to grow vegetables there and sell them at a good price. This will increase the income of their family. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Grace is married and she has seven children between 19 and 3 years old, only six of whom are in school and live at home. She completed 11th grade before establishing her business seven years ago, selling cosmetics such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, roll-on, etc. She started this business with a little money from her mother, and she learned this business from her.

She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly she enjoys the interaction with her customers. She spends 8 hours a day with her business, six days a week.  Grace is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is a 65-year-old retired woman. She lives alone in Shalauri village in the Telavi district. Venera requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Venera owns a small plot of agricultural land where maize is grown. The harvested product is sold at the local market. Her additional income is a monthly pension. 

Venera requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Venera will purchase a small stock of groceries. She has a commercial space in front of her house that will be used for selling the products. She plans in the future to use the profit and add a bakery to her shop. She will bake pastries and sell them to earn more income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a small stock of groceries.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 32 years old and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Hawa is single. She did not go to school. She has four children between 8 years and 5 months old, only three of whom are in school. They all live at home. For the past five years she has been selling roll-on, body creams, sprays, etc. She started this business with a little money from her fiancee, and she learned this business from her mother.

She likes her business because of the way people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 50 years old. He lives in Senaki District with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, an infant granddaughter and his mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Malkhaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Malkhaz has an auto workshop, where he works as an artisan and repairs damaged cars. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Malkhaz requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Malkhaz will rent a commercial space and open a grocery shop. He will purchase a stock of groceries for resale. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and open a grocery store

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a young and pleasant lady who lives with her small family in Gegharkunik region. She is 39 years old; she is married, but her husband is in the Russian Federation, abroad for work. Their two children, a girl and a boy, are grown up and they are already students. 

Susanna has graduated from Dilajan Medical College and she has a qualification as a nurse.  After graduating and till now she has been working at the Sevan Psychiatric Hospital as a nurse. Together with her work she manages farming, on not a very big farm, and land cultivating. She has two cows, two calves and five sheep. The main income they have is from selling milk and cheese, since the money that her husband sends them, barely covers the family’s needs.

Susanna has taken a loan from Nor Horizon five times and she has successfully paid back on time. This time she decided to take out a loan with Kiva and she is asking for a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to buy one more cow. She will wait hopefully for Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Idalia Mercedes

texts.es: Idalia, 35 años de edad, madre de soltera, tiene 2 hijos , se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, tiene 3 años con esta actividad. La cual inicio con muy poco capital vendiendo de manera ambulante, en  barrios y comunidades en las afueras de León. Un proyecto que quiere realizar para conseguir otros ingresos poner un puesto de venta de piñatas y accesorios para eventos y celebraciones es una mujer que le gusta progresar y es muy activa siempre buscando como salir adelante para buscar un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Hoy está solicitando el crédito para comprar ropa usada y salir a vender en las afueras de León.
texts.en:
Idalia is 35 years old, a single mother of two children, and she makes a living selling used clothing.  She has three years of experience in this job which she started with very little capital, selling as a street vendor in neighborhoods and communities in the outskirts of León.  A project that she wants to do to get other income is to set up a stall for selling piñatas and accessories for events and celebrations.  

She is a woman who wants to progress and is very active, always looking for a way to get ahead in search of a better future for her children.  Today she asks for the loan to buy used clothing and to go out to sell in the outskirts of Léon.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco, vive en la ciudad de León,  de oficio mecanico. El desea compartir su agradecimiento por el beneficio que ha obtenido su negocio pues brinda un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya ha cambiado algunas herramientas viejas por unas nuevas que ha comprado con el financiamiento obtenido. Hoy esta requiriendo para comprar herramientas tales como sopletes, gata hidráulica, llaves para tuercas, llantas  etc. Su deseo es ir mejorando poco a poco su negocio brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in the city of León and is a mechanic by trade.  He would like to share his thanks for the benefit he obtained from his previous loan.  He is now able to provide his customers with a better service and he has replaced some old tools with new ones that he bought with his loan.

Francisco needs this new loan to buy tools such as blowtorches, a hydraulic jack, nut wrenches, tires, etc.  His aim is to gradually improve his business, provide his customers with a better service and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blowtorches, a hydraulic jack, nut wrenches, tires, etc.

loans.name: Sociedad Emperadora Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOCIEDAD EMPRENDEDORA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adriana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de accesorios de electricidad, atención de punto VIVA, venta de mantas de lana, venta de juguetes, elaboración de mantas de vicuña.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adriana es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que la visito en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta mantas de lana; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un pequeño capital pudo comprar con los préstamos sacados en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra manta de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The 'Sociedad Emperadora' community bank are starting their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors with Adriana as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling electrical appliances, running a public telephone service, selling wool blankets, selling toys and making blankets from vicuña wool.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these micro-businesswomen.  Adriana is a member of this group.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five months, having joined through an invitation from one of the institution's loan officers who visited her at home.  Adriana currently has a business selling wool blankets.  She started this business with a small amount of capital and was able to buy more stock with money from Pro Mujer loans.

Adriana is taking out this loan to increase her capital.  She will buy wool blankets wholesale at the street markets and then re-sell them from her sales location.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her household.  Adriana is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Adriana replied that she likes the loans, the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool blankets

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 48 years old and he lives in Ddmashen village, which is in the Gegharkunik area, with his big and lovely family. Suren’s wife is a librarian at their village library. They have four children: three daughters and a son. Their son works at the police, the eldest daughter works as a teacher, the second daughter is a student and the third is school-aged. 

Suren has no higher education but for many years he worked as a bricklayer. His family is big and their needs are countless, Suren and his wife do their best to provide better living conditions for their children. 

Today Suren and his wife are engaged in agriculture and farming. He cultivates potatoes, tomatoes and some greens, which he sells locally. His farm is rich with three cows, a calf, four sheep and twelve chickens.


Suren wants to buy young calves in order to enlarge his farm and he asks a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams. Suren has already taken one loan from Nor Horizon and this time he has a strong desire to cooperate with Kiva lenders also.

loans.use: To buy young calves.

loans.name: Munah

texts.en:
Munah is 45 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, which is located by the sea and is the capital city of Grand Bassa County. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Munah and her fiancée stay together. She stopped her education in fifth grade and has five children between 30 and 10 years old. Only one is in school and lives at home. 

For the past twenty years, Munah has been selling fish in the local market in order to help her children. She started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned this business from her. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. 

Munah is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business.  She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Cristhian Modesto

texts.es:
Christhian tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, la cual es una ciudad de clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee una gastronomía variada y sus pobladores son personas muy amables. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Administración de empresas, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante ya que el es padre de 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden entre 10 y 7 años.

Día a día Christian trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de carne de cerdos, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente, con lo cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque desea salir adelante.

Christhian está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más cerdos y así poder tener mas mercadería para vender, sobre todo porque se acerca el día del padre y tiene varios pedidos, con lo cual podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una profesion a sus hijos y tener una granja de cerdos mas grande”.
texts.en:
Christhian is 31 years old. He lives in the city of Chincha, a city with very warm and welcoming weather. Additionally, it has a diverse gastronomy, and its people are very friendly. Because of his few economic resources, Christhian could only study through the fifth grade, but he would have liked to study a career in business administration. Because of this, he works hard to get ahead since he is the father of 4 children between the ages of 7 and 10. 

Day by day, Christhian works at his small business selling pork. He works about 8 hours a day. He can take care of about 20 clients daily, which allows him to cover his home expenses. Christhian believes that he is getting ahead because he is very friendly with his clients and above all because he wants to get ahead.

Christhian is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he has been able to buy more pigs and have more merchandise to sell. Above all, because Father’s Day is coming up, Christhian has several orders with which he will be able to increase his income and continue fighting to be able to make his greatest dream a reality: to give his children a profession and have a bigger pig farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Moradita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MORADITAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Simona es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ají y detergente, venta de fruta, tejido de chompas, venta de comida, venta de ropa usada, joyería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Simona es integrante, ella indica que hace un años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que la visito en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra papa) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Moraditas Group is beginning its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Andes regional group. There are eight members and a Board of Directors led by President Sra. Simona. The members have a variety of businesses: selling peppers and detergent, selling fruit, knitting sweaters, food sales, selling used clothing, jewellery.

The loan they will receive will benefit small businesses such as the one run by Sra. Simona. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of one of the institution's advisors who visited her in her house. She currently has a business selling potatoes, a business she started on her own initiative several years ago.

The loan that Simona will receive is to be used as working capital to buy potatoes. She buys them wholesale at markets and then sells them from her own stall. The money she earns allows her to maintain her family as best she can. She is married and has three children.

What Simona most enjoys about belonging to Pro Mujer are the health classes.

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Las Mamacitas De Escoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MAMACITAS DE ESCOMA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, producción y venta de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, producción de papa y chuño, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su pareja, ya que la familia de él trabajaba en este rubro, posteriormente decidieron trabajar con el mismo oficio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la renovación de herramientas (compra de red de  pesca) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The 'Mamacitas de Escoma' community bank are starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Silvia as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: growing and selling potatoes, growing and selling vegetables, running a neighborhood store, growing potatoes and chuño, and selling cattle.

This loan will benefit these micro-businesswomen.  Silvia is a member of this group.  She says that this is the first time she has become a member of Pro Mujer, having joined through an invitation from one of the institution's loan officers who came to visit her at home.  Silvia has a fish selling business.  She learned the trade from her partner as his family are in this line of work.  The couple decided to work in the same business.
