Silvia is taking out this loan to replace some work tools.  She will buy fishing nets in the street markets of the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her household.  Silvia is in a common law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Silvia replied that she likes the health training sessions and the loans.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 23 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Mama is married. She did not go to school and has three children between 8 and 1 years old. Only one is in school, and they all live at home. 

For the past three years she has been selling red oil and fufu in the local market. She started this business with a little amount from her mother, and she learned this business from her. She likes her business because of the ways people buy from her. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and six children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a home painter since 1983. Over these years, Abbas has gained extensive experience as well as built a good business reputation. He works on a freelance basis and has one employee helping him with his work. 

Abbas is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a car for his business. Having a car will facilitate his transportation and allow him to reach customers and projects whenever they are located. In the future, Abbas plans to open his own painting tools and supplies shop.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Kobah

texts.en:
Kobah is 45 years old and lives in the West Point area of Liberia, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have two children (9 and 23 years old), one of whom is in school and lives at home.

She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past 8 years, she has been running a table business, where she sells food in the local market. She explains that she likes her business because of the ways that her customers buy food from her. She started the business with money given to her by her husband.

She walks every day to buy her food and ingredients, since her shop is much closer to the local market than her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, peppers, onions, etc. for her business. In the future, she plans to buys a piece of land on which to build a house. She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase additional food (e.g., rice, peppers, and onions) for her business,

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is living together with her fiancé, who is a carpenter. They have three children, ages 12 to 9, who are in school and live at home. She described herself as a hardworking person.

For the past eight years, she has been running a shop in the local market where she sells food ingredients such as rice, pepper, onions, and vita. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancé. She walks every day to buy her ingredients since her shop is much closer. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, vita, etc., for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.  

She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small-business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, vita, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Ines Stefany

texts.es:
Ines es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima variado y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, manzana, plátano, entre otros. Ines vive al lado de sus padres, los cuales debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo pudieron darle educación hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero a Ines le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Gastronomía.

Día a día Ines trabaja como jornalera en un fundo de su ciudad, trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y también producto de sus ahorros logro iniciar su negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra y con ello apoya a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar; Ines cree que le está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Ines está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar jaulas especiales para la crianza de cuyes, ya que actualmente tiene varios cuyes hembras preñadas y con cesta mejora podrá criarlas en un lugar más seguro; así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Estudiar una carrera universitaria y que su negocio sea más grande”.
texts.en:
20-year old Ines lives in the town of Imperial, known for its varied and welcoming climate as well as for its agriculture. Corn, apples, bananas etc. are grown there. Ines lives with her parents who, because they are poor, could only afford to send her to school up to grade five of high school. She would have liked to study cookery.

Ines works as a day laborer on a nearby farm. She works about nine hours a day, and in addition she raises and sells guinea pigs, a business she started on her own initiative with her savings. The latter brings in  extra income with which she helps her parents pay for household expenses. She believes she will do well because she is responsible and above all has a great desire to succeed.

Ines is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to buy special cages for the guinea pigs. At the moment there are several pregnant females and with a better cage she will be able to keep them in a safer place. In this way Ines will increase her income and continue working hard every day to make her dreams of studying at university and growing her business come true.

loans.use: To construct guinea pig cages

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 28 years old and lives at the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, age 8 and 7. They are in school and live at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past three years she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot,  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Hassiba

texts.en:
Hassiba is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children, who are still attending school. Her husband provides the main income source. As for Hassiba, she provides the family with extra financial support thanks to a bakery that she has owned since 2008. She produces tasty pastries. 

Hassiba is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase raw materials to renovate her bakery. Her loan and the renovation will help her improve her productivity and attract more customers to her shop. These changes will increase her returns and result in higher profits. In the future, Hassiba intends to expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: purchase raw materials to renovate her bakery

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Angèle est une femme de 39 ans, celibataire et mère de 4 enfants. Elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 5 ans. Grâce à sa determination et à son dynamisme, elle a su fidéliser une bonne partie de son voisnage et augmenter graduellement cette clientèle au point où elle ressent le besoin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des produits (mèches et greffes, casque et produits accessoires) afin satisfaire sa clientèle et ses prévisions de résultat. les bénéfices seront réintroduits dans son activité (salon de coiffure luxieux) d'une part et subviendront aux besoins familiaux (éducation, nutrition, logement) d'autre part
texts.en:
Angèle, age 39, is the single mother of four children. She has been the owner and manager of a hair salon in a district of the city for the past five years. Her determination and enthusiasm have helped her to build a loyal, steadily increasing customer base among the locals, and she now feels the need to bolster her stock of merchandise. 

She wants to use this loan to buy hair styling products (hair extensions, caps, accessories) to meet customer demand as well as her own sales projections. She will reinvest part of her profits into her business (high-end hair salon) and use another portion to provide for the needs of her family (tuition, food, lodging, etc.).

loans.use: to buy supplies and merchandise for her hair salon.

loans.name: Petrnilla

texts.en:
Petronilla is married and has seven children.  She lives in Kongowea, north of Mombasa, Kenya. She has a water business which she runs concurrently with a dressmaking business, which she has been doing for more than 10 years.

Petronilla is requesting a loan from Milango for 21,050 KES, which she will use to buy pipes for her water business. The main challenge she faces is over billing by the water ministry. In five years, she wants to have other water points where she will be tapping more income. Petronilla wants to give her children the best education with the income she will earn from the business

loans.use: to purchase buy pipes for her water business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married with three children, two of whom attend school. He lives in Mombasa, Kenya. James has been in the poultry business for the past five years and he also sells water. His major business challenge is the shortage of water.

James is requesting a 10,650 KES loan to buy chicks for rearing. In the future, he wants to provide decent housing for his family.

loans.use: to buy chicks to rear

loans.name: Domiano

texts.en:
Domiano is married and blessed with three children, two of whom go to school. He lives in Likoni, south of Mombasa, Kenya. For the past five years, Domiano has been building and selling blocks for construction. He learned of Milango through friends and his major business challenge is transportation.

Domiano is requesting a 36,650 KES loan to purchase working tools. In the future, he hopes to improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tools to make bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is 26 years old and lives at the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is living together with her fiance, who is a carpenter. They have two children, aged 10 and 3, who live at home and one is in school. She described herself as a hardworking person. 

For the past two years she has been running a table where she sells fish in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her fiance. She walks every day to buy her ingredients. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small-business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Qmenvinah

texts.en:
Qmenvinah is 24 years old and lives at the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and completed grade 12. She described herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past five years, she has been running a shop where she sells soft drinks in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 A.M. to 5 P.M. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old and lives in the West Point area of Liberia, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have two children (aged 14 and 10), both of whom are in school and live at home.

She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past ten years, she has been running a table business, where she sells various goods and food items such as rice, palm oil, peppers, etc. in the local market. She explains that she likes her business because of the ways that her customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband.

She has an increasing number of customers, so she walks every day to buy her inventory. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods and food items, including rice, peppers, and palm oil, for her business. In the future, she plans to buy a piece of land on which to build a house. She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase additional food items (e.g., rice, peppers, and palm oil) for her business,

loans.name: Habsa

texts.fr:
Habsa est âgée de 42 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant; elle est membre du Banc Villageois de son quartier depuis le 27 août 2009.Elle a bénéficié de 8 prêts dont 4 prêts spéciaux, son épargne augmente à chaque cycle.

Femme dynamique et sérieuse, elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus et capitalise une bonne expérience de 4 ans.

Elle se rend dans la sous-région pour acheter des tissus "khartoum" et des tissus teintés pour revendre à dans sa localité.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des tissus pour un montant de 300000 F; elle va payer pour 50000F les taxes douanières. Les frais de transport et de nourriture seront son apport. Elle souhaite vendre avec succès pour se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer aux charges de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Habsa is 42 years old, unmarried, and without children. She has been a member of the 'banc villageois' in her district since August 27, 2009. She has benefited from eight loans, including four special loans. Her savings increase every cycle. 

An energetic and serious woman, she is active in the commerce of cloth and capitalizes on four years of good experience. 

She goes around the sub-region to purchase "khartoum" cloth and dyed fabrics to resell in her town. 

Her loan will be used to purchase cloth for 300,000 francs. She will pay 50,000 francs in import taxes. Transportation costs and food will be her portion. She would like to be successful in her sales to bring in large revenues. 

Her profits enable her to help cover family expenses and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 34 years old. She lives in the Telavi district with her husband, George, and her brother-in-law. 

Nino requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Nino is working in the bakery as a baker. Her husband is working at the local communication warehouse. They both get small monthly salaries.
 
Nino requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Nino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Nino will purchase grocery stock and open a grocery shop. She has rented a commercial space that was used as a shop before. The shop already has the entire needed inventory so Nino will not have much expense. She will fill up the shop with products and start selling them to earn an additional income for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock and open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Massah is 47 years old and lives in the West Point area of Liberia, which has the most populous market in Montserrado County. She is married with thirteen children between the ages of 16 and 31 years old. One child attends school and lives at home.

Massah is an 11th grade dropout, yet she is a businesswoman. Her husband sells water by the sack. She decided to start her own business to contribute income to her family. Over the past four years she has been running a shop where she sells water by the sack in the local market. The business was started with a little amount of water lent by her husband, but she managed to turn it into a big operation. She sells water six days per week and 10 hours per day.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack for her business. She appreciates the support of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more water by the sack.

loans.name: Aref

texts.en:
Aref is a 30-year-old, single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings.

To earn a living, he owns and operates a small shop in his town. At his shop, he sells food provisions and water.

With the requested youth loan proceeds from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he would like to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs and groceries to increase his business sales and thus his income. Aref is very positive and hopes to save as much money as possible because he plans to get married and has to afford the wedding expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs and groceries

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is in her late 20s and married with a one-year-old child. For the past three years, she has run a food stand in Jui, in the eastern area in Freetown. Princess started her business because she did not go to school and she was trained in business. She also sells rice and her stand is located in a busy market area. Princess's main business challenges are price increases and the slow purchasing power of her customers.

Princess is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more rice, pepper, and vegetables to expand her business. The extra income from her loan will help increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Princess would like to empower herself. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, and vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 45 years old and lives at the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has three children between 30 and 20 years old. She described herself as a business-minded woman.

For the past four years she has been running a table where she sells dried fish in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 A.M. to 6 P.M. She like her business because she makes more profit, and she started this business with money given to her by her husband. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Armada Boliviana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARMADA BOLIVIANA” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Beatriz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: herramienta de albañil, venta de gaseosas, costura de chamarras, encuadernado y tapas de carpeta, costura de mandiles, venta de verduras, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de perfumes, venta de queso, venta de golosinas, tejido de mantas, venta de condimentos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Beatriz es integrante, ella indica que hace varios años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que la visito en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de mandiles; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un pequeño capital pudo comprar con los préstamos sacados en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra tela) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Armada Boliviana” will begin its eleventh cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Regional Office.  It is composed of 8 members and is led by a board of directors where Beatriz is the president.  The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied, among them are: selling bricklayers tools, soft drink sales, sewing jackets, selling binders and folder covers, sewing aprons, vegetable sales, selling baby clothing, perfume sales, cheese sales, candy sales, blanket weaving and condiment sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small group of businesswomen of which Beatriz is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer several years ago, entering at the invitation of an advisor of the institution who visited her at home.  At present she has a business of sewing and selling aprons.  She makes known that she started this business with a small amount of resources that she was able to buy with the loans taken out from Pro Mujer.

The loan that she will take out now is for the increase of capital to buy fabric that she will acquire from the markets wholesale and subsequently make into what she will sell in her sales space.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her household as much as possible as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu is 37 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 3 and 18. Four of her children are going to school. She runs a cookery business in Jui in the eastern area in Freetown.

She's been in this business for 12 years and sells cooked food and pure water. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate capital to expand her business.
 
Rugiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking ingredients, including palm oil, fish, pepper, and other seasonings. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land for a house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as palm oil, fish, pepper, and other seasonings

loans.name: Lansana

texts.fr: Lansana est enseignant habite au Sénégal marié père de 2 enfants dont l'ainé âgé de 4 ans fait le jardin d'enfant.Il capitalise une expérience 9 ans,il prend en charge sa famille et s'occupe de la dépense quotidienne. Lansana sollicite un crédit 240 000f cfa pour acheter des meubles .En 2012 et 2013,il travail à l'inspection départemental de la région .Il a comme ambition d’être inspecteur de l'enseignemant dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Lansana is a teacher living in Senegal. He is a married father of two children, of whom the oldest is 4 years old in kindergarten. Lansana capitalizes on nine years of experience. He supports his family and takes care of day-to-day expenses. 

He is requesting a loan of 240,000 francs CFA to purchase furniture. In 2012 and 2013, he has been working in departmental inspections in the region. His ambition is to be a school inspector in the future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Adama from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children ages three and six. For the past five years, Adama has been selling food and commodities. She began her business to improve her standard of living and she works 12 hours a day, seven days a week. Her main business challenges are price fluctuations and the cost of transportation. 

Adama is requesting a loan to purchase more gari, flour, and sugar to sell. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to open a food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase gari, flour, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Rugiatu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with six children between the ages of 13 and 20. For the past 12 years, Rugiatu has operated a food market. She began her business to generate an income to take care of her needs. Rugiatu works 12 hours a day, seven days a week. Her main business challenges are price inflation and improper business location.

Rugiatu is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, pure water, and bread to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from her loan will allow her to empower herself and increase her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pure water, and bread to expand her business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 45 years old and married with six children between the ages of 8 and 20. Two of her children go to school. For the past 13 years, Aminata has run a food stand business in Jui eastern area in Freetown where she sells fish, palm oil, pepper, and cooking seasonings. Her main business challenge is inadequate financial capital to expand her business.
 
Aminata is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking material such as palm oil, fish, pepper, and cooking seasonings. She says that the extra income from her loan will help her educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, Aminata would like to renovate her house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, fish, pepper, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Juliana Janet

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 37 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo y de sus 2 maravillosos hijos, a los cuales ama mucho y por quienes se esfuerza y se sacrifica para darle una mejor cálida de vida y mejores oportunidades; ya que Juliana solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y es por ello que juliana se esfuerza mucho para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.

Día a día juliana trabaja como agricultora, actualmente ha sembrado papa, uno de los tubérculos originarios de nuestro país, el cual es muy delicioso y con el que se preparan muchos platillos típicos del país, Juliana trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia especialmente de lunes a viernes ya que los fines de semana trata de pasar un tiempo de familia con sus hijos; Juliana cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y porque tiene mucha fe en Dios.

Juliana está muy agradecida con los prestamistas ya que gracias a su gran apoyo podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, así como también podrá solventar los gastos de regadío y arado de la tierra, de esta manera podrá mejorar su cultivo y tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus negocio y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener una parcela propia”.
texts.en:
Juliana is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and their two marvelous children, whom Juliana loves very much. She works hard and makes sacrifices in order to provide them with a better quality of life and better opportunities. Juliana was only able to complete three years of a high school education, so now she works very hard so that her children will have a better future. 

Day to day, Juliana works as a farmer. Currently, she grows potatoes, a native plant to Peru that is delicious and used in many typical dishes. Juliana works about 10 hours each day, especially Monday through Friday since she tries to spend the weekends with her family. Juliana believes that she is getting ahead because she is very responsible and has faith in God. 

Juliana is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the great support offered to her. With this loan, she will be able to buy compost and fertilizers for her crops as well as pay to irrigate and plough her land. This will help improve Juliana's crops, which will improve her sales so that she can keep working toward turning her dream of "giving her children the education to enter a good profession and to have her own plot of land" into a reality.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, and other items.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.fr: Etienne habite au Sénégal , il est célibataire sans enfant , depuis 7 ans il est dans le commerce de vin de palme et le cana .Il démarre sa journée de 7h à 9h 30 dans la matinée et de 19h à 22h , de 10h à 18h ,il est dans la brousse pour l'achat et la récolte de vin pour augmenter son stock et satisfaire ses clients .Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000f cfa destiner à achater du vin rouge dans un pays frontalier pour venir revendre dans sa localité .Il a comme ambition ouvrir un grand Bar dans son quartier.
texts.en: Etienne lives in Senegal. He is unmarried and has no children. For seven years, he has done commerce in palm wine and 'cana'. His day goes from 7 AM to 9:30 AM and from 7 PM to 10 PM. He is in the countryside to purchase and gather wine to increase his stock and to satisfy his customers. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs CFA for purchasing red wine from a bordering country. He will sell the wine in his town. His ambition is to open a big bar in his district.

loans.use: to purchase wine to sell

loans.name: Alan Dennis

texts.es: Alan es un hombre de 30 años, soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Camaná, caracterizada por clima cálido y hermosas playas; Alan es un hombre muy trabajador, persevante, con un gran sentido del humor, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y hermanos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Seco de Pollo” para compartir con su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Agronomía. Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de su familia, Alan se dedica a la agricultura ya que cuenta con un pequeño terreno en el cual cultiva frejoles, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diaria, él se encuentra muy a gusto en su negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado mucho las labores del campo. Alan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, gracias a ese apoyo podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y podrá realizar el mantenimiento del cultivo; de esta manera podrá sostener la cosecha de su cultivo e incrementar sus ingresos y así de esta manera espera poder cumplir su gran sueño de estudiar la carrera de agronomía para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
30-year old Alan is single and lives with his parents and siblings in the town of Camaná, known for its warm climate and beautiful beaches. Alan is a hardworking, diligent man with a great sense of humour. In his free time he likes to play football with his friends and siblings, and sometimes cooks a delicious meal of 'seco de pollo' to share with his family. Unfortunately, because of lack of money, he wasn't able to go to college, but he still dreams of being able to study agriculture.

Thanks to his enterprising attitude and a wish to help his family, Alan found a job in agriculture and has a small piece of land where he grows beans. He spends about 12 hours a day working on his land. He enjoys running his business as he has always liked working on the land.

He is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is through their help that he will be able to buy manure and fertilizer and care for his fields. His harvest will be good, and he will increase his income. Then he will be able to fulfill his greatest dreams of studying agriculture at college and helping his family get ahead.

loans.use: Buy manure, fertilizer etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente  vive con su compañera de vida y su hija, el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con productos  de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como todo buen comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. el cliente  asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client resides with his life's companion and his daughter. He owns a store where he sells articles of primary necessity; beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. He has had this business for many years and it has rewarded him with experience in sales that permit him to earn a better income. 

The business is located in his residence. He has gained many customers. Since he keeps the store well stocked, people prefer his store. He stays ahead of the competition because he always has what customers need with quality products at accessible prices and unequaled services, always at the customers' order. 

Like all good merchants, he wants to expand his business and make an additional investment for which he needs capital. Hence, he is soliciting a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc. The client assures us that he will pay off the debt and, at the same time, he's confident that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nassah

texts.en:
Nassah is 29 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has completed grade 12. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. 

For the past three years, Nassah has been running a table where she sells cold water. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. Nassah started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shard-taxi every day to get her goods to her business location. 

Nassah is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of water for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of water for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 35 years old and married, with four children, ages between nine years and 17 years. She runs a palm oil business in Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. Three of her children are going to school. She started her business because she wants to improve her family's standard of living. 

Hawa's been in her business for more than 12 years, selling palm oil within a busy market area. She says that, at present, her business is doing well because the profit helps her to feed her family.

Hawa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil, to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and renovate the roof of her house. 

In the future, Hawa would like to expand her business and open a palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene  de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su  hogar. Doña María solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Fifty-three year old Maria lives with her husband and their three children in their own home. 

For the past several years she has earned a living selling tortillas from her house. She works Monday to Sunday and has a large clientele because she is hard-working and friendly. With the earnings from the sales she manages to cover her household expenses. 

Maria is requesting a loan to buy corn in bulk to continue making tortillas. This will increase her earnings and give her and her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Lilian Arely

texts.es: Lilian de 37 años de edad es madre soltera  vive con su hijo de 16 años de edad en una casa que alquila, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace 5 años y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable, lilian es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa: blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, shorts, ropa para niños, etc. lilian tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica y podrá darle a su hijo una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Lilian, 37, is a single mother living with her 16-year-old son in a house she rents.  She’s been working selling clothes for the last 5 years and has gained much experience in her home-based business.  She’s acquired many customers because people know that everything is of top quality at affordable prices with unequaled service.  

Lilian’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and very hardworking.  In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment but lacks enough capital to back her up which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to be able to buy more blouses, pants, skirts, shirts, shorts, children’s clothes, etc.  Lilian hopes to provide economic security for her home and to give her son a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nuria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Nuria de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo, su hijo y una nieta en una casa que alquilan, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 3 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Nuria, 45, lives with her husband, son and a granddaughter in a house they rent.  She owns a store where she sells basic staple items like beans, milk, eggs and bread, among others.  She’s been in business three years and has gained much sales experience that allows her to earn the best profits.  The store is located at home which is in a very busy area and it’s very well-known by local residents.  She’s acquired a large clientele because her store is well-stocked.  

She wants to enlarge the business and make a new investment but lacks capital which is why she’s asking for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy everything she needs for the store.  She assures that she’ll repay the loan while at the same time trusts that she’ll give her family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Memie

texts.en:
Memie is 34 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Memie and her fiance live together. She stopped her education in fourth grade and has five children between the ages of 13 and 2, all of whom are in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money from her children's father, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente vive en casa propia con su familia, el posee un molino desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahi llegan a moler el maiz para elaborarlas,tambien procesando todo tipo de alimentos como frijoles, hárinas, salsas, entre otros. ya que el es una persona muy amable y responsable, el cliente solicita un credito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y asi seguir con su trabajo para darles el sustento diario a su familia sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
This client lives in his own house with his family. He’s had a mill for several years and has many customers especially the ladies that make tortillas because they come here to grind the corn to make them with.  He also processes all types of food like beans, flour and sauces, among others.  He is a very kind, responsible person.

He’s asking for a loan to buy blades, disks and other tools needed to have a good mill to continue with his work providing for his family’s daily support with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy blades, disks and tools.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis es una mujer de 41 años de edad la cual tiene 6 hijos los cuales todos están en diferentes grados de educación primaria y su relación es en unión libre desde hace muchos años. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado. Ella es agricultora y lo aprendió por parte de sus padres ya que ellos son agricultores desde toda una vida. Ella tiene un cultivo de café al cual se ha dedicado por muchos años en compañía de su esposo y sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona.

Actual mente ella solicita ayuda para limpiar y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos ya que de esa forma ella podrá tener un mejor cultivo y una buena cosecha ya que solo su pareja y ella se involucran en la misma.   

Sus planes son agrandar sus cultivos en variedad y cantidad, tecnificarla ya que de esa forma podrá tener más ganancias podrá cubrir los gastos estudiantiles de sus hijos y poder seguir apoyándolos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Alexis is a 41-year-old woman; she has six children in various grades in elementary school.  She’s been in a long-term common law relationship.  She did not complete elementary school; she went up to third grade.  

She works in agriculture having learned it from her parents since they’ve worked in agriculture their entire lives.  She and her husband have been growing coffee for many years and their customers are the various buyers that come by the zone.

She’s currently asking for help to do the clearing and to provide crop maintenance so that her crops will be better and the harvest will be good since just she and her spouse do all the work.

Her plan is to expand the variety and amount of her crops and to introduce technology so that profits will increase and she will be able to cover her children’s education expenses and continue supporting them so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: to provide crop maintenance.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 55 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. Buchanan is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough, typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Musu is a widow. She did not go to school and she has six children, between 30 and 19 years old, all of whom are living on their own. 

For the past 15 years, Musu has been selling flour, rice, bread, sugar, etc. in the local market. She started this business with the little amount rounded up by her late husband’s family and she learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. 

Musu is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Abed Al Husein

texts.en:
Abed Al Husein is a 59-year-old married man, and a father of six children. He has been working in his baking business for 12 years. In 2012, he moved to his present bakery, because it is wider and makes his work easier.

Abed Al Husein is a hard worker, and he is well known in his region with his good reputation and special french croissant he makes. He is recommended by almost all of his customers, which is why he puts so much effort on developing his business in a way it fits all of his customers' needs.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy an espresso machine and hookas, and to pay necessary fees for the machine that the government provides in order to get electricity and measure the amount used to pay at the end of each month. This will expand his business diversity and develop it in a way to increase his social and financial living.

He is opening a coffee shop next to his bakery and hopes it will provide him with the things his family needs.

loans.use: To buy an espresso machine and hookas, and to pay necessary fees for his government-provided electricity meter.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 27 years old, married, and has two children, ages 2 and 9. One of her children is going to school. She runs a palm oil business in Jui in the eastern area in Freetown. She started this business because she wants to improve her family's standard of living. 

She has been in this business for more than eight years and sells palm oil in a busy market area. She says that her business is currently doing well. She uses the profits to help feed her family. 

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and renovate the roof of her house. In the future, she would like to expand her business by opening a palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, pants and other necessary items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candies, cookies, soft drinks, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 28 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has a 1-year-old child. 

She describes herself as a hard-working woman. For the past three years, she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. 

She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a pickup every time to get her goods to her business shop. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. With her profits, she plans to build a house for her children. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more goods  for her business.

loans.name: Xiomara Jaquelene

texts.es:
Xiomara es una mujer joven de 30 años de edad la cual es casada y madre de 5 hijos de los cuales uno está en preparatoria, una niña que está en 5 grado, los otros dos en 4 grado y un menor. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. En compañía de sus esposo se dedican a la agricultura hace más de 25 años en la siembra y cultivo de café y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy joven. Las tierra que ellos trabajan las han adquirido una parte gracias a las herencias por parte de ambos padres y la otra parte con esfuerzo y trabajo las cuales están ubicadas a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan en ocasiones en vehículo y otras a pie.

Actualmente ella necesita apoyo para la compra de fertilizante y abono para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café para que sea aprovechado al 100%.

Sus planes a futuro es poder ampliar sus cultivos de café ya que sus sueños como madre de familia es ver a sus hijos culminados en sus estudios, ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y que tengan más oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Xiomara’s a 30-year-old married woman and mother of five children.  One of them is in high-school, a girl is in fifth grade the other two are in fourth grade and one of them is still too young.  She completed elementary school thanks to her parents’ support.

She and her husband have been growing coffee for more than 25 years; their parents taught them how to work the land when they were very young.  They have acquired their land partly through inheritance from both their parents and part of it through their own effort and work; the land is located two kilometers from their house and they get there sometimes by vehicle and sometimes on foot.

She currently needs support to buy fertilizer and manure to provide maintenance for her coffee crop so that it will be 100% useful.  Her future plan is to be able to expand the coffee crops because her dream as a mother is to see her children complete their schooling and to offer them better quality of life and that they have more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel to light her home

loans.name: Komron

texts.ru: Комрону 21 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Комрон учился в средней школе хорошо, но так как он вырос в малообеспеченной семье, он не смог поступить в университет и продолжать учебу. Комрон данное время является таксистом. Он перевозит людей с одной точки города в другой. Так как он живет в большом городе и много людей используют услуги такси, его бизнес развивается быстро. Его отец уже несколько лет не имеет место работы на родине и поэтому он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для покупки авиабилета. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Komron is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. Komron was a good student in secondary school, but, since he grew up in a low-income family, it wasn’t possible for him to go the university and continue his studies. At present, Komron works as a taxi driver. He transports passengers across the city. Since he lives in a large city, and many people here use taxis, his business is growing fast. His father has been out of work  in his home city for several years, and this is why he would go to the Russian Federation [as a migrant worker]. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 USD to buy an air ticket. He counts on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy air ticket for his father who wants to go to Russia.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 25 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and she was unable to go to school. 

She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years, she has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. 

She started this business with money given to her by mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. With her profits, she plans is to build a house for her children. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Nicolas Alonso

texts.es:
Nicolás de 61 años de edad, casado con dos hijos lo cuales están bajo su responsabilidad, están estudiando el  de 22 años está en la universidad, y el 8 está en primaria. Él es originario de  Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Nagarote se caracteriza por su comida típica como el “quesillo y el tiste” Nicolás es un hombre muy responsable, trabajador, con ganas de superación personal. Que lucha arduamente para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro mejor, y esta por cumplir unos de sus mayores sueños como es ver formado a su hijo en un profesional.
Nicolás tiene por actividad económica tiene por actividad económica la venta de frijoles cosidos, venta de gaseosas, golosinas, en su casa de habitación. El dedica a su actividad unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio,  en la compra de frijoles por quintales, cajillas de gaseosas, golosinas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Nicolás agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nicolás, age 61, is married and has two children who are under his care.  The children go to school.  The 22 year old goes to the university, and the 8 year old is in elementary school.  He is from Nagarote, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  Nagarote is known for its typical food like "quesillo" [tortilla wrapped around pickled onions and cheese sauce] and "tiste" [traditional drink made of corn and cocoa]. 

Nicolás is a very responsible and hard-working man with a great desire for self-improvement.  He struggles arduously in order to give his children a better future.  He is about to fulfill one of his greatest dreams, which is to see his son become a professional.

Nicolás sells cooked beans, soft drinks, and candy at his house.  He works at this business activity selling his products for some 12 hours a day.  It is a business activity that he does with great pleasure.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock his business by buying beans by the “quintal” [weight measurement equaling 100 kilograms], cases of soft drinks, and candy.  He will do this so that he will get improved income in the not so distant future.

Nicolás is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy products like beans, cases of soft drinks, and candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Esequiel Efrain

texts.es: Don Ezequiel, habitante del barrio 19 de julio, tiene un hijo que procreo con su primer matrimonio quien estudia en el colegio del barrio, con su actual esposa intenta salir adelante con su pequeño negocio ambulante de bebidas variadas, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en gaseosas, jugos agua purificada, galletas y golosinas para mantener las ventas del día y así brindar apoyo a su familia, su mayor sueño en la vida e poder estabilizarse en una tienda en donde pueda vender sus productos para no andar ambulante, pero tiene la esperanza de que con la ayuda de financiamiento pueda superarse un poco.
texts.en:
Ezequiel lives in the 19 de Julio neighborhood.  He has a son from his first marriage that attends the local neighborhood school.  He and his current wife are trying to get ahead with his small business selling various beverages from place to place.

The loan he’s requesting is to buy soft-drinks, purified water, juices, cookies and snacks to keep his sales up to date in order to support his family.  His greatest dream in life is to be able to become stabilized in a store where he can sell his goods and not have to go from place to place anymore.  He hopes that with the loan’s help he will be able to improve a little.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, juices, cookies and snacks.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix de 36 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a vender jocotes de forma ambulante en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio su producto y es un hombre muy atento y amable con sus cliente, Felix está solicitando un crédito que le permita poder comprar jocotes por mayor para seguir con su negocio y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Félix, 36, lives with his wife and three children in his own house.  He sells ‘jocotes’ [tropical fruit] from place to place in markets near his place of residence.  He has many customers because he sells his product at a good price and he’s very kind and attentive to his customers.  Félix is asking for a loan to buy jocotes at wholesale to continue with his business to be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread, sisal fibers, and silk for his business.

loans.name: Gs Nueva Jutiapa Group

texts.es:
El señor Juan es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, que es la venta de abarrotería, desde hace 4 años, el realiza las ventas en su casa de habitación misma que esta ubicada en la calle principal de su comunidad.
Don Juan tiene ubicado su negocio en una zona donde transitan muchas personas y esto le representa una gran ventaja, también se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas y alquiler de dos cuartos.
Don Juan ha logrado mantener a su familia a través de sus actividades económicas, siendo el una persona ejemplar en su comunidad y muy querido por sus clientes por  su forma de atenderlos es muy amable y cortes.
Don Juan está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pan, leche, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, huevos, aguas, refrescos etc. sueña con tener una pulpería bien surtida. 
Don Juan al igual que su compañero de grupo espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar sus ingresos y a la vez mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don Jorge su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace mas de 3 años. 

Danli, Honduras -  Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Juan is a very hard-working person.  He has been selling groceries for four years.  He sells at his house, which is on a main street in his community.  Juan’s business is located in a very busy area, which is a great advantage.  He also repairs motorcycles and rents two rooms.

Juan has managed to support his family through his business activities.  He is an exemplary person in his community, and he is very dear to his customers because of the way he tends to them.  He is very kind and courteous.

Juan is requesting the loan to buy bread, milk, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, water, and soft drinks, etc.  He dreams of having a well-stocked grocery store.  Juan, the same has his companion in the group, hopes that this investment will allow him to improve his income and to improve, a bit, his quality of life and that of his family.

Jorge has had his grocery store business for over three years.

Danli, Honduras – April 2013

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, water, and soft drinks, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 24 years old and single, with one child, one year old. She runs a local food business in Jui, an eastern area in Freetown.

Emma's been in business for three years, selling fried fish and chicken. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate finances to expand her business.
 
Emma requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase cooking materials, including cooking oil, fish, pepper, and seasoning. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to change her standard of living and repay her loan. 

In the future, Emma would like to open a restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking materials, including cooking oil, fish, pepper, and seasoning.

loans.name: George Ngari

texts.en:
George Ngari is a hardworking man and a father of five.  He lives in the same compound as his five children and helps to care for them.  He lives in the Kiambu district in central Kenya where he operates a small electronics shop in Juja town and also runs an M-Pesa business.  The two businesses enable him to earn approximately $210 US per month which he uses towards his family's expenses.  He recently happened to visit Visionary Empowerment Programme and was introduced to the available solar lamps and their advantages.  He has opted to change his business from electronics to solar lamps, and believes this will double his profits since his customers have been frequently complaining of high electricity bills and occasional power shortages.  

VEP advanced this loan to George so he could purchase ten PowaPack 5w home devices, each of which can be used to light four rooms, power a radio and also charge a mobile phone.  With this solar package, his customers will be able to save on their monthly electricity bills.  Those without electricity can replace their kerosene lamps with cleaner solar lamps which are less costly than installing electricity.  By selling these lamps, he expects to make profits of around $23 per lamp.  Combined with the income from his M-Pesa business, this will put him in a position to repay the loan in 12 months and also reinvest some money into his business for expansion.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamps for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de verduras, plátanos, tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren  porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; el cliente quiere realizar  una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar verduras por mayor y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: This client lives with his life partner and their son; he works selling vegetables, bananas, tomatoes, onions, chilies and potatoes, among others.  He’s been in business several years.  The place where he sells is very strategic for this activity and many people visit it.  He has a large clientele that prefer him because his product is fresh, well-priced, good quality and service is excellent.  He wants to make a new investment but does not have enough capital to back him up which is why he’s requesting a loan to be able to buy vegetables at wholesale and thus provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, vegetables, toilet paper, sugar, rice, beans, and coffee, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con sus cuatro hermanos y su padre en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz  cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los granero y sacos que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es de muy buena calidad y a precio accesible, el cliente solicita un crédito para poder comprar  herbicidas, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y las herramientas necesarias para seguir con sus cultivos y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This client lives with his four siblings and his father in a house they own.  He’s been working in agriculture for many years; his main crop is corn. When the harvest is ready he stores it in the silos and in sacks as shown in the photo to then sell it in markets near his place of residence.  He has many customers because his product is very good quality at accessible price.  

He’s asking for a loan to be able to buy herbicide, manure, seeds, fertilizer and tools needed to continue with his crops and to earn higher profits to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Dina Yolanda

texts.es: Dina de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos. Ella posee una venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, dina  desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Dina, 37, lives in her own house with her three children. She’s been selling tortillas for ten years; she makes them every day at noon and in the evening.  Her business is located at home.  Dina wants to be able to improve her business because it earns very stable profits which allow her to support her family.  This is why she’s asking for a loan to buy corn at wholesale and lime powder to make a larger number of tortillas especially on weekends when demand increases because many of the tortilla shops are closed and she will be able to earn higher profits that will make it possible for her to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder.

loans.name: Magumu Smart Angels Group

texts.en:
Magumu Smart Angels is a group of women venturing into entrepreneurship.  They have been VEP members since last year and have each benefitted from a number of loans for self development.  All of them are mothers with school-age children and their concern is financial security to ensure quality education for their children.
They live in Kiambu County in central Kenya, and their core business has been the sale of secondhand clothing at a local market. 

Currently, they would like to expand their business by venturing into green energy products, specifically energy saving Jikos, that are beneficial to the environment and also income generating.  Through their network at the grassroots level, they can reach many women and create more awareness about the usage of efficient cookstoves.  They will also be able to transform their environment by reducing deforestation. 

VEP has advanced them a loan to purchase 20 Firewood Jikos each, totalling to 180 Jikos.  Each Jiko costs about $32 US and will be sold at $39 making a profit of about $8 per Jiko.  With this profit and income from the clothing business, the ladies can be self employed and financially stable.  Their income will be used to repay the loan and some profits will be ploughed back into the business to ensure sustainability.

Their dream is be the central point of sale for renewable energy in their region, and they hope to incorporate solars into their business in future.

loans.use: To purchase energy saving Jikos for resale

loans.name: María Elvidia

texts.es: Doña María de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 6 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos de de muy buena calidad y aprecios realmente accesibles, doña María esta solicitando un crédito que le permita poder compra mas mercadería por mayor para seguir con su negocio y poder tener una mejor vida con su hijo.
texts.en: María, 63, lives in her own house with her son. She has worked selling shoes for six years.  Her business is located in a market near her place of residence and she has many customers because her products are very good quality and prices are affordable.  María is asking for a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale to stay in business and to be able to have a better life with her son.

loans.use: to buy more shoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leaves for tamales, shortening, rice, beans, chicken, potatoes, corn, and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 30 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  She is from the western rural area in Freetown. Fatmata runs a  fish business. She began her business because she wants to improve her family status. She works from 8:00 AM until 9:00 PM, Morning to Friday. 

Fatmata is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. Her main business challenges are price inflation and transportation difficulties.She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a piece of land. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Yohana Lizzeth

texts.es:
La señora Johana  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el  sur de Honduras.
Doña Johana su negocio es una pulpería desde hace más de 2 años. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes de pollo, res, refrescos, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer.
Doña Johana espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando que sus hijos para que  sean personas  de bien para la  sociedad. 	


Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Johana is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person.  She lives with her husband and their three children in the southern part of Honduras.

Johana’s has had her grocery store business for over two years.  She needs the loan to buy shortening, rice, beans, chicken, beef, and soft drinks, etc.  With the loan she hopes that the sales in her business increase upon having more products to offer.

Johana hopes to cover the needs that she has and to improve a little her quality of life and that of her family.  In a few years she hopes that her business continues growing and becomes one of the largest and most well-known in the area.  She hopes to continue supporting her children so that they become good people for society.

Choluteca, Honduras – April 2013

loans.use: to buy shortening, rice, beans, chicken, beef, and soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Grace Wanjiru

texts.en:
Grace Wanjiru is a single mother of two children - one is in primary school and the other is four months old.  They live in the Chogoria district in eastern Kenya.  Grace is employed as a housekeeper where she earns approximately $70 US per month.  She also practices dairy farming on her half-acre piece of land, where she makes about $47 US per month from the sale of milk.  This money is only enough to care for her small family and save $23 as investment for the future.  

Being an ambitious woman, she also wants to make more savings which will secure her children’s future.  Out of her little savings she started a shop in Chogoria town where she sold energy saving cook stoves.  These stoves not only help in preserving the environment, as they emit less smoke, but are also eco-friendly as they use less charcoal when compared with the traditionally used stoves.  The residents of Chogoria spend about $47 per month on charcoal, but with the efficient cook stoves they will be able save at least 50% of that each month.

Realizing that her business is making a profit margin of about $17.50 per stove according to the few stoves she was able to purchase and sell from her savings, she opted to take a loan through VEP to buy 40 Envirofit charcoal stoves.  With the profit margin and the savings from the sale of milk, she will be in a position to repay the loan in twelve months and also make more savings from the business.  This will empower her as well as offer financial security for her and her children.

loans.use: To purchase energy saving cook stoves for resale

loans.name: Ludy Marleny

texts.es: Ludy de 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta,  Ludy  esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ludy, 34, lives with her husband and two children who are 4 and 2 years of age. She has a sewing workshop at home where she makes various types of clothes.  She’s acquired many customers lately because the works she does is excellent and she sells it at really affordable prices.  She’s a responsible, honest woman who is dedicated to her work.

Ludy’s asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, needles and everything related to sewing so she can continue to meet customer demand so she can have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en: Johnny has successfully started his clean energy enterprise with EarthSpark. The most popular product so far has been the PowaPak- a mini solar home system capable of lighting two rooms as well as charging mobile phones and radios. He would like to increase his stock of this product, so is coming back for a second loan.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 40 years old and married, with four children, ages between one and four years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, a western, rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business as her daily living.

Aminata has been in her business since 2000, selling fish within her community. She says that, at present, her business is doing well because, out of the profits, she is able to take care of her family.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Aminata would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Antoine Gilbert

texts.en: Antoine started selling EarthSpark clean energy products a few months ago - integrating these products into his existing business. He has already taken out two loans to launch his clean energy retail business. After selling out the entire inventory he bought with his last loan, he still has customers calling him with more orders. He is looking to increase his inventory. He is taking out a third loan to help meet the demand in his community for a source of renewable energy that will allow customers to save money while helping the environment.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his clean energy business

loans.name: Jean Adrien

texts.en: Jean Adrien’s business is growing so steadily that he is coming back for another loan to increase his stock. This time he is taking out a new loan to purchase more goods in his grocery store. An environmental agent in his locality, Jean is very interested in selling more products to help minimize the effects of charcoal on the environment by reducing carbon emissions and deforestation.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his clean energy business

loans.name: Irakora I Group

texts.fr:
Viola fait partie du groupe  Irakora   et habite à Gitega. Elle a 58 et est mariée à Patrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 19 à   25 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis 20 ans.
